story:
Ine is a typical, young adult, feathered lizard attending college in Provo, Utah. Despite living in the "Mormon Bubble," as he gets to know his new roommates he learns how unique their individual stories are.  Because fur, scales, fins, or feathers, everyone has a story.

Aww, Feathers! is a family friendly, anthropomorphic, slice-of-life webcomic that I began in May, 2014.  Now I'm excited for the chance to release the first year of comic pages in print form!  I've already got a proof made, and it looks awesome!  All it needs now is your support.


Funding Goals

Since this is my first rodeo, I've kept the initial funding goal small.  Luckily, the print service I'm using (Ka-blam) will print as many or as few copies as I need, so even if we don't reach that goal, I'll still be able to send a copy to all the backers who paid for one.  However, if we do reach our funding goal or any of the stretch goals, there are a few extras that can be added as well!

REACHED!  $500 - Dil's Prank

That's right!  Dil's got an embarrassing photo of Ine (currently in a safe place where Ine will never find it!)  and if this initial funding goal is reached, he'll paste it in the back of each copy of the book!  (Don't worry, it's nothing inappropriate.  All in good fun!)

REACHED!  $600 - Backers Q&A Page

For this first stretch goal, all backers will get the chance to submit their questions to the characters in the comic, who will pick and answer them on an exclusive Backers Q&A Page that will be added to the book!  This will be similar to the recent character Q&A pages on the website (like this one) but we'll arrange them so more can fit on the page.

$750 - 1 Page Bonus Story

At this funding level, an extra story will be added to the book!  In addition, all backers will get the opportunity to vote on which character this bonus story will focus on.  Want to see more of a main character like Ine, Dil, June, or Mally?  Or maybe you'd like to learn more about one of the secondary characters, like Bishop Reyes or Ine's brother, Mark?  Or even a sneak peek at a new character who's planned for a future chapter but hasn't appeared in the webcomic yet!  Whoever the backers choose, an exclusive one page story about them will be added to the book.  Want more than one page?  Well...

$1,000 - 3 Page Bonus Story

...at this next level the bonus story that was unlocked will be expanded to three pages!  Still not enough?  Hmm...

$1,500 - 5 Page Bonus Story

Then how about five pages!  The character chosen by the backers will get an entire chapter of new material!  Phew... that's going to be about as much as I can handle before sending the final version of the book off to be printed.  But what if we surpass even this lofty goal?

$3,000 - Holiday Bonus

Now we're getting real ambitious!  If we reach this stretch goal, then during the month of December 2015, the webcomic will update twice a week instead of just once!  And I don't mean one main page and one teensy bonus comic.  I mean two full pages of the main story!

$5,000 - Extended Holiday!

Hey, you gotta dream big, am I right?  A month of double updates is great, but what about two months!!  If this level is reached, the webcomic will update twice a week during December 2015 and January 2016!


Perks

To thank you for supporting Aww, Feathers!, backers will receive the following rewards based on their pledge amount:

$1 - Thank You!

Thank you for your support! All backers who pledge at least $1 will have their name added to the website's Thank You page (if they choose).


$5 - Character Sketch

On a budget?  You can still score some original artwork! Choose a character (either from the comic or your own character), a pose, and a prop or two, and I'll send you a 5"x7" pencil sketch (both the original and a scanned version) styled after the comic.  (See Details section below.)


$15 - Aww, Feathers! Book 1

Get your physical copy of the book! Includes all pages from the first year of the webcomic in full color, as well as any bonus pages unlocked by our stretch goals! Each copy will be signed and numbered by the author and include a complimentary sketch on the inside front cover of an Aww, Feathers! character of your choice.


$20 - Book with Character Sketch

Get a copy of the book and a character sketch!  See the Character Sketch section above for details.


$25 - Book with Custom Icon

Get a copy of the book and a custom digital icon!  Want to see how your face would look in the Aww, Feathers! universe?  I'll create a colored 500x500 pixel icon according to your specifications, similar in style and quality to those pictured here. (See Details section below.)


$30 - Book with Digital Portrait

Get a copy of the book and a custom digital portrait!  Like the Character Sketch Perk, only inked, colored, and shaded digitally.  You'll receive a 5"x7" physical print and a high resolution digital version, similar in style and quality to those on the Aww, Feathers! cast page. (See Details section below.)


$40 - Art Lovers Package

For those who really love collecting art, this package includes the book, the Character Sketch, Custom Icon, and Digital Portrait perks!


 

$50 - Feathered Friends Package

In addition to everything in the Art Lovers Package, your name and portrait will appear on the book's "Feathered Friends" page to show off your stellar support for the comic! The portrait may be a photo or drawing, or even the digital icon you receive from the Art Lover Package.


$75 - Cameo Appearance!

Submit a character of your own creation and he or she will appear as a background character in a future comic page on awwfeaters.com! Your character will appear in one panel of the comic, will be shown from at least the chest up, and will be at least 200 pixels tall, not just some tiny speck in a crowd! Also includes the Feathered Friends Package. (See Details section below.)


$100 - Help Design a Character!

Future chapters of Aww, Feathers! are in need of secondary characters (like a classmate, co-worker, bully, teacher, etc.). These are characters with speaking roles that interact with the main characters. You'll work together with the author to pick his or her species, design, personality, etc. Also includes the Feathered Friends Package. (See Details section below.)


$200 - Help Write a Chapter!

Have an idea for a future chapter of the webcomic? Choose the characters, the plot, and even some of the dialogue. Then, work together with the author to flesh out your idea into a full chapter of up to five pages to appear on awwfeathers.com! Also includes the Feathered Friends Package. (See Details section below.)



The Impact of your Pledge

Aww, Feathers! has been such a fun and even inspiring project for me, and I love hearing other people tell me when it's brought a smile to their face!  My plan is to keep it available online for free for the foreseeable future, and to keep writing more as long as I have material for it.  (And I've still got a bunch of stories I want to tell!) However, your financial support speaks volumes.  By supporting Aww, Feathers!, you show your support for entertainment that is fun, family friendly, and that addresses topics in an honest and approachable way, even sometimes sensitive ones like trials, relationships, and religion.

After paying Indiegogo's fee, payment processing fees, and the cost of printing and shipping the books and other perks, anything leftover will go towards supporting the webcomic, including the cost of hosting, registration, supplies and equipment, etc.


Risks & Challenges

As I said before, this is my first rodeo, both when it comes to publishing a book and running a crowdfunding campaign!  Luckily, I have the advantage of already having a printed proof that looks great and a printer that can print as many copies as I need.  The worst case scenario I'm aware of is the printing and fulfillment of Perks getting pushed back due to unforeseen delays in creating bonus material, shipping, payment processing, etc.  But even in that situation, I see no reason why I couldn't fulfill every order.


Other Ways You Can Help

You may not feel like you can do much, but even the smallest pledges (yes, even just a dollar) make a big difference.  Even so, whether or not you're able to pledge, there are other ways you can support Aww, Feathers!

  • Share this campaign with your friends and family!  Seriously, a personal recommendation is one of the best ways to spread the word.
  • If you haven't already, read the comic at awwfeathers.com!  It updates every Tuesday (including during this campaign).
  • Subscribe to the Aww, Feathers! Newsletter to get weekly updates about the webcomic, this crowdfunding campaign, and other news.
  • Follow Aww, Feathers! on Facebook, twitter, or google+.


Q & A

Q: What's the premise of the comic?
A: Aww, Feathers! is a slice-of-life comic, meaning it shares everyday experiences from the lives of the characters. It features a variety of characters, all based on animals, and follows their life through college and beyond. The tone is meant to be light-hearted and often humorous, but occasionally serious and thought-provoking.
Q: Is this comic family friendly?
A: Yes! While the intended audience is probably teen and up, my goal is for the entire comic series to be safe for anyone to enjoy. It's rated SFW (Safe For Work) or probably about a PG rating.
Q: Is this an LDS comic?
A: Not exclusively. I am a member of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints (aka "Mormon" or "LDS"), and frequent mention is made of the Church and Mormon culture. Several characters are members of the Church, and it is a very large part of their lives. However, not every story arc deals with LDS or even religious topics, and overall the comic is intended for a general audience. Mormon or not, religious or not, I think everyone can find something they can relate to.
Q: Why animal characters instead of humans?
A: There are a few reasons. I like animals and they're fun to draw. And with a nearly endless variety to choose from, coming up with new and unique characters is also easier and lots of fun. But it's also somewhat of an analogy. Many of the characters are so different in species. Sometimes this causes tension or awkwardness, but often they learn to get along. Shouldn't we be the same?
Q: Are the stories based on real events?
A: Many of them are. In fact, quite a few of the story arcs are based on my own personal experiences. A lot of the details are different however and some of the events are entirely fictional or only loosely based on reality.
Q: What are the dimensions of the printed version?
A: The book measures 7" x 10.5" and is currently 68 pages. Depending on what stretch goals are met however, a few more pages may be added.
Q: Will any of the bonus material ever be posted online?
A: Maybe someday, but if so it won't be until at least a year after the book's release.

Details

All requested artwork, cameo appearances, and ideas for future characters and chapters are subject to my approval.  See additional specifics below.  If there is any question about what would be allowed, feel free to email me at awwfeathers@gmail.com.
  • Icons, Sketches, and Digital Art Perks - All requested artwork must be family friendly  and not include suggestive themes, graphic violence, profanity, drug references, racism, etc.  You maintain the rights to any character(s) belonging to you, but I maintain the right to display and reproduce the resulting artwork, including for commercial or promotional purposes.  Artwork will be completed in the order they are requested after payment has cleared.  Depending on the number of art pieces waiting to be done, you will be given an estimate of when yours will be finished, but please allow (at most) up to one month after the the commission before yours is completed.
  • Cameo Appearance - By choosing this option, you assert that you own the rights to the character making the appearance, and you maintain the rights to that character, but grant me permission to include the page he/she appears in both online and in any future printed versions.  After the initial cameo appearance, your character will not be used in any other way without first obtaining your permission.  In order to fit with the established world of the comic, minor adjustments may need to be made to the character (colors, relative size, or placement of wings or other appendages for example), but I will seek your input before making any such adjustments.
  • Help Design a Character - While you may pick certain aspects of a character's appearance and personality, the resulting character will remain the intellectual property of Aww, Feathers!, meaning he/she may be used online and in print at my discretion.  Therefore, by choosing this option you agree not to attempt to recreate any character belonging to you or someone else.  Character ideas that appear similar to already existing characters may not be accepted.  (If you really want to see your character appear in the comic, consider the Cameo Appearance option.)
  • Help Write a Chapter - As always, all story ideas must be family friendly.  In addition, to maintain the integrity of the story so far as well as future plans for the story, certain ideas may not be accepted.  These may include, but are not limited to, major changes in a character's personality, interests, relationships, or general role in the story.  However, if for any reason an idea is not suitable, I'll communicate with you about what can be changed until we have an idea that works.

story:
Welcome to our IndieGoGo crowdfunding campaign on behalf of Jack Katz ~ creator, author and artist residing in the San Francisco Bay Area, California.  This is a grassroots support endeavor initiated by our Team of twelve people, who are described in the lower section of this page.  Every member of our Team is a long-time friend and/or art student of Jack’s; do browse the testimonials below to better understand the impact on our lives that knowing Jack has given each of us and why we are so committed to his well-being.  We consider Jack to be a “living art treasure” of the United States, a “Silver Age” Artist who merits support at age 87 at this time in his dedicated career (he began producing professional illustrations in the comic industry at age 16.)   People worldwide honor Jack for paving the way for other artists to produce independent works and graphic novels.   Your support as a patron of the arts will enable Jack to produce the first part of his new 800 page graphic novel, “Beyond the Beyond,” and to have the means to create this project during the time of transition while he is waiting for royalties to be received from his first thousand-page graphic novel, “The First Kingdom.”  Our Team thanks you for visiting this site; it will acquaint you with the complexity and creative genius, the passion and compassion, of Jack Katz.  We trust you will enjoy a thank you gift in return for your support.  Please contribute through this IndieGoGo site, and share this campaign.  Thank you so much.                                   ~ Beyond the Beyond Team

                                

The Story of Jack Katz

Imagine turning 87 years old and your ship is finally coming in!  Well, in creating what has been described as the world’s first graphic novel,  “The First Kingdom” – which took me fifteen years with over 1,070 fully illustrated pages plus covers, and now published in its entirety – my first big ocean liner has finally come to port.   But it takes time for the royalties to roll in.   And here I am, without the means to create my next magnum opus, a new graphic novel called “Beyond the Beyond.”  It’s been 40 years since the start of my graphic novel journey – and now I’m asking for your help and support so that I can have the means to create and complete the first half of the Introduction of “Beyond the Beyond," which will be the first 65 fully illustrated pages of this new project.  The good news is that my new ship has left port and set sail – I have begun the project already and will explain more about it below.   

I have a wonderful Team who want to help me produce this project, so they offered to help organize this IndieGoGo.com site and reach out.  We have thought up some nice thank you’s for your kind contributions and the Team will make sure that they reach you.  We sincerely appreciate you spreading the word among people you think might like to view my story on this site.

So how long is this new Project going to take?

I’ve already written the entire outline for “Beyond the Beyond” and started to draw it.  I don’t work like anyone else I know.  I do one page at a time, in narrative sequence.  I write it, pencil it and ink it all myself.  Rarely do I use any reference in drawing, these visuals just go straight from my mind to the paper.  It takes one to three days to produce a completed page.  Originally “Beyond the Beyond” was going to be over 1,700 pages.  I sat down with my exceptional literary agent, Peter Beren, to share my idea.  He said, “You’re 87 years old.  Do the math.  If we can do the math, so can the publishers.  This will take too many years.”  

So now my goal is to telescope this graphic novel into 800 fully illustrated pages; and I assure you, it is achievable and my agent believes in the project.  The illustrations are not as elaborate as you saw in “The First Kingdom.”  This new style I’m working in is more refined and more story driven.  I have completed 34 pages so far and I’m able to keep up the pace and achieve a very consistent style of graphical story telling.   Yet it’s some of the best drawing I’ve ever done;  here are several of the early pages, minus some of the text at the page top.

                                                  


                     

A Bit of Background ~
Graphic Novels and Space Operas

Some of you may know me from “The First Kingdom."   It was the first independently produced graphic novel, published by Bud Plant, who began publishing it in 1974 as I was producing it.  But only now is it reaching a world-wide audience because Titan Publishing, in the UK, has recently published six hardcover volumes, including two never-before-released installments, “The Space Explorer’s Club” and “Destiny.”   Below are several of the pages so that you can see the scope of this work.                

     

        

I’ve been credited with contributing to the “graphic novel” and “space opera” genres.  I consider graphic novels to be fully illustrated books for adults, a means of mature expression just like movies, novels or music.  Space opera is a subgenre of science fiction that often emphasizes romantic adventure, set mainly or entirely in outer space.  Below is a very short video which conveys a glimpse of these concepts through visuals and music arranged by Titan Publishing. 


The color images below were from covers on the first soft cover editions of the first 24 chapters. (See my Facebook page "TheFirstKingdom Jack Katz" to view an album of more interior pages; and also all 48 color front and back covers, as well as credits to the colorists for each set.)     

            

I was certainly influenced since age five by artists like Hal Foster (Tarzan and Prince Valiant) and Alex Raymond (Flash Gordon).  I knew them.  In fact, at age 13, I went to the Society of Illustrators where Alex Raymond lectured.  At age 19, I met Hal Foster while I was working at King Features.  I mentioned my ideas for “The First Kingdom” and I asked them if it was possible to use this new medium of expression to convey my story.  They essentially said, “Well, nobody has done it before, but go ahead with my blessing.”  So in 1973, I took the idea for my graphic novel, “The First Kingdom,”  which was fully formed in my mind since I was 12 years old, and I started transferring it from my mind to paper. 

                                 

Some of you may also know me from my career as a professional artist in the comics industry, from my paintings, or from taking an art class with me.  If you want to know me better, at the bottom of this page is a website link, www.jackatz.com, for details about my life and background;  information about “The First Kingdom,” such as various reviews and articles and how to find the books  (you may want to also visit www.thefirstkingdom.com);  images of my 200+ paintings;  and listings of most of my prior works in the comics industry since my start in the Silver Age.  The Gallery button (top menu) includes some visuals of several Rewards items and other photos.  

No retirement fund for this Silver Age Artist…

                        

Well, let me give you just a brief glimpse into my career as an artist; my professional career began at age 15.  When I worked for companies like Atlas, Timely, Standard, DC, Marvel, King Features, etc. it was a factory.  It was all “work for hire.”  There were people literally passing out at their drawing boards trying to meet their deadlines.  When that happened, we helped each other.  I did a lot of “ghosting” (some with pseudonyms) on everything from “Archie” to “Popeye,” horror stories, you name it.  And if one of the artists had a family crisis or something, I helped them.  We all did that.  We had to.  We weren’t making huge money.  We weren’t employees, we didn’t get paid for overtime or get any benefits such as health or retirement…or anything, except pay for hours worked.   The companies owned all the artwork that was created, too.   That’s just the way it was.  You made your deadlines and you got to keep working.  You were just glad to be working.  To give you an idea, below are images of a story I drew in the 50's; and an original Bulletman drawing.  You'll find these in the Rewards section of this site.                         

    

One day, I was asked to draw a scene where the villain was beating up some teenagers and I just put down my pencil and said, “That’s it, I’m not doing this any more.”  That was one of the pivotal moments in my career -- I just couldn’t do one more page of this type of violence.

Now I had had this idea since age 12 that I could do “The First Kingdom,” as a preamble to "Beyond the Beyond" on my own and somehow get it published.  It has an interweaving story of adventure, romance, and science fiction interspersed with philosophy – it does depict battles, but there is no graphic violence.   That was my vision, to focus on the message and content for adults and to avoid mindless violence; to evolve comics to a whole new concept.  And with the support of my wife Caroline, I was able to spend the next thirteen years creating the first 24 chapters (completed in 1986).   Then much later, I spent another two years completing the final chapters which are the last two volumes of the hard cover books. 

Needless to say, those were lean years while I was creating “The First Kingdom."  In all those years working for mainstream comics, followed by independent alternative publishing, and later painting, there was no way to establish a retirement fund.   This has been a 40-year sojourn since beginning "The First Kingdom" in 1974, finally to arrive at this place in time where the entire work has been published recently in six quality hardcover volumes by Titan.    I want to thank my agent, Peter Beren, and Titan Publisher Nick Landau and his talented staff, for having faith in "The First Kingdom;" and for their commitment to exceptional quality in reproduction and printing.  I feel proud of their presentation of my efforts and trust that as people learn of my graphic novel, eventually royalties will sustain me.  Also I want to take a minute here to thank again the people along the way who supported my vision in diverse ways, who are too many to acknowledge in this brief space.  

How is the money going to be spent?

Now at 87, I really don’t have any savings to fall back on.   As mentioned earlier, we believe the royalties from sales will roll in eventually.   But it will take some time and right now, I need your help to be able to do the work for “Beyond the Beyond."   I have some income for basics from teaching Figure Drawing once weekly for the local community and also a little Social Security.  But to do the work for “Beyond the Beyond,” I need to dedicate myself to sitting behind my drawing board 14+ hours on most days and have what I need to write and draw this project.  There are necessities such as space rental, supplies such as Bristol board and ink pens, and other logistics for getting this project ready to go to print.  

           

The campaign target goal would keep me going for at least three months.  Should the blessing of exceeding our funding goal occur, any extra funds will be used to keep the project going beyond this initial three months of support.  Our "Beyond The Beyond" Team will keep you informed of my progress along the way through this site (see “Updates” tab at top of this page).

Many thanks for taking the time to read my story.   I am blessed with excellent health and vitality, so can assure you of my commitment to a long life which involves producing this work with the very best quality of art and creative spirit that is within me.  I will truly appreciate any and every donation for this project.  I’m happy to thank you with gifts as mentioned on this site, and will allow time to produce sketches or sign & date the gifts as indicated.  All proceeds will be used to enable me to work on this beginning phase of “Beyond the Beyond,”  and also, our budget includes fees and rewards expenses related to this outreach endeavor. Thank you for your support, it means so much to me.

                    Team members Celebrate  
(L to R): Brian Miller, Jack Katz, Bob Gill, Peter Beren, Caroline Gold


               

                 Team Adventure to UC Berkeley in April 2014
(L to R): Brian Miller, Jack Katz, Thérèse Pouliot, Harvey Myman, Peter Beren

What our Beyond The Beyond Team has to say about Jack:

(Note: please click on the photo buttons below to learn more about our Team members' experiences knowing Jack; and to view their personal profile links.)

“I have been on a long and dedicated journey by his side ~ holding the vision of Jack Katz, an extraordinarily creative genius who was ahead of his time.  It is wonderful to see that his time has arrived and that graphic novels have assumed their rightful place in literature.  Our society needs to do more for its artists to enable them to have the means to actualize their gifts.  Thank you for your support of Jack.”  
  ~  Caroline Gold, Team Coordinator

"I am thrilled to be working with Jack Katz, who should be regarded as a national treasure. He is one of the most creative individuals I have ever known and filled with energy ––more energy than most people half his age."   
  ~  Peter Beren, Literary Agent and Publishing Consultant

"I am truly honored to be involved in this project.  Jack Katz is an artist of immense vision and a pioneering figure in the world of comics.  "The First Kingdom" paved the way for other artists to express their own visions through independent publishing and outside of the mainstream.  Jack showed the way for generations of comics creators."
  ~ Andrew Kunka, Professor of English at U. of South Carolina Sumter
        and Comics Scholar

“There really is no way to categorize Jack Katz, or put him into a single box: he is a true original.  His art speaks for itself; the stark and powerful images are unlike any other.  And what truly places Katz in his own category is his unrelenting determination to push the graphic novel into new terrain.  His storytelling is defined by a psychological and philosophical depth that exists nowhere else.  Though steeped in the classics of literature and art, his work in "The First Kingdom" is all its own.  One can only marvel, and eagerly await, what will come next, for Katz, who at age 87,  only seems to be getting started.”
 ~ Harvey Myman, Entertainment & Media Consultant, Partner at Element 8                     Entertainment, Adjunct Professor of Chapman U. College of Film & Media Arts

"I've never been more proud of my Dad and his unwavering tenacity, nor has my heart ever felt so much warmth flowing towards him from so many wonderful human beings and arenas.  Certainly, being recognized, after a lifetime of single-minded perseverance, sharing his unique thoughts and insights through his indomitable art, is long overdue. I feel deeply privileged to be able to share these precious moments, so filled with hope and promise.  I'm also brimming with curiosity and anticipation for "Beyond the Beyond!"
  ~  Milena (Beth) Katz , Jack's Daughter, Teacher, Editor, Creative Consultant

"Fifty years ago I began high school after a couple of summers in the youth program of the California College of Arts and Craft and never did return.  Ten years ago I found Jack's class in the Albany Adult School and learned I would never need to go back to the 'academy'. I took in more from Jack in that decade than I would ever get in a life time in a classroom, as it was his patience and thoughtful personal teaching that gave me all I would need to know to continue to paint and draw."
   ~  Bob Gill, Logistics, Database &Technical Consultant,  
          Rewards Gifts Coordinator             

"Jack Katz never stops growing as an artist.  Now in his ninth decade, he is more inspiring and creatively productive than ever.   Jack is a fine artist who spent his sixties and seventies creating a body of oil-on-canvas paintings that are among the most intriguing and fully accessible of any figurative artist working in the late 20th century.  From my viewpoint as a student, the time he has spent teaching art spurred him in later life to more ambitious heights of self-expression."
   ~ Susan Gee Rumsey, Business & Editorial Adviser, Artist, Writer, Musician and            Actress

"I started studying figure drawing with Jack Katz in 1997 and have been a student of his ever since.  He’s also become a friend and mentor.  Jack calls himself an art coach, rather than a teacher, since his students all come to him from different levels of experience, ability and goals.  Jack has a unique ability to tap into this and coach each student as an individual.  If you put Jack Katz in front of a piece of Bristol Board or a blank canvas, you may notice that he starts to fill it in as a fully formed work, already envisioned in its entirety in his head.  And of course he can write, pencil and ink his own work in one fell swoop.  At 87, Jack Katz is at the top of his game.  As Jack will tell you, an entire lifetime was spent to get to this point.  And yet, each time Jack puts pencil to paper or brush to canvas, he asks himself if he still has it.  And each stroke is an affirmation, saying yes, he does.”
  ~ Brian Miller, Logistics & Technical Consultant, Photographer, Videographer

"Jack is the reason I speak to you today.  He uncovered my desire to paint, which sat dormant until he noticed my cries for art.  He has the ability to see through you. My first teacher of art, he told me to pick up my brush and start painting.  Jack's passion for creating is endless, it's exhausting, and yet I strive for it.  He comes from the "old master" mold, he should be cloned. His intense look is overpowering, his vision is translated to canvas, to paper, to writing and on to you..."
  ~ Thérèse Pouliot, Fine Artist, Marketing & Media Consultant,    
        Project Development, Visioning      

"The road to visionary exploration hasn’t been easy for Jack Katz.  It's cost him much in his life because he didn't play it safe.  If he had, those visions would have stayed housed in his imagination: unrealized, unexplored, unknown, and forever lost to the world.  Risk takers who bare their soul to all may lose the materiality of life, but they gain the rising and advancement of spirit that nourishes the inner being of mankind."
   ~ Jim Amash, Comic Book Artist, Alter Ego Magazine Associate
     Editor,  Comics Historian

"I first met Jack through my relationship with Jack's agent, Peter. I had been working for Peter for several months when he said, today we're going to meet a client.  Everything changed from there.  Jack isn't just an ambassador for visual arts, he's an ambassador for the written word.  His lexicon is beyond anyone I know, and he's taken it as a personal mission to make sure I have all the books in a personal library that I would ever need to facilitate my creative writing.  In short, Jack wants all those with creative drive to strive for their unlimited potential.  He becomes invested like no other.  I've been very lucky to know Jack as a friend and a creativity sponsor.  He's as passionate for your creations as he is for his own work. In that way, Jack is truly remarkable and couldn't be a more worthy recipient of your support."
  ~ Matt Sobin, Editorial, Social Media, and Digital Media Consultant

  ~ Darren Kessler,  Attorney-at-Law, Artist, Jack’s Long-time Student & Supporter

Welcome to our IndieGoGo crowdfunding campaign on behalf of Jack Katz ~ creator, author and artist residing in the San Francisco Bay Area, California.  This is a grassroots support endeavor initiated by our Team of twelve people, who are described in the lower section of this page.  Every member of our Team is a long-time friend and/or art student of Jack’s; do browse the testimonials below to better understand the impact on our lives that knowing Jack has given each of us and why we are so committed to his well-being.  We consider Jack to be a “living art treasure” of the United States, a “Silver Age” Artist who merits support at age 87 at this time in his dedicated career (he began producing professional illustrations in the comic industry at age 16.)   People worldwide honor Jack for paving the way for other artists to produce independent works and graphic novels.   Your support as a patron of the arts will enable Jack to produce the first part of his new 800 page graphic novel, “Beyond the Beyond,” and to have the means to create this project during the time of transition while he is waiting for royalties to be received from his first thousand-page graphic novel, “The First Kingdom.”  Our Team thanks you for visiting this site; it will acquaint you with the complexity and creative genius, the passion and compassion, of Jack Katz.  We trust you will enjoy a thank you gift in return for your support.  Please contribute through this IndieGoGo site, and share this campaign.  Thank you so much.                                   ~ Beyond the Beyond Team                                The Story of Jack Katz

Imagine
turning 87 years old and your ship is finally coming in!  Well, in creating what has been described as the
world’s first graphic novel,  “The First
Kingdom” – which took me fifteen years with over 1,070 fully illustrated pages plus
covers, and now published in its entirety – my first big ocean liner has finally
come to port.   But it
takes time for the royalties to roll in. 
 And here I am, without the means
to create my next magnum opus, a new graphic novel called “Beyond the Beyond.”  It’s
been 40 years since the start of my graphic novel journey – and now I’m asking
for your help and support so that I can have the means to create and complete the first half of the Introduction of “Beyond the Beyond," which will be the first 65 fully
illustrated pages of this new project.  The
good news is that my new ship has left port and set sail – I have begun the
project already and will explain more about it below.   
I
have a wonderful Team who want to help me produce this project, so they offered
to help organize this IndieGoGo.com site and reach out.  We have thought up
some nice thank you’s for your kind contributions and the Team will make sure
that they reach you.  We sincerely
appreciate you spreading the word among people you think might like to view my
story on this site.So how long is this new Project going to take?
I’ve already written the entire outline for “Beyond the Beyond” and started to draw it.  I don’t work like anyone else I know.  I do one page at a time, in narrative
sequence.  I write it, pencil it and ink
it all myself.  Rarely do I use any
reference in drawing, these visuals just go straight from my mind to the
paper.  It takes one to three days to
produce a completed page.  Originally “Beyond the Beyond” was going to be over
1,700 pages.  I sat down with my exceptional literary agent, Peter Beren, to share my idea. 
He said, “You’re 87 years old.  Do
the math.  If we can do the math, so can
the publishers.  This will take too many
years.”  So now my goal is to telescope
this graphic novel into 800 fully illustrated pages; and I assure you, it is achievable and my
agent believes in the project.  The
illustrations are not as elaborate as you saw in “The First
 Kingdom.”  This new style I’m working in is more refined
and more story driven.  I have completed
34 pages so far and I’m able to keep up the pace and achieve a very consistent
style of graphical story telling.   Yet it’s some of the best drawing I’ve ever
done;  here are several of the early pages, minus some of the text at the page top.                                                                       
A Bit of Background ~
Graphic Novels and Space Operas
Some
of you may know me from “The First Kingdom."   It was the first independently produced
graphic novel, published by Bud Plant, who began publishing it in 1974 as I was
producing it.  But only now is it
reaching a world-wide audience because Titan Publishing, in the UK, has
recently published six hardcover volumes, including two never-before-released
installments, “The Space Explorer’s Club”
and “Destiny.”   Below are several of the pages so that you can
see the scope of this work.                             
I’ve been credited with contributing to the “graphic novel” and “space
opera” genres.  I consider graphic novels
to be fully illustrated books for adults, a means of mature expression just
like movies, novels or music.  Space
opera is a subgenre of science fiction that often emphasizes romantic
adventure, set mainly or entirely in outer space.  Below is a very short video which conveys a glimpse of these concepts through visuals and music arranged by Titan Publishing. The color images below were from covers on the first soft cover editions of the first 24 chapters. (See my Facebook page "TheFirstKingdom Jack Katz" to view an album of more interior pages; and also all 48 color front and back covers, as well as credits to the colorists for each set.)                 I was certainly influenced since
age five by artists like Hal Foster (Tarzan
and Prince Valiant) and Alex
Raymond (Flash Gordon).  I
knew them.  In fact, at age 13, I went to the Society of Illustrators
where Alex Raymond lectured.  At age 19, I met Hal Foster while I was
working at King Features.  I mentioned my ideas for “The First Kingdom” and I asked them if it was possible to
use this new medium of expression to convey my story.  They essentially
said, “Well, nobody has done it before, but go ahead with my blessing.”
 So in 1973, I took the idea for my graphic novel, “The First Kingdom,”  which was fully formed in my mind
since I was 12 years old, and I started transferring it from my mind to
paper.                                  Some of you may also know me from my career as a
professional artist in the comics industry, from my paintings, or from taking
an art class with me.  If you want to know me better, at the bottom of
this page is a website link, www.jackatz.com, for details about my life and background;
 information about “The First Kingdom,” such as various reviews and
articles and how to find the books  (you may want to also visit www.thefirstkingdom.com);  images of my 200+ paintings;
 and listings of most of my prior works in the comics industry since my
start in the Silver Age.  The Gallery button (top menu) includes some
visuals of several Rewards items and other photos.  
No retirement fund for this Silver
Age Artist…                        Well, let me give you just a brief glimpse into my career as an artist;
my professional career began at age 15.  When
I worked for companies like Atlas, Timely, Standard, DC, Marvel, King Features,
etc. it was a factory.  It was all “work
for hire.”  There were people literally
passing out at their drawing boards trying to meet their deadlines.  When that happened, we helped each other.  I did a lot of “ghosting” (some with
pseudonyms) on everything from “Archie” to “Popeye,” horror stories, you name it.  And if one of the artists had a family crisis
or something, I helped them.  We all did
that.  We had to.  We weren’t making huge money.  We weren’t employees, we didn’t get paid for
overtime or get any benefits such as health or retirement…or anything, except
pay for hours worked.   The
companies owned all the artwork that was created, too.   That’s
just the way it was.  You made your
deadlines and you got to keep working.  You
were just glad to be working.  To give you an idea, below are images of a story I drew in the 50's; and an original Bulletman drawing.  You'll find these in the Rewards section of this site.                             
One day, I was asked to draw a scene where the villain was beating up some
teenagers and I just put down my pencil and said, “That’s it, I’m not doing
this any more.”  That was one of the
pivotal moments in my career -- I just couldn’t do one more page of this type
of violence.
Now I had had this idea since age 12 that I could do “The First Kingdom,” as a preamble to "Beyond the Beyond" on my own and somehow get it published.  It has an interweaving story of adventure, romance,
and science fiction interspersed with philosophy – it does depict battles, but there
is no graphic violence.   That was
my vision, to focus on the message and content for adults and to avoid mindless
violence; to evolve comics to a whole new concept.  And with the support of my wife Caroline, I
was able to spend the next thirteen years creating the first 24 chapters
(completed in 1986).   Then much later, I spent another two years
completing the final chapters which are the last two volumes of the hard cover
books.  

Needless to say, those were lean years while I was creating “The First Kingdom."  In all those years working for mainstream comics, followed by independent alternative publishing, and later painting, there was no way to establish a retirement fund.   This has been a 40-year sojourn since beginning "The First Kingdom" in 1974, finally to arrive at this place in time where the entire work has been published recently in six quality hardcover volumes by Titan.    I want to thank my agent, Peter Beren, and Titan Publisher Nick Landau and his talented staff, for having faith in "The First Kingdom;" and for their commitment to exceptional quality in reproduction and printing.  I feel proud of their presentation of my efforts and trust that as people learn of my graphic novel, eventually royalties will sustain me.  Also I want to take a minute here to thank again the people along the way who supported my vision in diverse ways, who are too many to acknowledge in this brief space.  How is the money going to be spent?
Now at 87, I really don’t have any savings to fall back on.   As mentioned earlier, we believe the royalties
from sales will roll in eventually.   But it will take some time and right now, I
need your help to be able to do the work for “Beyond the Beyond."   I have some income for basics from teaching
Figure Drawing once weekly for the local community and also a little Social
Security.  But to do the work for “Beyond the Beyond,” I need to dedicate
myself to sitting behind my drawing board 14+ hours on most days and have what
I need to write and draw this project.  There are necessities such as space rental, supplies such as Bristol board and
ink pens, and other logistics for getting this project ready to go to print.              The campaign target goal would keep me going for at least three months.  Should the blessing of exceeding our funding goal occur, any extra funds will be used to keep the project going beyond this initial three months of support.  Our "Beyond The Beyond" Team will keep you informed of my progress along the way through this site (see “Updates” tab at top of this page).Many thanks for taking the time to read my story.   I am blessed with excellent health and vitality, so can assure you of my commitment to a long life which involves producing this work with the very best quality of art and creative spirit that is within me.  I will truly appreciate any and every donation for this project.  I’m happy to thank you with gifts as mentioned on this site, and will allow time to produce sketches or sign & date the gifts as indicated.  All proceeds will be used to enable me to work on this beginning phase of “Beyond the Beyond,”  and also, our budget includes fees and rewards expenses related to this outreach endeavor. Thank you for your support, it means so much to me.

comes from the "old master" mold, he should be cloned. His intense
look is overpowering, his vision is translated to canvas, to paper, to writing
and on to you..."  ~ Thérèse Pouliot, Fine Artist, Marketing & Media Consultant,            Project Development, Visioning      "The road to visionary exploration hasn’t been easy for Jack Katz.  It's cost him much in his life because he didn't play it safe.  If he had, those visions would have stayed housed in his imagination: unrealized, unexplored, unknown, and forever lost to the world.  Risk takers who bare their soul to all may lose the materiality of life, but they gain the rising and advancement of spirit that nourishes the inner being of mankind."   ~ Jim Amash, Comic Book Artist, Alter Ego Magazine Associate     Editor,  Comics Historian"I first met Jack through my relationship with Jack's agent, Peter. I had
 been working for Peter for several months when he said, today we're 
going to meet a client.  Everything changed from there.  Jack isn't just 
an ambassador for visual arts, he's an ambassador for the written word.  His lexicon is beyond anyone I know, and he's taken it as a personal 
mission to make sure I have all the books in a personal library that I 
would ever need to facilitate my creative writing.  In short, Jack wants 
all those with creative drive to strive for their unlimited potential.  He becomes invested like no other.  I've been very lucky to know Jack as a friend and a creativity sponsor.  He's as passionate for your creations as he is for his own work. In 
that way, Jack is truly remarkable and couldn't be a more worthy 
recipient of your support."   ~ Matt Sobin, 
        Editorial, Social Media, and Digital Media Consultant  ~ Darren Kessler,  Attorney-at-Law, Artist, Jack’s Long-time Student & Supporter

story:
8500€ STRETCH GOAL - BOOKMARK!!

The 8000€ stretch goal has been reached!!! Thanks to all of you!!! As promised, an Aminoacid Boy sticker will be send along with every physical copy of the book!!!! You will like it, I'm sure :-))

The new stretch goal is very ambitious, considered that little time is left to the campaign: if we reach 8500€, every book will contain a veeeery nice bookmark!!!

Less than 3 days are left now... Hang in there!!! Don't stop spreading the word!!!!!!!!!!! Gooooo!!!!!


NEW AMINO BIG ILLUSTRATION  (200€) perk now available! 

During the last week I've been working on the inside back cover of the book. It is now available as a new perk:


Remember that NEW FULL PAGE ILLUSTRATION PERK (150€) is still available:


Short summary

I’m Diego Lazzarin. Since 2005, I’ve been working in animation, illustration and filmmaking. I realized short animation movies that have been screened and awarded by national and international festivals. I also worked in music videos. If you are interested in my works, you can have a look at my website: www.diegolazzarin.com.

Aminoacid Boy and the Chaos Order is a graphic novel I started more than three years ago. The book is made up of more than 500 hand painted panels. The story develops throughout 7 chapters. An additional section contains full-page illustrations (the Chaos Order chapter). Aminoacid Boy and the Chaos Order is 100% done… now that the graphic novel is ready, it's time to start crowdfunding!

The purpose of this campaign is to raise enough money for a quality print run of the book. So if the goal is met this is basically a preorder event for the book. The campaign is fixed funding so, if the goal isn't reached, all the money you paid will be automatically refunded to you. Your contributions will help me to materialize three years of hard work!


The story

Aminoacid Boy is a creature from outer space sent on Earth from his Lord, a bio-architectural-metal-meat-machine living in a dark cave. He generates the whole things in a chaotic way. Physical and mechanical laws drive the transformations in his universe where equilibrium and chaotic states alternate without any final aim.

The Lord discovers that on planet Earth there are species whose individuals can find their own reasons for living, they have desires and will. They are able to feel pain and self-accomplishment. To Lord's eyes this is something extraordinary and illogical. Amino is sent on Earth to understand the reason of this anomalous behavior.

To accomplish his mission, Amino has the power to assimilate the DNA from human and animal species he gets in contact with. His DNA evolves and becomes more and more similar to the one of those creatures. This way Amino should understand them better.

Unfortunately, Amino is not going to be alone on Earth. The Chaos Order will soon reach him. I won't say what's happening next!!!

If you stumbled upon this campaign without knowing about the graphic novel beforehand, you can look at my blog posts at aminoacidboy.tumblr.com. I've been posting there my work in progress for more than one year.


The book and other perks

I've already contacted a quality printer, which is the same chosen by my favorite comic book editors in Italy. We've already agreed on the budget to get a high quality product. The book will be a full color, 17x24 cm (6.7x9.5 inches), 156 pages print on Arcoset EW 140 grams paper, sewn binding. The cover will be printed on Arcoset EW 300 grams paper and will have inside flaps.

The book will be in English. Since I'm not proficient in English, a qualified person will revise the final version of the book.

Every backer will be very much thanked and named in the acknowledgement page of the book. For contributions equal or greater than 5€, you will receive the digital version of the graphic novel (besides other perks, as you requested). 

You also have a good choise of perks:

- Set of 5 Pinback Buttons 25mm with illustrations of Aminoacid Boy and the Chaos Order characters. 25mm (1 inch) badges are the traditional badge size and come with a D-Pin or metal safety pin fastener.

- Temporary tattoos with illustrations of Aminoacid Boy and the Chaos Order characters. You will receive a A5 sheet with 16 tattoos. They normally last 2 to 4 days. They are non-toxic, safe on the skin, and can be easily removed.

- Original drawings in various sizes - They are made in acrylics and inks on 50% cotton paper. You will be able to choose among 74 drawings of various sizes. You can choose your artwork HERE.


June 15th -  Update

NEW DOUBLE PAGE ILLUSTRATION PERK (200€)! SOLD!

May, 25th - Update 

New double page illustration now available! SOLD!

Since the double page illustrations are sold out, during the last week I've been working on a new one. It's now available as a new perk!!!



Summary of rewards

PLEASE NOTE: Some perks have additional shipping costs. Read carefully the description in the perk boxes!


New Goal 7500€ - EXTRA REWARDS!

I still cannot believe that the campaign is going over Its funding goal!!! It's now time to think about some extra rewards! I've already promised you 4 extra pages in the chaos order chapter but I want to go further... As additional perk If the campaign reach the 7500€ goal, I will translate the book in spanish and french! The PDF of the book will thus be available in 4 languages: italian, english, spanish and french.

I hope this will be a good reason to keep on contributing and spreading the word!!!! Don't stop now!! :-)

FR: Si la campagne atteint les 7500€, je vais traduire le livre en espagnol et en français ! Le format PDF du livre sera donc disponible en 4 langues : italien, anglais, espagnol et français.

ES: Si en este crowfounding logramos alcanzar la meta de 7500€… ¡podré traducir el libro a Español y Francés!


Budget and additional perks

I'm hoping to raise €6.500 to cover the cost of printing (€4.000) and the various fees (Indiegogo, PayPal/bank fees which total approximately 10%). What's left is going to cover the shipping costs, which are insane... 

The money won't cover any personal costs for making Aminoacid Boy and the Chaos Order. I'm not trying to make a profit or be paid for my job: I just want to get my book printed.

If this campaign goes over its funding goal? I will be easily able to cover your extra demand of books. This way, the unitary cost of each book will decrease and I will be able to add some additional rewards: bonus pages, translation in other languages (for the digital book), cooler rewards for those who already backed… I'll update you in case the campaign will get off to a good start. I really hope so!!!


Timing

On the 17th June the Indiegogo Campaign ends, and then?

By the beginning of July, I should receive the funds from Indiegogo. Then, I will immediately send the printing files of Aminoacid Boy and the Chaos of Order to the printer. As soon as I receive the books from the printer, I'll start shipping them.

I can prudentially predict that you will receive the book by August. I'll constantly keep you update on the timing, after the campaign ends.

I will commit myself to monitor the printing and shipping process. I will do my best to avoid delays or solve any issue that may arise.


The impact

By contributing to this project you will receive an incredible graphic novel with a unique style, very close to painting.

This campaign is crucial to finalize the job I've been working on for more than three years.  Having the book in my hands will be the completion of this creative process. Knowing that many of you will have the book and hopefully love it, will be a great motivation to keep on working and put new efforts in my creative search. I have many ideas floating around my head...


Other ways you can help

Even if you cannot contribute directly, you can still help! Please tweet, re-link, or share this campaign on Facebook. Use the Indiegogo sharing tools to help the campaign spread the word! 


Prize package for most referrals

Indiegogo tracks the number of referrals back to the campaign page. If the campaign is successful, I will contact the backer with the most successful referrals and send him/her an original drawing as a token of my appreciation! 



FAQs

How does Indiegogo work?

If you're not familiar with Indiegogo or crowdfunding in general, here's a brief overview. 

Until 17th of June, you'll be able to make pledges to help support this project, ranging from €1 to whatever you can afford without going broke or having to divorce. You can select one of the perks on the right, corresponding to the amount you wish to donate. This means you're not only being awesome: you are also receiving stuff as proof of that! 

If the final deadline comes and we've reached our goal, I will receive the funds from Indiegogo and I start printing and mailing books and other goodies. But if for some reason we don't meet our goal, you will be refunded by Indiegogo. 


I don't have a PayPal account, can I contribute to your campaign?

If you have a debit or credit card you can contribute to the campaign, even without a PayPal account. Follow the steps to payment on Indiegogo website and click on "GO TO PAYPAL". Don’t worry if you don't have a PayPal account! You'll land on the payment page and there you can choose your own way to pay: PayPal or directly with credit or debit card.


I want to receive an original illustration, can I choose the one I want?

You will be able to choose among many illustrations in various sizes. If you want to select your artwork or you're just curious you can have a look HERE.

Once you choose the original piece you want to receive, send an email to aminoacidboy@gmail.com with the ID number as indicated in the link above.

Priority in the choice will be given according to the time of request. Please notice that I will only consider requests from those who already contributed to the campaign.

After I receive your request and verify your contribution, I'll send you a confirmation email. For any doubt or question fell free to contact me at aminoacidboy@gmail.com.


When will I receive the .pdf of the book?

I will make the .pdf download of the book immediately available, as soon as I receive the funds from Indiegogo. This should be approximately 15 working days after the campaign ends.

Please note that everyone who contribute with an amount equal or greater than 5€ will be able to download the .pdf in italian and/or english.


In what language will Aminoacid Boy and the Chaos Order be printed? 

The printed version of the book is going to be in english. The digital book will be available in italian and/or english. 


Is this book appropriate for children? You seem like a good guy, why the book is so full of violence???

When I started to draw Aminoacid Boy and the Chaos Order, my idea was to create a book for "adult children" :-)

I think the whole story has been created as a pretext for drawing a lot of fictional violence. At a certain point in my life I felt the need to reflect on why I have fun in representing scenes of weird violence... even if I truly deprecate violence in real life. Despite this... there are no bad words in the book, I promise! :-)


For any other query, please contact me at aminoacidboy@gmail.com

story:
UPDATE! 

Our stretch goal of $35,000 was met, so we are introducing the DIGITAL VERSION OF DEATH DREAMER! Tell your friends, help yourselves and let's keep it going for one more week!

--------------

DEATH DREAMER VOL. 1:

Troy Graves is no stranger to death. Now that he's an embalmer at Sunset Hills Mortuary he's never been closer to it. But behind the closed doors of the prep room all is not right. Bodies seem to appear and disappear mysteriously. And he's not the only one who's noticed... Following the horrific death of a City Councilman, Troy finds himself drawn back into a violent existence he'd kill to forget.    

DEATH IS HUMANITY'S ONLY PERFECT MOMENT.

DEATH DREAMER is the 54-page graphic novel by Scott Ian Lewis, frontman and vocalist for the death metal band CARNIFEX. 

The 1st edition of DEATH DREAMER, Vol.1,  will only available through two outlets - this Indiegogo Campaign, and during San Diego Comic-Con 2018. Secure your copy now!

DEATH DREAMER will be released July 18th, 2018 at San Diego Comic-con, Indiegogo Preorders will ship immediately following the release date! DEATH DREAMER will be in your hands by August 2018!

 

From Script to Sketch, to Absolute Sickness:

We wanted DEATH DREAMER to be incredibly cinematic, so we hired the best in the business.

Illustrated by Chris DiBari (Hoax Hunters, Magdalena) with colors by Simon Gough (G.I. Joe: Snake Eyes, Ringside), cover art by Chris Shehan (Prometheus), and lettering by Taylor Esposito (Red Hood & The Outlaws, Babyteeth).

The funding of this book goes toward the fantastic talent responsible for bringing the script to life.

What You Can Get:

- 11" X 17" DEATH DREAMER poster with artwork by Chris Shehan

- New! Digital download of DEATH DREAMER

- Signed and hand-numbered by Scott Ian Lewis, exclusive edition of DEATH DREAMER, Vol. 1

- Exclusive DEATH DREAMER merchandise

- Authentic Evidence Bag, Cemetery Pen, and Toe Tag hand-numbered by Scott Ian Lewis

(The Evidence Bag stores your seedy secrets, but it also doubles as a specially sized protective sleeve, so your graphic novel will be safe from the elements!)

- DEATH DREAMER Fine Art Print on a heavy matte canvas, limited to 100. Hand numbered, signed by Scott Ian Lewis

- Video Chat with Scott Ian Lewis, Talk about comics, music, writing or whatever you want!

- Stage-worn Junker Designs SLOW DEATH tour vest. Worn by Scott Ian Lewis during the SLOW DEATH global tours, The Summer Slaughter Tour and the infamous "Drown Me In Blood" music video.  UPDATE - SOLD OUT!

 

PERKS

PERK #1 - $5

POSTER

11" x 17" POSTER, Artwork by Chris Shehan. Ships end of July.

_____________________________________________________________________

PERK #2 - $15

DIGITAL DOWNLOAD OF DEATH DREAMER

The digital PDF of DEATH DREAMER. Sent end of July.

 

_____________________________________________________________________

PERK #3 - $20

YOUR COPY OF DEATH DREAMER, THE GRAPHIC NOVEL

Ships end of July.

_____________________________________________________________________

PERK #4 - $30

SIGNED COPY OF DEATH DREAMER

11" x 17" POSTER, Artwork by Chris Shehan

Signed and hand-numbered edition of DEATH DREAMER, Vol. 1, Ships end of July.

_____________________________________________________________________

PERK #5 - $50

SIGNED BOOK + T-SHIRT + POSTER

11" x 17" POSTER, Artwork by Chris Shehan

Signed and hand-numbered edition of DEATH DREAMER, Vol. 1

Exclusive DEATH DREAMER T-shirt, Ships end of July.

_____________________________________________________________________

PERK #6 - $70 - MORE ADDED!

RARE S/T CARNIFEX EP + SIGNED BOOK + T-SHIRT + POSTER

CARNIFEX'S 1st S/T EP FROM 2006, unavailable anywhere else in the world.

11" x 17" POSTER, Artwork by Chris Shehan

Signed and hand-numbered edition of DEATH DREAMER, Vol. 1

Exclusive DEATH DREAMER T-shirt, Ships end of July.

 

_____________________________________________________________________

PERK #7 - $65

EVIDENCE BAG

11" x 17" POSTER, Artwork by Chris Shehan

Signed and hand-numbered edition of DEATH DREAMER, Vol. 1

Exclusive DEATH DREAMER T-shirt

EVIDENCE BAG protective sleeve, featuring a hand numbered TOE TAG, Cemetery Pen, a logo patch designed by Mark Riddick, and two 1" buttons. Ships end of July.

PERK #8 - $75

3' X 4' WALL FLAG

Artwork by Chris Shehan

Signed and hand-numbered edition of DEATH DREAMER, Vol. 1

Exclusive DEATH DREAMER T-shirt

EVIDENCE BAG protective sleeve, featuring a hand numbered TOE TAG, Cemetery Pen, a logo patch designed by Mark Riddick and two 1" buttons. 

3' x 4' WALL FLAG, Ships end of July.

PERK #9 - $85

PERSONALIZED DEDICATION

Artwork by Chris Shehan

Signed and hand-numbered edition of DEATH DREAMER, Vol. 1

Exclusive DEATH DREAMER T-shirt

EVIDENCE BAG protective sleeve, featuring a hand numbered TOE TAG, Cemetery Pen, a logo patch designed by Mark Riddick, and two 1" buttons. 

3' x 4' WALL FLAG

_____________________________________________________________________

PERK #10 - $100

FINE ART PRINT

11" x 17" POSTER, Artwork by Chris Shehan

Signed and hand-numbered edition of DEATH DREAMER, Vol. 1

Exclusive DEATH DREAMER T-shirt

EVIDENCE BAG protective sleeve, featuring a hand numbered TOE TAG, Cemetery Pen, a logo patch designed by Mark Riddick, and two 1" buttons. 

3' x 4' WALL FLAG

PERSONALIZED DEDICATION by Scott Ian Lewis. A hand-written note for you or a friend.

FINE ART PRINT, Hand numbered and signed. This fine art print is printed on a heavy matte canvas. Limited to 100. Ships end of July.

_____________________________________________________________________

PERK #11 - $150

VIDEO CHAT WITH SCOTT IAN LEWIS

11" x 17" POSTER, Artwork by Chris Shehan

story_txt:
UPDATE! 
Our stretch goal of $35,000 was met, so we are introducing the DIGITAL VERSION OF DEATH DREAMER! Tell your friends, help yourselves and let's keep it going for one more week!
--------------
DEATH DREAMER VOL. 1:
Troy Graves is no stranger to death. Now that he's an embalmer at Sunset Hills Mortuary he's never been closer to it. But behind the closed doors of the prep room all is not right. Bodies seem to appear and disappear mysteriously. And he's not the only one who's noticed... Following the horrific death of a City Councilman, Troy finds himself drawn back into a violent existence he'd kill to forget.    
DEATH IS HUMANITY'S ONLY PERFECT MOMENT.
DEATH DREAMER is the 54-page graphic novel by Scott Ian Lewis, frontman and vocalist for the death metal band CARNIFEX. 
The 1st edition of DEATH DREAMER, Vol.1,  will only available through two outlets - this Indiegogo Campaign, and during San Diego Comic-Con 2018. Secure your copy now!
DEATH DREAMER will be released July 18th, 2018 at San Diego Comic-con, Indiegogo Preorders will ship immediately following the release date! DEATH DREAMER will be in your hands by August 2018!
 
From Script to Sketch, to Absolute Sickness:
We wanted DEATH DREAMER to be incredibly cinematic, so we hired the best in the business.
Illustrated by Chris DiBari (Hoax Hunters, Magdalena) with colors by Simon Gough (G.I. Joe: Snake Eyes, Ringside), cover art by Chris Shehan (Prometheus), and lettering by Taylor Esposito (Red Hood & The Outlaws, Babyteeth).
The funding of this book goes toward the fantastic talent responsible for bringing the script to life.
What You Can Get:
- 11" X 17" DEATH DREAMER poster with artwork by Chris Shehan
- New! Digital download of DEATH DREAMER
- Signed and hand-numbered by Scott Ian Lewis, exclusive edition of DEATH DREAMER, Vol. 1
- Exclusive DEATH DREAMER merchandise
- Authentic Evidence Bag, Cemetery Pen, and Toe Tag hand-numbered by Scott Ian Lewis
(The Evidence Bag stores your seedy secrets, but it also doubles as a specially sized protective sleeve, so your graphic novel will be safe from the elements!)
- DEATH DREAMER Fine Art Print on a heavy matte canvas, limited to 100. Hand numbered, signed by Scott Ian Lewis
- Video Chat with Scott Ian Lewis, Talk about comics, music, writing or whatever you want!
- Stage-worn Junker Designs SLOW DEATH tour vest. Worn by Scott Ian Lewis during the SLOW DEATH global tours, The Summer Slaughter Tour and the infamous "Drown Me In Blood" music video.  UPDATE - SOLD OUT!

story:
Uh... What Do You Want From Me? Who Is This Don Rosa Guy Anyway?

You might know Don Rosa for his Eisner Award winning work on Uncle $crooge and Donald Duck comics, but even before he started working with those world famous characters, he was a well-known cartoonist. For several years, he managed the “Information Center,” a question-and-answer column in different fanzines and did a wide variety of illustrations for those.

What Is This (So-Called) Artbook About?

For the first time EVER, “The Early (So-Called) Art of Don Rosa” will reprint ALL illustrations and mastheads Don did for his “Information Centers.” These great fun illos feature awesome parodies of TV show and movie characters, mashup scenes etc. But this is just the beginning. Be prepared to see school and college newspaper cartoons, private drawings, long comic stories from Don's high school times, advertising illustrations and a whole lot more that you've NEVER seen before (at least if you didn't go to the same schools as Don). For regularly updated samples of the illustrations that will be included, see the “Gallery” tab above. And for those of you who are interested in even more Rosa, we have a package that includes a PDF ebook of the COMPLETE Information Centers, not just the art, with all of Don's answers to readers' questions.

The project is being organized by Jano Rohleder, a longtime friend of Don Rosa's, who is also the German editor/translator of his Duck work. He's also the one who brought you the recent reprint of Captain Kentucky and The Pertwillaby Papers (both books will be in stock in October and are available as perks on this campaign). Jano doesn't do anything unless it's done right and the book will aim at the highest possible quality standard.

I Ordered the “Don Rosa Classics”... Is It Worth Getting This Book As Well?

Oh, yes, ABSOLUTELY! The book will have the same oversized format as “The Complete Pertwillaby Papers” and a similar cover design, so it will work perfectly as the final volume of the “Don Rosa Classics.”

Why Should I Contribute? Where Does My Money Go?

All funds go directly into the production of the book, so that it can be produced at the most awesome quality! This will be a limited hardback edition of about 350 copies, and only available while stocks last. Contribute at least 99 EUR and lock your copy of the artbook in right now! Free shipping (to everywhere) is included! Or, if you don't want the book itself, you can also get some exclusive Rosa goodies or the previous books (while stocks last) by contributing -- see the list on the right.

What Others Say:

  • “Very funny!”
    – Scott McCloud (on The Pertwillaby Papers)
  • “One of my all-time favorite cartoonists.”
    – Ed Brubaker

Oh, and to clear things up, here are the two color prints available this time (these are NOT the books; for the covers of those, see the Gallery tab above):

“Capt. Kentucky SIGNED Print” (A4 size, limited to 222 copies)

“SIGNED LIMITED CK/PP Print” (A3 size, limited to 150 copies, was already available as the last minute bonus perk in the Classics campaign)

Frequently Asked Questions

I Got All the Stuff in the First Campaign! What's New?

If you ordered the Super Fan Package and the limited PP/CK Print in the Classics campaign, you should get the "Don Rosa Art Package" or the "Information Center Package". Both include the new book, the new CK print and the postcards. The IC Package has the additional ebook of the full Information Center Columns.

Is Shipping to My Country Included?

Yes! Free shipping to anywhere in the world is included in your contribution!

Which Language Will the Artbook Be In?

The artbook contains mostly art (of course), but the captions and introductions will be in English.

What Will the Art Look Like?

All illustrations will appear in the best possible quality. Most were done in black and white, but the ones that Don did in color will be printed in color, of course (as long as Don has a color copy in his archive).

What Size and Page-Count Can We Expect?

The artbook will be C4 size (22.9 x 32.4 cm = 9.02 x 12.76 inches). At the moment, the plan is to have about 250 to 300 pages of material, maybe more.

When Do I Get the Book?

The first two Don Rosa Classics (PP and CK) are currently in production and will be in stock in October. The artbook will be available in the first half of 2015.

Is Don Rosa Himself Involved?

Yes, of course! All material will come from Don's personal archive so that the best possible reproduction quality is given. And as with the two previous “Don Rosa Classics”, he will act as an advisor and oversee every stage of production. There'll also be an introduction written by him.

Which Fanzine Illustrations Are NOT in the Book?

The only fanzine illustrations that won't be included are Don's comics “Tagdenah” and “Khulan”. These have already been reprinted in The Complete Pertwillaby Papers and The Complete Captain Kentucky, so we'll use the space for more stuff that hasn't been seen before instead. The same goes for his 12 “Phalanx” strips. If you're interested in these comics, please claim one of those books as your perk (see the table on the right). Oh, and of course we obviously can't include ALL the thousands of comic pages Don did as a kid and in school, but only several examples of his best ones (you wouldn't want to read most of the ones he did until the age of 15 or so anyway, they feature mostly stickman characters). So the focus is on making this a complete collection of his Information Center and other fanzine illos, but there'll be a lot of bonus pages featuring a wide selection of Don's best other pre-Duck work, ranging from some of the aforementioned comics to advertising illos, political cartoons and much more.

story:
Rainstorm #1 - A comic that will kick you in the face.

First, thanks for checking out our project.  Rainstorm #1 is the first comic book starring champion pro-wrestler, yoga instructor, and fitness model Bonnie "Rain" Maxson.  Bonnie's an amazing woman and known for her high-action style in the ring.  We're excited to have her on board for this project, and she's excited to have her very own comic book to offer to her fans.

The creative team behind this project is Nik Havert and Pablo Lordi, and the book will be published by Pickle Press - an independent comic book publisher based in northern Indiana and ran by Nik Havert.

Nik Havert is an in-demand comic book, music review, and erotica author based in Nappanee, Indiana.  He has published over 20 comics (including many for internationally famous glamour, fetish, fitness, and bikini models) and written for other independent comic book companies such as Bad Place Productions and Mark Starks Productions.  He's also a published author of erotica with XCite Books, Cleis Press, and Naughty Nights Press.  He is also the punk / alternative rock editor for Outlaw Music Magazine and a contributing writer to Kick Ass Music Women Magazine.

Pablo Lordi is one of the hottest new artists from Argentina.  His work has been featured in many Argentinian comics and Rainstorm #1 is his American full-length debut.  

What you can help us do...

You will be helping us raise money for art fees, promotional fees, printing fees, and shipping.  You'll also be helping Bonnie have her first comic and be the envy of many other pro-wrestlers around the world.  You'll be helping us create a book that will have fans around the globe, and a comic free of "big media" control and corporate ads.  You will be supporting indie comics, one of the greatest American art forms of the last 70 + years.

What you can get out of this...

We need $5,500.00 to reach our goal.  This all goes to art fees, printing fees, promotional materials, and shipping.  We have some fantastic incentives for you, including...

  • Custom sketches from Pablo.
  • Buttons and stickers.
  • Signed glossy photos from Bonnie.
  • Being drawn as a supporting character in the book.
  • Being drawn as a janitor kissed by Bonnie!
  • A PDF of the book.
  • A custom story by me.
  • A pair of shoes worn by Bonnie in several matches around the world.
  • A custom video thank you from Bonnie!

We're not a fly-by-night operation...

Nik Havert has published many comics in multiple genres.  Be assured that all of your contributions will go toward creating Rainstorm #1 and not something like a new air conditioner or a Blu-Ray player.  You only need to check the Pickle Press website (www.picklepress.net) to see Nik's the real deal.

 

No money?  You can still help us...

If you can't contribute cash, but still want to help us out, please do.  We appreciate any word-of-mouth, blog posts, Tweets, links, and anything else you want to post regarding the project.

Thanks for reading, for helping us, and for supporting indie comics.

Nik, Pablo, Bonnie.

story:
#milanonapoliconuneuro per Emergency

Mi chiamo Gioacchino Magnani e faccio parte insieme a Giacomo Di Luise della "The Red Box Video" una piccola casa di produzione video indipendente.

Se state leggendo avete probabilmente visto la prima puntata di mnc1e. Se volete vedere la seconda  puntata potete fare la differenza donando adesso. Qualora la cifra di 629 euro venisse raggiunta effettuerò, portandovene prova, una donazione dell' intero importo all' ente benefico Emergency. Molti di voi probabilmente penseranno che non è esattamente il tipo di prodotto a cui associare una campagna di beneficenza, ma la verità è che dal mio punto di vista, per poter svolgere un lavoro di tale portata ed ogni mese, ho bisogno di buone motivazioni. Chiedervi di essere pagato  mi è parso fuoriluogo, allora ho pensato che se lo avessi fatto per beneficenza perlomeno a qualcuno il mio lavoro avrebbe giovato. Io metto in gioco il mio tempo ed il mio lavoro, voi potete donare.
