story:
Welcome,
for those who don't know me: I'm a Berlin based artist who specializes in drawing and storytelling. You might have seen my work at Crack! Festival in Rome, Neurotitan Gallery in Berlin or in Anthologies like Komikaze or Excessive Force. I co-founded the artist collective Radical Jetset with Patu in 2012.

I'm starting this crowdfunding campaign, because I'm trying to figure out a way of making the creation of comic books and graphic novels a less precarious lifestyle choice, and because I think there is a dire need for non-comformist art, that is independent from corporate sponsorships, which actually just want to sell you energy drinks, sneakers, or what every sneaks into your mind right now.

During this campaign I'm offering you a quarterly subscription to my comic books for 2015. The idea for this was inspired by Tiny Masters from Leipzig (you should check them out!). 

A subscription will cost €28,- (within Germany) or €37,- (worldwide), including printing, shipping, fees, etc. Each of book will contain 36 pages of comic short stories and drawings in black and white, including a color cover.

You can see a few samples of my work in the gallery or on my website.

I'm trying to make it as affordable to as many people as possible, but if you like my work and can chip in a little more, that's great! If you don't have money to spare, but want to support this project, feel free to spread the word on your social media site of choice.


By your subscription, I hope to cover not just the work these books, but hopefully my work on long term projects like graphic novels and exhibitions. Since I'm cutting out the middlemen, just 200 subscribers would give me enough backup to work on these projects for at least 3 months. If everything goes well, there will be a new subscription for 2016, which will include books by other artists of Radical Jetset and we would work on making this a long term project.
 
Kind regards,

Maik Hasenbank

ps: you can now take a look at some older comics here

www.radical-jetset.com

www.maikhasenbank.com
story_txt: Welcome,for those who don't know me: I'm a Berlin based artist who specializes in drawing and storytelling. You might have seen my work at Crack! Festival in Rome, Neurotitan Gallery in Berlin or in Anthologies like Komikaze or Excessive Force. I co-founded the artist collective Radical Jetset with Patu in 2012. I'm starting this crowdfunding campaign, because I'm trying to figure out a way of making the creation of comic books and graphic novels a less precarious lifestyle choice, and because I think there is a dire need for non-comformist art, that is independent from corporate sponsorships, which actually just want to sell you energy drinks, sneakers, or what every sneaks into your mind right now. During this campaign I'm offering you a quarterly subscription to my comic books for 2015. The idea for this was inspired by Tiny Masters from Leipzig (you should check them out!). A subscription will cost €28,- (within Germany) or €37,- (worldwide), including printing, shipping, fees, etc. Each of book will contain 36 pages of comic short stories and drawings in black and white, including a color cover. You can see a few samples of my work in the gallery or on my website.I'm trying to make it as affordable to as many people as possible, but if you like my work and can chip in a little more, that's great! If you don't have money to spare, but want to support this project, feel free to spread the word on your social media site of choice. By your subscription, I hope to cover not just the work these books, but hopefully my work on long term projects like graphic novels and exhibitions. Since I'm cutting out the middlemen, just 200 subscribers would give me enough backup to work on these projects for at least 3 months. If everything goes well, there will be a new subscription for 2016, which will include books by other artists of Radical Jetset and we would work on making this a long term project. Kind regards,Maik Hasenbankps: you can now take a look at some older comics here www.radical-jetset.comwww.maikhasenbank.com

story:
My Story

Hi there, my name is Rachel Stubbings and in March 2011 I set myself up as an agony aunt. I have been healing people via my service (Stubbing Out Problems) ever since. This year I want to take my project up to The Edinburgh Festival so I can raise my profile and help more people.

 

The Impact

I have always been a firm believer that actions speak louder than words so if you think you might need proof of how good I am then please watch the following clips. Its me in action.
Stubbing Out Problems Clip 1
Stubbing Out Problems Clip 2
Stubbing Out Problems Clip 3

 

What We Need & What You Get

I don't know how familiar you are with the Edinburgh Festival... Its a wonderful thing but the price of taking a show is crippling. You have to pay for the venue, the PR, getting in the brochures, technical support, admin... All of these expenditures mount up and the financial loss is gargantuan.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't want to help me out financially then by all means spread the word about my plight! Here's a link to my website: http://rachelstubbings.com/category/stubbing-out-problems/

story:
IT'S OFFICIAL

TO ARMS! 

IS NOW 100% FUNDED


Last night TO ARMS! officially broke through our £2000 funding goal! So we'd like to take a moment to thank some very special people.

Thanks to everyone who contributed to this project so far (and to all the people you might still contribute). 

Thanks to all the people who helped spread the word about the book, without you I don't think we'd have raised half the money. 

And of course a big thank you to our amazing team of  artists and writers, who have done such amazing work in such a short amount of time. Can't wait to see their stuff in print.

In our minds you're all war heroes in the fight to get this book made. We salute you.


DON'T FORGET THE CAMPAIGN CONTINUES BELOW...



(Cover Artist: Tim Hassan)


OUR PROJECT...

This August marks the centenary of the outbreak of WW1, a conflict that claimed 16 million lives, yet will soon slip from living memory. 

TO ARMS! resurrects the stories of the fallen, bringing them to life in an evocative contemporary format that will appeal to the comic book fan, the history buff, and everyone in-between.

We've asked over twenty writers and artists to create incredible and compelling stories and illustrations, that seek to provide alternative perspectives of WW1. A vision of this conflict that elevates its retelling above the traditional depictions already available.

The result is an anthology that blends both humour and heroism, reality and the surreal, into a unique experience you won’t get anywhere else. Believe us when we say you've never encountered a WW1 comic quite like TO ARMS!

Your support of TO ARMS! will also be providing several of the creators involved with their first opportunity to see their work published professionally. This is something that we are immensely proud of, as debuting amazing new talent is a big part of what this project is all about.


WHO WE ARE...

We are an international collection of artists, writers and comic book enthusiasts, who have banded together to produce work that is both exciting and thought provoking. 

Coming from a range of different entertainment and media backgrounds, which include the likes of TV, film, design and publishing, we believe that we have a pretty deep talent pool, something that should no doubt be reflected in the quality of the work we aim to produce.

Spearheading this project is the marvellous Matthew Duncan, visionary publisher of the indie comic book anthology Ye Olde Axe. Joining him is Matt's guy friday, Karim Iskander Flint, screenwriter, fanboy and all around affable sort of chap. Put it this way, if we were a WW1 based TV show we'd definitely be BLACK ADDER. And yes... we do have a cunning plan.

For more about our project, or to contact us directly, feel free to check out our Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/TOARMSANTHOLOGY

Also please check out the links below to some of existing work of our amazing contributors...

http://www.backwardsburd.com

http://mikemedaglia.com

http://oi.thecomicseries.com/comics/first/

http://www.pennyblackfeather.co.uk

http://timhassanart.tumblr.com

http://www.songlinepress.com

http://www.keithmcdougall.com

http://www.owenpomery.com

(Artist: James Hickman / Writer: Karim Iskander Flint)


WHAT DO WE NEED...

Thanks to the tireless work of our contributors so far we already have 75% of the content we hope to print, and our aim is to produce an 80+ page book, that will be printed in both colour and black & white.

We have budgeted this project at £2000, of which all funds will be going towards our printing, shipping and marketing costs. Any monies raised from the sales of our books (fingers crossed) will then be distributed amongst our collaborators.

Below is a brief rundown of the costs we expect to incur...

Printing Costs: £1000

We plan on an initial run of 500 copies. Those that aren't sent to our Indiegogo supporters will be distributed both here in the UK and abroad, in conjunction this year's WW1 Centenary celebrations.

Shipping: £500

We want this book to be distributed as widely as possible, which is why we've been careful to factor in enough funds to cover both shipping here in the UK and abroad. So whether you live in Toronto or Timbuktu, we'll get you your copy.

Marketing & Incidentals: £500

As you can see in our Perks section there is a lot of great stuff we want to give you guys for supporting this campaign. This, along with any Indiegogo admin costs we need to pay, will also be covered in our budget.

What happens if we fail to hit our funding goal?

Well first and foremost our number one priority is to get this book published, and get copies to all you nice people who have supported us here on Indiegogo. If we dramatically fall short then we most likely be forced to reduce our initial printing run, but we do have contingencies in place if this is the case. However the more money we raise, the more money we can put into this and future projects.

What happens if we exceed our funding goal?


If all you good people dig deep, and help us exceed our fundraising goal, then we intend to take this show on the road. That means promoting the book at small press fairs and comic expos, which in turn will contribute to the ever burgeoning small press scene both here in the UK and abroad. So any additional funds will go towards covering table costs for these events.

Wherever possible we also want to give back to the creatives involved in this project. They've truly pulled out all the stops to produce truly amazing stories and art for us, without any expectation of financial reward, and we hope to continue to work with as many of them as possible on future projects.


WHAT DO YOU GET...

Check out below a sneak peek at some of work that will feature in the finished book.

(Artist / Writer: Michael Lightfoot)


(Artist / Writer: Milo Shore)


(Artist: Daniel de Sosa / Writer: Karim Iskander Flint)


(Artist / Writer: Matt Duncan)


EXCERPT FROM AN INTERVIEW WITH PAT MILLS...

As part of our preparation for this project our man Matt sat down with Pat "the godfather of British comics" Mills, writer of the acclaimed WW1 comic book Charley's War. The full and illustrated version of this interview will feature as part of TO ARMS!

Matt: You’re writing a new story about the First World War. Can you tell us anything about your new story?

Pat: I’ve only just started on it and it’s just doing the rounds of publishers. It features a soldier from  1914 and his relationship with soldiers from other countries – his “Brothers in Arms”, The theme is “The World is My Country.

Matt: Why revisit the subject? Is there more you want to say on the subject, or have your views changed since Charley’s War? 

Pat: There’s so much more to say. Firstly, chronologically, CW started in 1916. Brothers starts in 1914 so I get to cover Mons, Loos etc.  But amongst the many things not covered in detail in Charlie's War featured here:

Drugs.  Burroughs Welcome “Forced March” tablets of cocaine and caffeine, probably drunk with rum, were given to the troops. Germans similar.  This has been largely hushed up. Establishment historians didn’t report it, but it’s a fact. Why not? Because their histories exist to reinforce the status quo and this raises too many embarrassing questions.

Matt: What’s the difference between doing a WWI story in 2013, and 1979, in terms of the audience you’re addressing? Is it a more informed or savvy one?

Pat: Less savvy today because the establishment historians have been white washing murderers like Haig and spreading the lie of the noble sacrifice again. That’s not co-incidence, that’s a deliberate and disturbing trend. Look at docs like “The Somme – from defeat to victory”. A doc like that couldn’t have appeared in 1979. No, it was a much sharper time back in 1979. I’m not sure audiences today question as much as people did back then.

Matt: Our view of WWI these days is of a pretty grim experience all round, for very little gain, if any. Presumably, the anti-propaganda machine has been quite effective in countering the ‘official’ version of that war, would you agree? 

Pat: Instinctively, we all know it was “organised murder” to quote the last Tommy who died recently. And if that’s true, and not a meaningless phrase,  then Haig, Lloyd George and the rest should have faced a war crimes tribunal after the war. But the establishment does its best to fight back, and I think they’re winning.

They often quote and trash Black Adder for criticising Haig. A Sandhurst historian thought CW was “Vietnam generation” thinking. All of them loathe Oh, What a Lovely War, which they wrongly think was some kind of comment on the Vietnam War. That’s how desperate they are to defend the indefensible.

Matt: Charley’s War showed British society during WWI as being riddled with class prejudice. Has class prejudice disappeared from Britain?

Pat: No. It continued in WW2 and I touch upon this in the final volume of CW. And it continues today.  Only now there is an underclass, the spirit of the working class is broken, much of their ideology has gone, and they can be legitimately trashed as chavs. So you have websites like Chavtown, and TV dramas like Shameless, where the middle classes can go to the zoo and laugh at them.

It’s why in Brothers, I make a point of dramatizing the story of working class heroine and martyr Alice Wheeldon who fought against the war. We need working class heroes and heroines.

Matt: Did all those men in the First World War die for nothing? Did any good come out of that war?

Pat: That’s an interesting question. In macro political and social terms – no.

If we remember and honor the achievements and courage of  ordinary soldiers  – yes. I say ordinary, because despite the sacrifices of the officer class, in ultimate terms this was a class war with the working class sacrificed for the objectives of the upper classes (colonies, trade, power).


OUR LONG TERM VISION...

Of course we have great faith in this endeavour, especially as it enables us to introduce so many new readers to the amazing work of the highly talented team of artists and writers we've gathered together. 

Our long term vision for TO ARMS! is that it will be just the beginning! By supporting this project, you are also supporting small press comic creators across the UK and beyond and helping to create artistic networks that will endure far beyond a single collaboration. 

Which is why we welcome you to  get in touch with us via https://www.facebook.com/TOARMSANTHOLOGY for any more information about this book, or future projects on our slate.

And if you've made it all the way to the bottom of this page then thank you so much for taking the time to check out our campaign. We hope we count on your support.


CAMPAIGN UPDATES...

HA HA HA!

Owen Pomery's powerful story Last Laugh is a welcome addition to the TO ARMS! fold.

Check out more of Owen's work here http://owenpomery.blogspot.co.uk

With just 5 days left to go on the campaign I can't wait for you guys to see this story, and many others like it, in full.


A TIME TO KILL.

This is an incredible work in progress from the supremely talented artist Tim Hassan. A brilliant example of the diverse range of material that will be featured in this anthology.

Tim is also the man behind the incredible cover art for TO ARMS!  and you can find more of his work at http://timhassanart.tumblr.com/


DOWN UNDER'S GREATEST COMIC BOOK CREATOR... EVER!

A few panels from the TO ARMS! story by Australian artist Keith McDougall, which explores the artistic avant garde during WW1. One of our favourite entries so far.

You can find more of Keith's brilliant comics at http://www.keithmcdougall.com.


STOP THE PRESSES!

The  guys over at Broken Frontier, your one-stop guide of the comic's universe, have very kindly agreed the to turn their Small Press Spotlight... on the best WW1 book you're likely to read this year.

If you want to check out the awesome Andy Oliver's interview with Matt and Karim, the editors of TO ARMS!,then follow the link below.

http://www.brokenfrontier.com/small-press-spotlight-on-first-world-war-anthology-to-arms-with-matt-duncan-and-karim-iskander-flint/


 I WAS A BOY.

Here's the beautiful first page from the Matt Boyer  story that will be featured in the finished TO ARMS! anthology.

Honestly one of my favourite pieces in the book so far. You can find more of Matt's work here http://www.dark-matter.co.uk/blog/matt-boyer-artist/.


THE BUSIEST MAN IN COMICS.

This amazing page of art is from the crazily talented Tim Hassan. You'll probably recognise him as being the same artist behind our stunning TO ARMS! cover.

Tim will also be doing the back cover the book, and producing a special bookplate to be given away at launch party at GOSH! COMICS. 

You're welcome to come and join us at the launch party, and you can find more of Tim's work at http://timhassanart.tumblr.com.


IT'S PARTY TIME!

The secret origin story of TO ARMS! can be traced back to a very special comic book discussion group called PROCESS (https://twitter.com/ProcessComics). 

This gathering of artists, writers and creative reprobates assembles on the first Wednesday of every month at the London's premier purveyor of sequential artwork,GOSH! (http://www.goshlondon.com).

Now the amazing people at our favourite comic book store have once again stepped up, and agreed to host the TO ARMS! launch party.

So clear a window in your schedule and come join us at 19:00pm Friday the 12th of September. 

You'll be able to have a drink with creative team behind this amazing project, pick up a copy of the book for your friends and loved ones (we'll assume you already got yours via Indiegogo), and have what we know will be a fun filled night.

More details about this event will follow soon.


SONGBIRDS OF WAR.

We now have inked pages from the wonderful Jess Milton. Her work is so beautiful, and I know this is going to be a great story for TO ARMS!

Take a look at more of Jess' amazing art at http://www.jessicamilton.co.uk/, or follow her on twitter https://twitter.com/jezbelizia.



ONCE MORE INTO THE BREACH.

Take a look at this amazing piece of artwork by the always astounding Nick Jobbings.

Nick has kindly donated the original of this piece, which will be given away as one of WAR HERO level perks.

So if you want this, or other equally beautiful works, dig deep and contribute to the campaign.

And be sure to check out Nick's other comic related stuff at nickcomicart.tumblr.com.


CAUGHT IN THE CROSSHAIRS.

A work in progress yet still Sajan Rai's beautiful page for TO ARMS! stands out.

Check out this and more of Sajan's amazing work at http://www.backwardsburd.com.


BIRDS EYE VIEW.

The very talented Alex Potts (The Comix Reader, Lost Shoe Comics) has very graciously contributed an amazing piece of work for TO ARMS!

Check out the first page of this story, and find a link to more of Alex's work, listed below.

http://www.alexanderpotts.com

TO ARMS! 

COMING AUGUST 2014

EVER!A few panels from the TO ARMS! story by Australian artist Keith McDougall, which explores the artistic avant garde during WW1. One of our favourite entries so far.You can find more of Keith's brilliant comics at http://www.keithmcdougall.com.STOP THE PRESSES!The  guys over at Broken Frontier, your one-stop guide of the comic's universe, have very kindly agreed the to turn their Small Press Spotlight... on the best WW1 book you're likely to read this year.If you want to check out the awesome Andy Oliver's interview with Matt and Karim, the editors of TO ARMS!,then follow the link below.http://www.brokenfrontier.com/small-press-spotlight-on-first-world-war-anthology-to-arms-with-matt-duncan-and-karim-iskander-flint/ I WAS A BOY.Here's the beautiful first page from the Matt Boyer  story that will be featured in the finished TO ARMS! anthology.Honestly one of my favourite pieces in the book so far. You can find more of Matt's work here http://www.dark-matter.co.uk/blog/matt-boyer-artist/.THE BUSIEST MAN IN COMICS.This amazing page of art is from the crazily talented Tim Hassan. You'll probably recognise him as being the same artist behind our stunning TO ARMS! cover.Tim will also be doing the back cover the book, and producing a special bookplate to be given away at launch party at GOSH! COMICS. You're welcome to come and join us at the launch party, and you can find more of Tim's work at http://timhassanart.tumblr.com.IT'S PARTY TIME!The secret origin story of TO ARMS! can be traced back to a very special comic book discussion group called PROCESS (https://twitter.com/ProcessComics). This gathering of artists, writers and creative reprobates assembles on the first Wednesday of every month at the London's premier purveyor of sequential artwork,GOSH! (http://www.goshlondon.com).Now the amazing people at our favourite comic book store have once again stepped up, and agreed to host the TO ARMS! launch party.So clear a window in your schedule and come join us at 19:00pm Friday the 12th of September. You'll be able to have a drink with creative team behind this amazing project, pick up a copy of the book for your friends and loved ones (we'll assume you already got yours via Indiegogo), and have what we know will be a fun filled night.More details about this event will follow soon.SONGBIRDS OF WAR.We now have inked pages from the wonderful Jess Milton. Her work is so beautiful, and I know this is going to be a great story for TO ARMS!Take a look at more of Jess' amazing art at http://www.jessicamilton.co.uk/, or follow her on twitter https://twitter.com/jezbelizia.ONCE MORE INTO THE BREACH.Take a look at this amazing piece of artwork by the always astounding Nick Jobbings.Nick has kindly donated the original of this piece, which will be given away as one of WAR HERO level perks.So if you want this, or other equally beautiful works, dig deep and contribute to the campaign.And be sure to check out Nick's other comic related stuff at nickcomicart.tumblr.com.CAUGHT IN THE CROSSHAIRS.A work in progress yet still Sajan Rai's beautiful page for TO ARMS! stands out.Check out this and more of Sajan's amazing work at http://www.backwardsburd.com.BIRDS EYE VIEW.The very talented Alex Potts (The Comix Reader, Lost Shoe Comics) has very graciously contributed an amazing piece of work for TO ARMS!Check out the first page of this story, and find a link to more of Alex's work, listed below.http://www.alexanderpotts.comTO ARMS! COMING AUGUST 2014

story:
DI COSA STIAMO PARLANDO?

V!P - Very Important Powers" è una saga a fumetti nata nel 2011 e pubblicata per più di un anno sul sito www.veryimportantpowers.com. Interrotta nel Dicembre 2012 per una serie di congiunture cosmiche sfavorevoli potrebbe ora ricostruirsi un'identità in formato cartaceo. A proporvi tale impresa sono proprio i due autori del fumetto, Roberto Gallaurese & Ernest Yesterday, tornati in azione per vedere se sia davvero possibile trovare un "mercato" attivo per un prodotto apparentemente slegato dai canoni fumettistici italici ma che, nella sua parabola online, aveva attirato molta attenzione.

La storia esplora le conseguenze dell'apparizione, a fine Anni '60, di individui super-potenziati le cui origini sono misteriose. Alcuni di essi diventano vere e proprie superstar ("Vip", appunto) e si uniscono in una Squadra di Difesa dei Confini Europei, i leggendari "Vigilanti". Eppure, come spesso accade (e in Italia più che in altri luoghi) il potere porta corruzione...e anche i Protettori del Paese non ne sembrano immuni.Quando uno scandalo travolge gli eroi più amati del mondo si assiste al crollo di questi idoli, tra mazzette e favori politici. Chi ha scatenato tutto questo? Chi è il nemico? Presto si manifesterà in carne e ossa con una banda di Supercriminali che parlano poco e massacrano molto, scatenando una vera apocalisse. Solo il figlio adolescente di Volto della Notte, il leader dei "Vigilanti", potrebbe fermarli...ma non può farlo!! Perché?? Chi gli potrà/vorrà dare una mano?? In un mondo dove essere "super" sembra l'unica cosa che conta è possibile vincere semplicemente essendo "uno qualunque"?

Alla storia si uniscono finti articoli del quotidiano "L'Eco del Potere" che esplora eventi del presente italiano "rielaborandoli" in chiave supereroistica, finte cover di riviste reali, finti interventi di esperti...insomma, un "mondo" intero che si ispira alla realtà ma la rielabora per renderla parte integrante e sfondo dell'avventura di V!P.

DI COSA AVREMMO BISOGNO?

Semplicemente del vostro aiuto per creare il primo volume della saga di "Very Important Powers". Originariamente il progetto prevedeva tre "Atti" solo ed esclusivamente sul Web. Dato che il primo volume è stato completato e la pubblicazione online interrotta poco dopo, l'obiettivo è ora quello di rendere quell'Atto Primo (come amiamo chiamarlo) un prodotto da esibire non solo sui nostri scaffali ma anche su quelli di coloro che ci hanno seguito e spronato nella incarnazione "Web" del prodotto e che ora vogliono farlo anche per questa nuova impresa! 

Godetevi il video di presentazione della Campagna in cui i due autori viaggiano indietro nel tempo, all'epoca della pubblicazione del fumetto online, per "cambiare il corso degli eventi" e speriamo non solo di farvi divertire ma anche di incuriosirvi. Poi spulciate le alternative delle singole donazioni a destra dello schermo, valutate i ricchi premi e cotillon che mettiamo in palio per ognuna di esse...e, beh, a quel punto non possiamo che contare su di voi.

Se l'impresa dovesse ottenere successo allora potremmo constatare che un mercato per la nostra creatura esiste davvero e, chissà, riprendere da dove fummo costretti a interrompere!! Quindi, tutto sta a voi, Very Important Fans!

DOVE CI TROVATE?

Per domande, dubbi, ricatti, avances e minacce di morte saremo disponibili non solo sulla pagina facebook di V!P

http://www.facebook.com/veryimportantpowers?ref=ts&fref=ts

ma anche su quella del progetto "Photocomics_13" dedicato alla creatività giovanile e realizzato a Novara con il contributo del Programma" Gioventù in Azione".

http://www.facebook.com/photocomics13

 

ALTRI MODI PER AIUTARCI?

Condividete questa campagna, a chiunque e con chiunque! Diffondete come un virus il nostro video e il nostro progetto. Fate TUTTO il possibile affinché, per sessanta giorni, il Web possa ribollire di fermento e/o fomento nei confronti di "V!P" . Come diceva il dottor Peter Venkman: "Siamo pronti a Credere in Voi!"

story:
DEADSKINS! 1 & 2 is a 64-page, perfect bound comic book collecting the first two issues of the series critics call:

DEADSKINS! was the first graphic novel we ever created, and it was serialized on our website from 2013-2014. The full story clocks in at 5 issues, roughly 30 pages each. 

We're remastering this book 2 issues at a time, darkening the lines to improve print quality and bring out the beauty of our black, white, and red production. 

Here's the pitch:

"A Harvard-educated dandy and his blind, drunk companion are all that stand between the Old West and an Undead Apocalypse. This is the true story of Custer's Last Stand... whatever they taught you in school is bullsh!t." 

In addition to the 64-page, perfect bound book, backers get: 

  • Exclusive digital bonuses
  • FREE U.S. SHIPPING!

 

Want to try before you buy?

No problem! Here's a 9-page preview:

We're keeping our rewards pretty simple this go 'round. But in addition to our main cover by Afro Samurai's Takashi Okazaki, we have... 

THE BEN TEMPLESMITH VARIANT 

And if you missed any of our other campaigns for RED XMAS or PBOW, you can catch up with our ...

Box of Fries 

More details below...

*Please note: After June 15, 2020, we are no longer offering credit inside the book, as we are sending to printer right away. 

NOTE ABOUT THE TIME PERIOD

DEADSKINS! takes place in the Wild West, and as such, some characters--particularly the villains--express attitudes that seem outdated today. We think our readers are smart enough to know that we aren't condoning these things, but we also know that in 2020, some people don't want to read about it. So: fair warning. 

There's also donkey-f*cking.

FRIED Comics is a proud purveyor of offbeat, irreverent pulp fiction since 2013, and a labor of love for Clay Adams and Alexandre O. Philippe.

So far, we have seven successful Kickstarters under our belts. (And between us we have a lot of belts. ) So, we're stoked to return to the scene of the crime.

Clay is a writer and filmmaker who's funded seven projects on Kickstarter with FRIED Comics. His feature script, THE ECLIPSE, placed second in the horror category of the FADEIn Awards, and his latest comic, ELECTRIC YOUTH, co-written with Kyle Roberts, was recently featured in the LA Times. He has written and directed for television and holds a BFA in Dramatic Writing from NYU. When Clay first met Alexandre, he thought, "My, what a sophisticated European." Boy, was he wrong!

Film nerd/director Alexandre's most recent documentary is LEAP OF FAITH: WILLIAM FRIEDKIN ON THE EXORCIST. He holds a Masters Degree in Dramatic Writing from NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts and has written and directed numerous award-winning films and documentaries, including MEMORY: THE ORIGINS OF ALIEN, 78/52: HITCHCOCK'S SHOWER SCENE, AND THE PEOPLE vs. GEORGE LUCAS. When Alexandre first met Clay, he thought, "My, what a stupid American." Boy, was he right!

Leila is a comic book artist and writer living in Portland, Oregon. She draws SLEEPLESS, SHUTTER and writes AFAR at Image Comics. Leila has drawn for titles such as THE WICKED + THE DIVINE, SCARLET WITCH, AMERICAN VAMPIRE, and THE PANTHEON PROJECT. In 2015 and 2016, Leila was nominated for the Russ Manning Promising Newcomer Award for her work on SHUTTER. She only took this job because she thought she'd be paid in fries.

Brett Nienburg is a Denver-based artist who has worked as a concept artist for LEGO and  designed sets for feature films. We're sorry we made him peel so many potatoes. He looks pretty sad about it.

Charles is from Canada, so we imagine he looks like one of those flappy-headed dudes from South Park.* He has lettered books for Aftershock, Image, IDW and Top Shelf (among others) and is a founding member of Frozen Beach Studios. (*As far as we know, Charles has a normal-looking head.) 

Ugh. Just... ugh.

The Package

We've gotten our fair share of comics that arrived mangled by the mail carrier.

You pay premium prices on crowdfunding sites, and you deserve better. That's why we've started using Gemini Comic Mailers:

These babies are sturdy. They require a little more money, a little more time (and a lot more tape!) but it's worth it to make sure your comics arrive in pristine condition.

And if somehow your comic still gets roughed up?

Frieda will replace it free of charge.

 

Why Crowdfunding?

We are crowdfunding to put the first two issues into print. The book is 100% complete, our printer is still operating as an essential business, and we are ready to deliver quickly. We just need YOU to make it a reality.

All funds from this campaign will go to:

  • Printing rewards
  • Shipping them to you
  • Anything above our goal goes towards making more comics

Image copyright Can Stock Photo / pressmaster

THE TIMELINE

Book Goes to Printer: ~June 15

Book Printed and shipped to us ~June 30

Pack and ship - ~July 1

Expected delivery to US backers - 2 Weeks (Early July)

Expected delivery for International Backers - 4 Weeks (late July)

THANKS, HON!

We're not asking for a million dollars.

We just want to put a cool book in your hand and entertain you for a bit during these crazy times.

So find a pledge level you like and pre-order. We'll make more comics.

Thanks for supporting! And remember...

Risks and challenges

The book is 100% finished. Our printer is considered an essential business, so it is up and running and we aim to fulfill this project fast. Right now, the biggest risk is that the postal service will see disruptions over the summer due to lack of funding. We sincerely hope this won't be a problem... but if it is, we'll get your books to you via an alternate service.

story:
Children’s comics against floods,

 books for clean rivers


What happened?

A low pressure area named “Yvette” or “Tamara” caused flooding in the Balkans area between 14th and 16th of May 2014. The rainfall in Croatia, Serbia and Bosnia and Herzegovina was the heaviest in the 120 years of meteorological records. Rains, torrents and mudslides raised water levels, which led to the flooding of the surrounding lowlands. The flooding waters caused 2,000 landslides throughout the southeast of Europe. Over 2 million people were indirectly affected by the 2014 floods. Thousands of animals were left underwater. The flora was covered in mud for months.

The floods were caused by nature. The consequent damages were largely the fault of authorities and people. Lack of funds means there are practically no preventative measures carried out. The levees weakened by gravel excavation are old 50 years and upwards. The riverbeds and drainage and flood control canals are not cleaned regularly. The population throws different kinds of waste into the canals and rivers: plastic bottles, bags, paper, glass, food and hygienic product leftovers. We are directly endangering our life and environment, polluting water, soil and air. Floating garbage islands are created, then dispersed throughout the planet by flooding rivers.


What are we going to do about it?

The Waters of Balkans Project aims to publish a book featuring children’s comics on the topic of the floods created in workshops in the towns of Gunja (Republic of Croatia), Obrenovac (Republic of Serbia) and Maglaj and Doboj (Bosnia and Herzegovina) during 2015.

The book also features honest stories about life during the floods, photographs of the damages caused by the floods and photographs of the polluted rivers’ beds.

The 156-page A4 size book in colour, in the three countries’ languages and with English translation, will be passed out to children and youth in the aforementioned towns in exchange for 5 used plastic bottles (PET packing) or 5 pieces of PE-LD packing (flexible bottles, bread and frozen food bags,…).

The primary goal is to gradually build the consciousness among the children and youth to stop throwing waste into the rivers and in that way act preventatively against flood damages.

Our organised workshops helped the children to free themselves from trauma and fears of floods in a creative manner, by gathering waste we give them an opportunity to teach us adults to respect nature.


How can you contribute?

The total planned budget to carry out the project is USD 4,000 out of which USD 3,000 we plan to get through crowdsourcing on the Indiegogo crowdfunding platform. The collected funds will be spent on printing 1500 books that we will pass out to children in the four aforementioned towns in exchange for plastic waste.

All additional collected funds will be invested in printing of further copies, promotions, exhibitions and collecting plastic packaging in a series of towns lying by the bed of Bosna, then rivers Morava, Sava and others. The project would be conducted for years with the goal to raise the ecological awareness of the people of this area and elsewhere as much as possible. Clean rivers mean life, for us and for the generations to come. 


Projects stages

Balkan Waters projects will be implemented in several stages. First we will hand in the books in return for waste at locations where we did the comic workshops. After that, the initiative will expand to river Bosnia, Morava and Sava.


We got some goodies for you!




Balkan Waters Comic Book Preview



                                                            Who are we?


Association of Comic Fans StripOs Osijek, founded in 2009 with the main goal of preserving comic heritage and foster creative endeavours of children and youth. The idea of creating a regional humanitarian-ecological project to encompass the areas of Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina and Serbia struck with the 2014 floods was born while arranging Children’s Comic Festival in Gunja in 2015.

The 156-page A4 size book in colour, in the three countries’ languages and with English translation, will be passed out to children and youth in the aforementioned towns in exchange for 5 used plastic bottles (PET packing) or 5 pieces of PE-LD packing (flexible bottles, bread and frozen food bags,…).
The primary goal is to gradually build the consciousness among the children and youth to stop throwing waste into the rivers and in that way act preventatively against flood damages.
Our organised workshops helped the children to free themselves from trauma and fears of floods in a creative manner, by gathering waste we give them an opportunity to teach us adults to respect nature.



How can you contribute?
The total planned budget to carry out the project is USD 4,000 out of which USD 3,000 we plan to get through crowdsourcing on the Indiegogo crowdfunding platform. The collected funds will be spent on printing 1500 books that we will pass out to children in the four aforementioned towns in exchange for plastic waste.
All additional collected funds will be invested in printing of further copies, promotions, exhibitions and collecting plastic packaging in a series of towns lying by the bed of Bosna, then rivers Morava, Sava and others. The project would be conducted for years with the goal to raise the ecological awareness of the people of this area and elsewhere as much as possible. Clean rivers mean life, for us and for the generations to come. 


Projects stages
Balkan Waters projects will be implemented in several stages. First we will hand in the books in return for waste at locations where we did the comic workshops. After that, the initiative will expand to river Bosnia, Morava and Sava.



We got some goodies for you!
Balkan Waters Comic Book Preview




















                                                            Who are we?

Association of Comic Fans StripOs Osijek, founded in 2009 with the main goal of preserving comic heritage and foster creative endeavours of children and youth. The idea of creating a regional humanitarian-ecological project to encompass the areas of Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina and Serbia struck with the 2014 floods was born while arranging Children’s Comic Festival in Gunja in 2015.

story:
This is the preorder/fundraiser for "IN THE LAVENDER" it will be a full colour 100+ page graphic novel.

 

below - a test colour page.

below 

IN THE LAVENDER, is a story that has something for everyone.  Whether you are into  Steampunk, zombies, pirates, or the post apocalyptic setting, or even if you love action and adventure, this graphic novel has it all.  It is horror, action, comedy and drama all rolled into one!  The story follows a group of heros aboard their flying steamship after they have stumbled across some technology that far surpasses the steampunk world they live in.  The heros believe this new found technology could be a weapon capable of destroying the evil corporation that currently rules the entire planet and its resources. So, they set out to take them down. However, this newly found technology is in the form of a reanimated brain, fitted into a steampunk/cyber mechanical body.  All hell breaks loose once everyone else finds out about this "discovered technology." Everyone from pirates to underground machine cultists want it for themselves. Suddenly, the crew finds themselves in a very complicated situation.

   IN THE LAVENDER is a very well thought out and indepth story.  It has a lot of very intricate plot lines, and story twists and turns that will keep you guessing and wanting more!  The main story though is about the steampunk zombie and how he is a regular guy from the year 2015 ish and his personal struggles in life.  He deals with the same things we all deal with: trying to discover his place in the world, trying to fit in, while facing his own inner demons as well as dealing with misplaced trust and a slew of other problems we all have in life. This isn't a story about the world of tomorrow, or zombies, or robots.  It is a story about you, me, the human condition and how we all are as people.  Just so happens the future is filled with awesome explosions, flying ships, massive mechanical cities, hordes of zombies, and a pile of steam ran everything!!! Welcome to the world of IN THE LAVENDER!

   The title In the Lavender comes from a victorian slang term meaning "dead." The  story was written by myself (Eric Xton) and co written by my wife April. Most of the art is done by me, but, there will be many amazing guest artists from around the world helping out, like Josh Falls, Lidia Misfit, Travis Sharpe and colour work by Ryan Mihandoost of Colossal Robot .  All very talented artists!  Also, I will be updating this campaign regularly to keep everyone up to date.  Please bear with me, as I am new at this fund raising for projects thing lol.  Thank you for your interest!

 (below is a finished panel from the book)

 

What We Need & What You Get

   I'm shooting for $10,000. after this site takes its fees , the rest will go to the production,marketing and shipping of the graphic novel, as well as the perks being made. whats left will go to the artists and editors for their work provided. We will have stretch goals up, so if we make more than we need we will make it worth everyones while, and we will also put back into the indiegogo comunity, helping to support other peoples dreams into reality.   

 

below - one of our crew, shes sweet , gullable and totally in love with a cowboy, but can love really survive in the lavender? We will see ....

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

   Your contribution to this campaign will make or break this dream of mine.  I simply cannot do this without you!  To be 100% honest here.  I don't have some cool success story to tell about how my last comic made it world-wide and I'm some super famous special person... I'm not...  I'm just some guy, trying to make something happen that I've always dreamed about doing. 

   I know that sites like this one have had some "shady" people use the system and get paid then disappear.  I really hope that a couple of bad apples dont ruin it for the ones like me, who really just want a chance to make it happen.  I'm linked with Facebook so I"m easy to track down. I'm not a hard person to find lol.  So, in that I hope that to some level after reading all this and watching the video you get how real I am about what I'm doing here.  I really hope you decide to support this graphic novel of mine , if so fantastic!!!  If not then please check out some of the other pages here you'll probably find a couple of others you might want to get involved in, there are a lot of good ideas here that need help.

(below is another finished panel from the book - colour by:Ryan Mihandoost)

THE RISKS? : Honestly, I can't think of any. I will make this happen no matter what. With the funding support however it will make everythign so much easier, and better!  

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

  Please share this with somone you know, or maybe a group you're in that might like it, if at all possible.  Just please help spread the word on a little.  It would be very much appreciated and could mean the difference between failure and sucess for me.  Indiegogo has some share tools to make it easier, check em out!

Thank you very much for taking a look at what I'm doing !!!!

here are some pics of early designs, enjoy!

 below - the clockwork captain, a standard clockworker robot corrupted into thinking its a old time pirate captian. He has a ship, a ruthless crew, and runs off coal, seems like a real pirate captain to me ....

 

 below - the cowboy hero of the story, comes just in time to save the day, save our crew, and save the love of his life .....

 

 

 

below - one of the cyber zombie half breeds that our hero must face!

below - the main bad guy, I mean girl, after stumbling upon a old museum of nazi propoganda she decides to follow suit. She creates the new reich, and wants to purify the human race through machines !

Thank you very much for taking a look at what I'm doing !!!!

story:
*Flexible Funding means that regardless of whether we meet our goal, Indiegogo will still send us the amount we have raised and we will cover the rest of the costs.  You will still receive rewards and they will still be sent out on time.*

About the Graphic Novel

Technologically primitive tribes steeped in tradition populate a world that is vicious and beautiful.  They band together in territories in an attempt to survive against a populace of other animals that threaten to overwhelm their numbers.  There is no top of the food chain in a constant power struggle against nature.  However, the tribes still greatly respect the natural world and the creatures that inhabit it.  Individuals show their deference through the creation of unique headdresses or masks crafted from hunts and through the worship of sacred animal spirits as gods.

In the Meadowlark Basin, Elder Grovvik recounts a tale of the Jun’tari tribe’s survival to three warriors.  Without the combined efforts of their ancients, the Jun’tari would have fallen during the chaos of the Great Migration, when a demi-god spirit appeared and stirred the movement of an entire species.  Learning lessons from the past is integral to survival, and these warriors must internalize the message before they can attain their place as members of the hunt, an ancient ritual that signifies the passing from childhood to adulthood.

Journey through the history of the Jun’tari, their outlandish practices, and struggle for survival in a world that is unforgiving to error.  Discover the respect they hold for the past and dedication to the survival of future generations. Explore a foreign world where overlooking the intelligence of any creature can be detrimental to survival.

Behind the Idea

We are college students that met by chance during a year of college at UW-La Crosse.  We traveled separate directions but kept in contact and have wanted to collaborate on a project that represents the skill sets we have developed.  In building this concept from the ground-up, we have fed on the ideas of one another to propel the project further.  Through the work on the graphic novel, we are striving to develop a piece that both of us can use for our career portfolios that encapsulates our potential as artists in different mediums while delivering something unique to readers. We need $600 so that we can do this project without going under due to taking off work and paying rent. The money will be used solely to get the project done while we pay for everything else out of pocket. The hope was to find help in order to finish a graphic novel by those that believe in young artists at a limited cost.

About the Creators

Donnie Stephens is a Junior Majoring in Illustration with a minor in Painting at the University of Illinois at Chicago. Medium of choice is mainly watercolor and ink with adaptations digitally. When Donnie isn’t sketching and painting he’s working, being a captain of the UIC men’s Ultimate Frisbee team, or trying not to spend money at the local comic book store.

Mitch Marty is a senior majoring in English Rhetoric & Writing (with a minor in Creative Writing) from the University of Wisconsin – La Crosse.  He has written flash fiction, short stories, and campaign settings for d20-based tabletop games.  When he isn’t writing, you may catch him hiking or rock climbing in the bluffs that overlook the marshes and the Mississippi.
You can view samples of his writing at http://mitchnmarty.wordpress.com/

Furthermore

We would like to extend our sincere thanks for taking the time to check out our project as well as for your support.  If you can’t contribute financially, you can still help us by spreading the word.  Please feel free to repost this to twitter, facebook, your blog, or anywhere else you can think of.

If you donate at the $50 mark, please email us with your choice of animal for the watercolor painting and poem.  If you donate at the $100 mark, please email us with your choice of headdress or mask animal.  Contact us at donnieandmitch@gmail.com.

story:
to the crowdfunding campaign for the printed version of the web-comic Monsieur Charlatan!!!

    

 

You can read the whole story at monsieur-charlatan.com!

 

Here's some awesome perks you can get from your contribution!

This campaign will run on fixed goal and all the expenses are solely purposed to fund the printing, postage material, shipping and Indiegogo's commission costs (including taxes). The physical edition of Monsieur Charlatan is a full color 211 pages of comic in A4 size and since it's already finished you won't have to wait too long for your copy once the campaign is successfully funded!          

For every contribution  over 5 euros, you will receive a PDF with concept art , along with a 1920x1080 wallpaper of Monsieur Charlatan!!!

   

Concept Art PDF                                               1920x1080 wallpaper

There's a great variety of perks, mostly original art, but have a look and choose the most appropriate for you!

           Here's your choice of perks:

  • Thanks on Monsieur Charlatan's Facebook page!

 

  • eBook (PDF) of the comic along with a PDF of various concept art images!

 

  • The book + eBook (PDF) + two Monsieur Charlatan's bookmarks!

 

  • The book + eBook (PDF) + two bookmarks + one (1) A5 black and white print in thick paper (please check the gallery with the samples of the images-These will be sent randomly let us know if you have a preference)!

  • The book + eBook (PDF) + two bookmarks +  five (5) A5 black and white prints in thick paper!

 

 

  • Signed book + eBook (PDF) + two bookmarks + two (2) A4 fanart posters from G.Doutsiopoulos and C.Papatheodorou! 

 

 

  • Signed book + eBook (PDF)+ two bookmarks+ two (2) A4 variant posters

 

 

  • Signed book + eBook (PDF) + two bookmarks + one (1)  A5 sketch of a character from the comic in thick paper!

 

  • Signed book + eBook (PDF) + two bookmarks + two (2)  A5 sketches from a character from the comic in thick paper!

 

 

  • Signed book + eBook (PDF) + two bookmarks+ one (1) A4 inked sketch of a character of your choice in bristol paper!

 

 

  • Signed book + eBook (PDF)+ two bookmarks + two (2) inked A4 sketches of characters of your choice in bristol paper!

 

  • Signed book + eBook (PDF) + two bookmarks + one (1) penciled original page of your choice from the comic in A4 bristol paper!

 

 

  • Signed book + eBook (PDF) + two bookmarks +all four (4) A4 posters from the comic + one (1) A4 sketch of a character of your choice + two A5 (2) sketches from characters of the comic + three (3) A5 black and white prints in thick paper! 

 

 

  • Signed Book + eBook (PDF) + two Bookmarks + All four (4) A4 Posters + Three (3) A5 inked sketches of characters from the comic + Two (2) A4 colored sketches + One (1) inked page of your choice from the comic in A4 size

 

  

 

 

But what is this web-comic "Monsieur Charlatan" I hear you ask?

Monsieur Charlatan is a historical noir  web-comic, set up in Paris of 1931. It's a project that begun 5 years ago and was only recently completed! This campaign is purposed to fund its printing costs as a full graphic novel! You can read the whole comic online here! (but be informed: the last chapter will only be available in the printed version!) 211 pages of drama, suspence, and suicidal tendencies. Lots of them!

Who is Isidore Charlatan and what is this comic about?

Monsieur Charlatan takes place in Paris of the early 1930s; the title character was once a celebrated private detective who solved cases in both Europe and the States. Made penniless by the Wall Street Crash and deserted by his fiancée, Adeline the comic opens with Charlatan contemplating suicide in his family home.

(It's a close -way too close- shave for Isidore)

The plot soon starts to unfold as Charlatan saves the life of his ex-fiancée who is now the wife of a wheelchair bound Parisian mobster, the Count.

 

(Khaaaaaaaann!!!)

Things escalate from there and Charlatan is soon forced to solve the mystery behind the attack on his ex-fiancée as the life of his good friend (and secret admirer) Magda is put in danger by an assassin, who sidelines as a University Professor, and  plays a significant part in the whole plot.

 

(He really does)

The story may be set in Paris, but there are flashbacks to New Orleans and plenty of action sequences to rival a Hollywood Blockbuster with daring balcony escapes, car chases . . . or rather a bicycle chasing a car; all leading up to the dramatic showdown, which takes place underground in the Parisian catacombs!

 

(Is that a skull in your hands,or are you just glad to see me?)

With Absinthe hallucinations, love scenes and wanton brutality all making their mark upon the story, Monsieur Charlatan is a rip-roaring adventure laced with some humor that is sure to leave you breathless and on the edge of your comfy sofa as you read!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

(Isidore doing his cardio through Paris)

Monsieur Charlatan has gained a considerable audience and has also won two Deviantart awards. You can find articles about it on Freaking Awesome Network, Pretty Cool Wecomics , Grekamag and Comicdom.gr which included it amongst the best web-comics!

 

This project is a web-comic that began in 2011 and finished in 2016. It goes without saying, that throughout these years of actively updating, there has been an improvement of style page after page which will be intentionally left in the final product.

 

About the creator

I have studied computer animation and hold a Masters Degree with Distinction from the Bristol School of Animation in the UK. After finishing my studies I settled down in Athens, Greece, where I have worked in numerous projects storyboarding, animating and in-betweening for films and TV commercials, illustrating children's educational books and last but not least creating comics.

You can see more of my work in the following links

instagram

tumblr

deviantart

facebook

Monsieur Charlatan was a personal project, which started off as a hobby and quickly evolved into some sort of a part time job!  With your help this can go from a web-comic hobby to a physical graphic novel!

Follow Monsieur Charlatan on Facebook for news and updates!

 

  

 

 

For every contribution of 5‎€ and above, a PDF with concept art will be sent, along with a wallpaper of Monsieur Charlatan!!!

Have a look at some samples!

 

 

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • add the campaign to your favorites
  • use social media to help spread the word
  • the more comments left on this campaign the more popular it becomes, so keep chatting lads!
  • if you have a blog website or feel like writing something about this project please do, and gain eternal blessings

Now go and make some noise!

 

 

Risks and challenges

This campaign is my first attempt raising money through a crowdfunding platform and although every possible parameter is taken into account, some issues might arise that are not scheduled.

I will be available to answer any questions you might have and I will keep you fully updated for the process as we go. Follow Monsieur Charaltan's page on Facebook for more immediate  I ask for your patience and your support!

 


_______________________________________________________________

Special Thanks for their help to:

Kostas Skiftas for Animation Editing and Composition

Spoiler Alert  for Promo Video Production

Ian Thomas Brocklehurst for proofreading  the comic and campaign and writing the synopsis

DNA lab for the music of Monsieur Charlatan's webpage

Eleni Valtinou for pagination

Dimitra Christodoulopoulou  & John Tselas for their invaluable help

Special thanks to George Doutsiopoulos and  Costis Papatheodorou for allowing me to use their art as perks

Signed book + eBook (PDF) + two bookmarks + one (1) penciled original page of your choice from the comic in A4 bristol paper!
 
 

Signed book + eBook (PDF) + two bookmarks +all four (4) A4 posters from the comic + one (1) A4 sketch of a character of your choice + two A5 (2) sketches from characters of the comic + three (3) A5 black and white prints in thick paper! 
 
 

Signed Book + eBook (PDF) + two Bookmarks + All four (4) A4 Posters + Three (3) A5 inked sketches of characters from the comic + Two (2) A4 colored sketches + One (1) inked page of your choice from the comic in A4 size
 
  

 

 
But what is this web-comic "Monsieur Charlatan" I hear you ask?
Monsieur Charlatan is a historical noir  web-comic, set up in Paris of 1931. It's a project that begun 5 years ago and was only recently completed! This campaign is purposed to fund its printing costs as a full graphic novel! You can read the whole comic online here! (but be informed: the last chapter will only be available in the printed version!) 211 pages of drama, suspence, and suicidal tendencies. Lots of them!
Who is Isidore Charlatan and what is this comic about?
Monsieur Charlatan takes place in Paris of the early 1930s; the title character was once a celebrated private detective who solved cases in both Europe and the States. Made penniless by the Wall Street Crash and deserted by his fiancée, Adeline the comic opens with Charlatan contemplating suicide in his family home.

(It's a close -way too close- shave for Isidore)
The plot soon starts to unfold as Charlatan saves the life of his ex-fiancée who is now the wife of a wheelchair bound Parisian mobster, the Count.
 

(Khaaaaaaaann!!!)
Things escalate from there and Charlatan is soon forced to solve the mystery behind the attack on his ex-fiancée as the life of his good friend (and secret admirer) Magda is put in danger by an assassin, who sidelines as a University Professor, and  plays a significant part in the whole plot.
 

(He really does)
The story may be set in Paris, but there are flashbacks to New Orleans and plenty of action sequences to rival a Hollywood Blockbuster with daring balcony escapes, car chases . . . or rather a bicycle chasing a car; all leading up to the dramatic showdown, which takes place underground in the Parisian catacombs!
 

(Is that a skull in your hands,or are you just glad to see me?)
With Absinthe hallucinations, love scenes and wanton brutality all making their mark upon the story, Monsieur Charlatan is a rip-roaring adventure laced with some humor that is sure to leave you breathless and on the edge of your comfy sofa as you read!

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
(Isidore doing his cardio through Paris)

Monsieur Charlatan has gained a considerable audience and has also won two Deviantart awards. You can find articles about it on Freaking Awesome Network, Pretty Cool Wecomics , Grekamag and Comicdom.gr which included it amongst the best web-comics!
 

This project is a web-comic that began in 2011 and finished in 2016. It goes without saying, that throughout these years of actively updating, there has been an improvement of style page after page which will be intentionally left in the final product.
 
About the creator

I have studied computer animation and hold a Masters Degree with Distinction from the Bristol School of Animation in the UK. After finishing my studies I settled down in Athens, Greece, where I have worked in numerous projects storyboarding, animating and in-betweening for films and TV commercials, illustrating children's educational books and last but not least creating comics.
You can see more of my work in the following links
 instagram
 tumblr
 deviantart
 facebook 
Monsieur Charlatan was a personal project, which started off as a hobby and quickly evolved into some sort of a part time job!  With your help this can go from a web-comic hobby to a physical graphic novel!

Follow Monsieur Charlatan on Facebook for news and updates!
 


  
 
 

For every contribution of 5‎€ and above, a PDF with concept art will be sent, along with a wallpaper of Monsieur Charlatan!!!
Have a look at some samples!
 
  




  
 
Other Ways You Can Help
I understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

add the campaign to your favorites
use social media to help spread the word
the more comments left on this campaign the more popular it becomes, so keep chatting lads!
if you have a blog website or feel like writing something about this project please do, and gain eternal blessings

Now go and make some noise!
 
 
Risks and challenges
This campaign is my first attempt raising money through a crowdfunding platform and although every possible parameter is taken into account, some issues might arise that are not scheduled. 
I will be available to answer any questions you might have and I will keep you fully updated for the process as we go. Follow Monsieur Charaltan's page on Facebook for more immediate  I ask for your patience and your support!
 
_______________________________________________________________
Special Thanks for their help to:
Kostas Skiftas for Animation Editing and Composition
Spoiler Alert  for Promo Video Production
Ian Thomas Brocklehurst for proofreading  the comic and campaign and writing the synopsis
DNA lab for the music of Monsieur Charlatan's webpage
Eleni Valtinou for pagination 
Dimitra Christodoulopoulou  & John Tselas for their invaluable help 
Special thanks to George Doutsiopoulos and  Costis Papatheodorou for allowing me to use their art as perks

story:
Summary

Hi there! Thanks for taking an interest in the fundraiser! My name is Derrek Buerger, and today I present to you, a fundraiser to help my next COMIC SERIES, Realms.

Realms is basically about 4 different people having to go out and save the world. They all begin with their own distinctive quests that they have been assigned to, whether it was personal or destined. They all embark on their quests. But later on, they all come to realize that what they want is missing, then the weird stuff happens.

The title Realms is coming from a Minecraft Project I recently had an idea for, but realized it was a bit too small for me to work with minecraft. So, as a way better way to do this project, I wanted it to be a series of Flash Animations with unique music for each part, and create an amazing story with it. That's pretty much everything in a nutshell.

To view what REALMS is like so far, you can go here!: http://www.aimlessadventures.com/

What We Need & What You Get

I'm asking $1000 for the series to be made. This is so I can hire others to help out, such as with art, music, and QUITE POSSIBLY, flash games (if we ever decide to try it).

Getting $1000 means a lot to me, as I will have the resources to make Realms amazing as possible. Resources include hiring Musicians, Artists, and quite possibly Flash Programmers. When you contribute to the project, there will be rewards for your donation. For example, you donate $15, and you get the Soundtrack, Stickers, and a Special Thanks in the end of the first Flash Animation for Realms.

NOTE FOR SPECIAL THANKS: When you pledge $1 or more, your name will go on AimlessAdventures.com in the Special Thanks section under the About Tab. We look forward to seeing your name there!

The Impact

Making Realms is a major goal of mine. I've always had an interest in webcomics, and can remember as far back as 2006 when I discovered VG Cats, and other things about the internet too. Then I discovered other things, such as Eddsworld, Newgrounds, other Media that would scream to me to make Media for the internet as well. I wanna make this to show the world another great webcomic that will have people begging for more. Donating will surely bring my dreams just a bit closer to becoming a reality.

Here's a little track-record of what I've done: I've made 2 Game Grump animations and they have a collaborated view count of over 150,000 views. I'm somewhat known, and I rarely get negative feedback on the things I do now. I also have made No-Brainer, which was a cartoon that had about 4 episodes, with a 5th one mentioned that I WAS working on for quite some time, but never went through with it. That's my only set back.

Pledging to this campaign will help me step foot into professional territory (hopefully) and allow me to do actual business with others, and set up and amazing story for all of you to watch, FOR FREE.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate? Just share this thing around and hopefully we make it! We'll need as much support for this project than ever imagined. A $1000 Goal isn't asking much. If your already a fan of what I do, go contact others and tell them what's happening here right now!!

Preview Images!!

 

FAN OF THE GAME GRUMPS ANIMATIONS?????? CHECK THIS ISHT OUT.

story:
When the zombie apocalypse finally happens..

Hello there!  My name is Jennifer.  I am based out of Sunnyvale CA and I have just recently graduated from the Academy of Art.  Zombie Killers is something I've been working on since January in the hopes of bringing it to a comics convention.  My entire life, I have admired graphic art and comics.  Even through art school as an animator, I kept going back to comics.  Well, after so many attempts at getting a comic going to no avail, I've finally been able to create a full first edition!  I have always been a little bit shy about sharing my art.  Especially when it comes to something like a comic book, they really depend on their readers to become successful. When I got the opportunity to go to the Alternative Press Expo, I was really nervous but also overjoyed.  Now that I have made the commitment I am hoping to raise the money to cover the costs of the table and printing copies of my comic.  If all goes well, I hope that Zombie Killers will bring a little bit of fun and campiness into lots of peoples lives.


If this campaign succeeds...

The success of my campaign would mean that I would better be able to afford to go to the Alternative Press Expo.  If unable to reach my goal, I will be out a good chunk of money and due to my financial situation, might not be able to print a second book.  Obviously, I will be happy just that I get to go whether anyone is willing to help me or not!  However, the donations would be deeply appreciated.


Yeah, but what do I get??

Well, I have lots of fun and somewhat weird treats for helping me out in my little endeavor!  For each $5 donation you get a sketch of your choice.  $15  A full illustration or techno-art of your choice.  $30 Gets you a full illustration or techno-art of your choice along with the signed comic.  At the $75 mark, you will get the comic, art, and a FABULOUS zombie themed gift basket full of wonderful apocalypse survival prizes!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help me out financially, that's ok!  I would really appreciate it though if you could get the word out.  Zombie Killers is a fledgling project and it would mean the world to me if someday it could be enjoyed by people all over!

story:
Hello Indiegogo/ARH Readers!

We are Hazel and Bell, the duo behind Always Raining Here. We're raising money to publish the first volume of our webcomic in print, which has been a work in progress for the last year and a half! It will be a 96-page long, full colour paperback book.

With your donations, we will be able to see our hard work in a physical medium and if you donate enough, you will be able to get a copy for yourself!

We're going to need $5500 to get ARH in print.  All the money at this point is going towards the printing of the books, which includes taxes, shipping to us, and indiegogo fees. When we're done, it will be in full colour, perfect bound and professionally done.

If you participate in the fundraiser/preorder and donate $25 or more, you automatically receive a copy of Always Raining Here v.1. The book itself is 20 dollars, and the five dollars includes shipping to Canada and the US (we ship elsewhere, but it costs a little more). If you donate more, you can get extra perks that range from author signatures to keychains, tote bags and original work like sketches and hand written fiction. This fundraiser takes both paypal and credit card, and you don't even need an account to donate to us!

We have set out 35 days for this pre-order - so you basically have until the end of this fundraiser to order this comic. If we don't reach our full goal by the deadline, we'll still use the funds we raise for printing, and everyone will get the perks they donated for, but we will probably end up doing a smaller run.

On the other hand, if we reach our goal before the fundraiser is over, we will post exclusive short stories and other bonus content we wouldn't otherwise post!

***September 8th, 2012: We've reached our funding goal!!***

Thank you so much everyone for helping us get to this point. We have spent the last two weeks compiling the volume for print, so we'll be glad to see all our hard work printed! We will post some bonus stuff for you guys in a few days, but in the meantime Bell and I are just scrambling putting the last peices together for the volume. 

Also, if you're still interested in donating now that we've reached our goal, please do! The 5500 we raised merely covers printing costs + shipping to us and taxes. Any money raised beyond this will go directly towards the other prizes we're giving out here and other shipping costs! Every dollar helps.

***Update September 11th, 2012: Bonus Print if we reach 7,000!***

As the 5500 dollars we raised will only cover the bare-minimum cost of printing the books, we decided to set another goal to help cover the rest of the costs (fees/prints/keychains/totebags). As a gift to you guys, we will be giving out a free exclusive pre-order only print to everyone who purchases a print version of the book if we reach 7,000 before the end of the fundraiser! Scroll below to the prizes section to check it out. 

If you can't contribute anything to our fundraiser but you want to help out anyways, you can spread the word! We need all the help we can get, and extra coverage would be lovely. Tell your friends, family, or anyone else you think might be interested in our project. Indiegogo also has social media sharing tools that make that sort of thing pretty easy.


Thank you so much for checking this out and spreading the word!

Bell and Hazel

If you are interested and want to read the comic, you can check it out for free at:

wwww.alwaysraininghere.com

-----

More Prize info:

The Book: 96 pages of full colour goodness. Soft cover and perfect bound, includes the main story of the comic (which you can read on the website!) as well as 10 bonus pages. Currently, the book cover is TBA. :) Check back in a week or so for the updated cover. Rest assured, it's going to look good! PDF versions also available upon request with purchase of the book! To be shipped November 2012.

Prints: Prints are 8.5x11 and printed on high-qaulity matte photo paper. Qauntities include: 1 print: Cloudbreak print 3 prints: Cloudbreak print + Rainbow print + Summer print

**Bonus: if we reach 7000, we'll be giving everyone who ordered a printed version of the book a free exclusive pre-order only print with their copy! edit: Nevermind 7000, we'll be giving this away regardless!

(click for bigger)

Keychains: cute chibi Carter and Adrian acrylic charms!

Buttons: There are Carter and Adrian chibi buttons.We will also have other buttons that are TBA - most likely quotes, and other things!

Stickers: We will have Carter and Adrian chibi sticker sheets.

Tote Bag: It will be a tan colour with a print of chibi Carter and Adrian on it + raindrops.

Poster: Big poster of Adrian and Carter to have on your wall (wide cover image with them falling). 

T-shirt: Raindrops, Adrian and Carter all on one T-shirt.

Commissions details:

Art Commissions from Hazel are in limited qauntity. Hazel will draw one to two characters, Always Raining Here, fanart or your original characters, digitally coloured with a simple background or hand drawn and coloured with markers. Example. We can discuss what time I'll be doing this, but it'll probably be some time around late October/early November. I will send you the file and and print out a nice copy with your order, or send you the original if it's hand-drawn.

Story Commissions from Bell will be varying from 500-5000 words depending on donation. They are limited to Always Raining Here content (I can't sell fanfiction that would be bad!) and everything will be considered non-canon. You can request any prompt as detailed as you would like. I withold the right to make any sex scene fade out at any point in time. We can discuss the rating and content (I'm fine with writing violence and other intense situations, but generally I won't write porn unless you donate like 500 bucks).

Shipping Details:

Shipping for the comic is included for comics going to the US + Canada. If you're international, please add 10 dollars to help us with shipping fees! We will ship anywhere. Keep in mind that books will be sent via regular post. 

NOTE: If you've already contributed, but forgot to add shipping, you can add it by clicking "Contribute now" and scrolling to the bottom of the list and selecting "No perk, just a contribution" and put 10 dollars for international orders. Thanks you!

UPDATE 2: Also, now that the campaign is over, if you're international and you FORGOT to add an extra 10 dollars to help with shipping costs, you can simple donate it to us using this link below:

Just be sure to include your name so we know who's it is. Thanks so much!

----

If you have any other questions or comments about anything regarding this fundraiser you can send us an email at hazelbell.arh @ gmail.com!

story:
The Craver story begins toward the end of WWII, in one of the infamous Nazi concentration camps. A little boy, one among many, is taken into Dr. Hans Schmidt's laboratory to be used as a human guinea pig in horrifying experiments, as part of the Nazis' search for a new and indestructible species, a new breed of warrior. What they create they could never have imagined and to their everlasting terror, they will never escape it. 

Follow this horrific and suspenseful tale of The Craver - find the truth about the Sons of Aaron - and pray that The Craver isn't coming for you. 

The story of The Craver was born in the mind of actor, comics enthusiast, and monster fanatic, B.E. Clark. He owes the inspiration for this comic book and (stay tuned!) the feature film which it will launch, to his dreams and to the Universal Monsters:  Frankenstein's Monster, Wolf Man, Creature From The Black Lagoon, The Mummy, etc. 

B.E.'s heart's desire is to make a new monster for this generation in tribute to those classic Universal Monsters.  He hopes to share with others how and why they captivated his imagination and illustrated the struggles between good and evil. When the rest of us heard this unique idea, we all knew that this was a project we needed to be a part of.

The Craver is a brave new look at history, monsters, good vs evil and the ways in which graphic novels can be used to present untold horror stories. The Craver is intended to be a film trilogy; the screenplay for the first movie is already completed, but we want to create the origin story in the comic book, then continue the unique storyline in the movies!   By the way, actor and super monster-portrayer Doug Jones has agreed to play The Craver  and is on board to help us launch the comic book.

In order to see our dream realized, we need your help!  We need to raise seed money to get this show on the road.

We have an amazingly talented team lined up for the comic book, including Writer: Erik Warfield; Artist: Tone Rodriguez; Co-creator (comic book): Anthony Lipe-Ladenheim and Creator: B.E. Clark. We are waiting for you, the fans, to help make this a reality. So, please join us in bringing The Craver to life and stay tuned for our updates from story plots to conceptual art! 

 Thank you!

  -  Team Craver

Examples of Tone Rodriguez' Art...
