The Craver story begins toward the end of WWII, in one of the infamous Nazi concentration camps. A little boy, one among many, is taken into Dr. Hans Schmidt's laboratory to be used as a human guinea pig in horrifying experiments, as part of the Nazis' search for a new and indestructible species, a new breed of warrior. What they create they could never have imagined and to their everlasting terror, they will never escape it. 
Follow this horrific and suspenseful tale of The Craver - find the truth about the Sons of Aaron - and pray that The Craver isn't coming for you. 
The story of The Craver was born in the mind of actor, comics enthusiast, and monster fanatic, B.E. Clark. He owes the inspiration for this comic book and (stay tuned!) the feature film which it will launch, to his dreams and to the Universal Monsters:  Frankenstein's Monster, Wolf Man, Creature From The Black Lagoon, The Mummy, etc. 
B.E.'s heart's desire is to make a new monster for this generation in tribute to those classic Universal Monsters.  He hopes to share with others how and why they captivated his imagination and illustrated the struggles between good and evil. When the rest of us heard this unique idea, we all knew that this was a project we needed to be a part of.
The Craver is a brave new look at history, monsters, good vs evil and the ways in which graphic novels can be used to present untold horror stories. The Craver is intended to be a film trilogy; the screenplay for the first movie is already completed, but we want to create the origin story in the comic book, then continue the unique storyline in the movies!   By the way, actor and super monster-portrayer Doug Jones has agreed to play The Craver  and is on board to help us launch the comic book.
In order to see our dream realized, we need your help!  We need to raise seed money to get this show on the road.
We have an amazingly talented team lined up for the comic book, including Writer: Erik Warfield; Artist: Tone Rodriguez; Co-creator (comic book): Anthony Lipe-Ladenheim and Creator: B.E. Clark. We are waiting for you, the fans, to help make this a reality. So, please join us in bringing The Craver to life and stay tuned for our updates from story plots to conceptual art! 
 Thank you!
  -  Team Craver
Examples of Tone Rodriguez' Art...

story:
10/11/15 - This Campaign is Still LIVE and Collecting Funds!


Goals and Stretch Goals!

Since the campaign was such a success, we're going to keep going to fund other projects. If you want to help, here's what we need to Keep GOING! Below is a list of the projects and proposed artist for each one. Happy hunting!

$1900

$1300

$650


The Deal:

Thanks to the help of many of you, we succeeded in funding the tenth episode of Peppermint Saga: Blue-Gray Rhapsody. But... would you like to see more? I thought you might.

Prettío is not the only artist I work with. Hell, even I draw stuff, hard as it is to believe. We are still trying to get more projects funded, and now that we are "InDemand", we can continue to raise funds to deliver finely crafted cartoon smut right to your virtual door.

What Do I Get?

You get high resolution digital copies, advance looks at works in progress, and the ability to harass me (legally!) on my podcast each week. I'm working on three different series, all of which need funding for various reasons. Peppermint Saga and Peppermint Saga: Blue-Gray Rhapsody will live on past episode 10, but if you want to see it more often, this is one of the places you can go to help!

Ok, Why Here?

Good question. The truth is, the alternative to forums like Indiegogo are places like Patreon. And while we have a seemingly thriving campaign there, it will only get us so far. 100% of the money earned there goes to funding the artists until we reach $800 per month. I still need to live, eat, pay rent, etc. Also, there's one other issue: Patreon won't allow us to use PayPal to collect funds because our campaign is a tad NSFW. So this is pretty much the only option left to us.

So... what now?

Easy. Our first goal was $650. If we double that ($1300), I will commission the next episode: "The Princess' New Clothes", and so on, as we hit each stretch goal milestone. Basically, we will keep track of when you donated, and adjust your reward according to when you joined the campaign, so you get the exact item you wanted.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Story

Samantha, a young teenage wallflower, discovers a dark and powerful form of Filipino folk magic called Kulam. Harnessing its dark power, Samantha takes revenge on those who have wronged her and to change her life for the better.  But the more Samantha uses the Kulam, the more things seem to go bump in the night.

Get involved and help back Hawaii’s own supernatural horror comic. The Rainbow state is about to get dark!

What We Plan to Do
The Hexing will be a thirty two page black & white, four part comic-series. Each issue will be fully crowd funded.  Majority of the first issue is already done. The money raised will help pay for an inker to add tones, printing issue 1,  and starting production on The Hexing Part 2: Fire with Fire.


 

Goal

We are asking for $6600 to make a our comic. This will cover the cost of printing, artwork, packing supplies, and processing fees. 

 

The Impact

By backing our project, you will help make the first supernatural horror comic, set entirely in Hawaii.  Not only are we making a horror comic, but we are introducing readers to a new world, rarely seen in print.  Exploring a more urban and gritter side of Hawaii. With characters that are true and authentic to the local people of Hawaii.  Yet, compelling for all readers to relate too.   

Risks & Challenges

One of the greatest risk to any crowdfunding is never getting your rewards.  Our campaign is unique in the sense that majority of our comic is done. We just need to get it into your hands! It will not take long to make our changes and send your comic to the printer.

To ensure that your prizes arrive on time, we will be shipping our rewards with USPS Flat Rate Boxes so that your package is insured and has a tracking number.

Some of the companies we are using to print our rewards are. Kablam Digital Printing, Budsies, Greco Printing, Teelaunch, and Pure Buttons. Each of these companies have a history of creating quality products and delivering on time.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not donate, but want to support our project.  Please Like and share our social media accounts. Also check out our website for all the latest updates. Where you can also read the first seven pages of our comic. 

www.thehexing.com

https://twitter.com/TheHexingComic/

https://www.instagram.com/thehexingcomic/

https://www.facebook.com/thehexing/

Sample Pages

 

The Team
Michael McGarvey: Writer & Creator 
Élan Heredia: Art

Jose Marzan: Inks/Backgrounds 
Shane Curran: Character Designs 
Andrew Wright: Assistant Editor

story:
ALL OR ANY DONATION IS GREATLY APPRECIATED! 

                                           No Donation is too small!

                                   Now with a Pre order Perk option!

With a $45 donation you can be one of the 100 preorder copies available!

You can pre order a copy of the super graphic novel The Fed: Accelerator! The novel will contain books 1, 2, and 3; also tons of drawings, pre production art! Fund this book and get a copy before anyone else!


The Fed is a 65 page B&W graphic novel. Follow Agent Butch Simms and his partner as they intimidate, blackmail, and murder to protect the elite and their masters. If you like the X-Files and Men in Black; these are the other guys. They bury the truth, at all cost.

"Deliriously written and maniacally drawn, this deranged tale gleefully throws you into the middle of an intergalactic saga without any explanation, rhyme or reason and expects you to hold on for the ride. And the ride is SO worth it! I eagerly await Volume 2. Oh, and if you didn't like clowns before, well, this book will do nothing to change your opinion."

The Fed 2 is a 78 page black and white adult themed graphic novel. Agent Butch Simms and his team are on the trail of some smuggled off-world tech loose on Earth. They are ambushed, their office attacked and their leader kidnapped. If you loved the Men in Black, and the X-Files; These are the other guys! They bury the truth!

"Tony Bourne did, that's who! This sequel to "The Fed" is well worth the read. The story begins to take on more of a life of its own as details from the first volume are fleshed out nicely. There's plenty of action and gore, but none of it is either gratuitous or out of place or character. There are also some great nods to science fiction of old and I simply can't wait for Volume 3."


My campaign is to fund the marketing and creation of a single massive graphic novel. I will combine the first two Fed books with the yet to be created third book into a huge hardcover complete graphic novel. The funding will allow me to print and market the novel outside the traditional distribution channels. To be a complete creator owned entity.

Your generous contributions to this campaign will help raise funds for the publication and distribution of the super graphic novel, The Fed: Accelerator. I have anticipated the need for approximately $20,000 to help support pre-publication, publication, and post publication costs. These costs include, but are not limited to editorial services ($500); Website creation,hosting and domain services ($500) online distribution and shipping ($2,000); initial print run of 1000 copies ($4500); and marketing and promotional services ($10,000). Needless to say this is a lot of cash, and I plan on adjusting my plan based on just how close I come to my goal.


Anthony Bourne trained to be a comic book artist in NYC where he was born. He has had several various careers; manager, artist, bouncer, and US Army Captain just to name a few. His first love has always been comics, sci-fi, and graphic novels. He currently lives in New Jersey and enjoys way too many hobbies.

Some of the gifts you will receive when you donate towards this project.

                                           $10 Donation NCC Victory


                                           $25 Donation The Tank




                                      $25 Donation The Machinegun team




Check out the perk page for the other great posters you will get with nice healthy fat donations!

story:
My name is Rachel Dukes. I’m an illustrator and have been and self-publishing comics for nearly ten years. I’m currently enrolled at the Center for Cartoon Studies, pursuing my MFA in cartooning.

Earlier this year, I wrote and illustrated an all-ages book “Frankie’s Busy Day” about my cat, Frankie. Frankie has been in my autobio comics over the years, but this was the first book that was completely about her. I hand-crafted eighty copies of the book this summer and I’ve already sold all but two copies. It’s time to reprint!

In addition to the second printing of “Frankie’s Busy Day,” I also want to debut a new comic: “Coffee Cats,” a story about a race of tiny cats who live in coffee trees and how they come to effect coffee and its consumers.

  • “Frankie’s Busy Day” is 28 pages in full color, with a three-colour silkscreened cover, and a decorative yarn bookmark. All copies will be signed and numbered. (Read a preview.)
  • “Coffee Cats” is 28 pages with black and white artwork. Also signed and numbered. (Read a preview.)


What We Need & What You Get:

I'm asking for $910 for this project. That will cover the cost of ordering materials for the books and incentives, printing costs for the books interiors, indiegogo fees, and shipping costs to get these goodies in your hands.

For helping fund these books going to production, I’m offering the following incentives:

  • PDFs of both books
  • Print copies of both books
  • Four silkscreened patches of Frankie
  • Four silkscreened stickers of Frankie
  • A button pack of Frankies
  • Original artwork from both books
  • Custom black and white commissions by yours truly

The Impact:

I love making comics and am truly proud of “Frankie’s Busy Day” and “Coffee Cats.” Being able to see these books in print, in the hands of people who will enjoy them, means the world to me.

The timing of these books going to production is also opportune because I just found out that I’ll be bringing Frankie home when I visit family on the west coast in a few weeks.

While the funds raised through this campaign's goal will pay for the materials/incentives production, I hope that some of the additional money raised (if any) can help pay for Frankie’s upcoming vet and travel expenses.

(If I don’t hit the goal, all expenses raised will still go to book and incentive production; the production quantities will just be smaller.)

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can’t help fund the campaign, please spread the word about Frankie and the Coffee Cats.

Thanks for reading!
- Rachel

story:
PRE-ORDER YOUR COPY BY DONATING NOW! AND GET OTHER GREAT FREEBIES & PERKS

Hello, my name is Sean, and i’ve been working on putting together this mammoth project over the last 4 years, (i am not paying myself anything as it's a non-profit) and you can now help to raise the last bit of cash to get it out for the world to see.

My motivation behind creating this project, was to put together a work which would help raise money for worthy causes, but also to provide the reader with an educational and engaging collection of comics, art and illustrated factual and pieces surrounding themes of war, but from an emotional & humanitarian angle. Think of it like a WIKILEAKS; getting the real stories out there, but with mostly personal accounts and emotive art.

“War: The Human Cost” will consist of a 260 page perfect bound book, and a 21 track music CD compilation on themes of war and peace. The work is more or less finished, as is the majority of the fundraising…It’s just the raising of the remainder of money for the project which is left.

With so much conflict in the world, the book and CD addresses & exposes all the surrounding complex issues on why humans go to war, and the very real universal cost that it entails. It also looks at the more positive stories to come out of war and suffering and those creating practical alternatives to the destruction it causes.

I contacted many people, commissioned work and also allowed for open submissions from comic artists, writers, illustrators and musicians.
I was astounded by the response. I received over 800 pages of work from artists from 24 countries, with some amazing, heartfelt and well-researched work. I’ve now edited that down to a much smaller and better book, & am just working on my own last 3 contributions to this work.

The book & CD is a not-for-profit project run by Community Art Projects/ Paper Tiger Comix (a small, one-man independent publisher ie: me), which is helping to raise money and awareness for Campaign Against the Arms trade (http://www.caat.org.uk/), aswell as raising awareness of campaign groups such as War On Want, Amnesty International, CND, Unicef & Hero Rats (training african rats to safely sniff out landmines!).

£1 from every book & CD sold will go to CAAT and all the other proceeds will go to CAP.

The aim is to bring people together, and look at the causes and effects of war. I believe, that it is through understanding, real-life stories, solid journalism, expressive art & allowing different voices to be represented, that we can work against fear, propaganda and warmongering, & lessen the dehumanisation and ‘us & them’ mentality that is whipped up around the world by various leaders/ groups to create conflict, exploitation & hate.

The comic strips include well researched stories from around the world (Tibet, Afghanistan, Israel & Palestine, Africa, Iraq, etc) which cover everything from human rights struggles, war veterans & PTSD, political imprisonment & torture, child soldiers, refugees /asylum seekers, peace campaigns, the arms trade, corruption/ conflicts of interest, military spending, propaganda to humour & satire.

Some of the stories are more historical, going back to previous generations (Vietnam, World War 2, Spanish Civil War etc) & the very personal/ moving stories of those involved.

Paul Gravett, leading author on comics, journalist, and curator of the COMICA events (plus one of the supporters of the project), has read the collated work and said “this will be a landmark project”.

Roger Sabin, another leading comics author, scholar and lecturer has also donated to the project, along with the anti-war/ poverty charity War On Want.

So far the project has raised £3450 externally (it's in the CAP community bank account waiting for the target to be reached), I have put in £1500 myself into this project, and have raised another £1750 via some wonderful sponsors, contributers, and by putting on two benefit gigs. That leaves me with just under £650 to raise so that i can get the books printed and barcoded, the CDs professionally mastered/duplicated & to then promote & distribute the work

See Gallery and Updates links above for examples of comic strips, and check links to the myspace and facebook sites for more examples

The CD features well known artists who support the project, such as Michael Franti & Spearhead, Sly & Robbie, DJ Spooky, Blue King Brown, Zion Train, The Levellers, Big Youth & Twilight Dub Circus, The Groove Corporation & many more.

The book features the cream of underground & international talent from 17 countries,& well known respected artists from the comics world such as Spain Rodriguez (Ché: The illustrated Biography), Peter Kuper (World War 3 Illustrated/ Speechless), Alexsandar Zograf (Regards from Serbia), Ulli Lust (Warburger), Mazen Kerbaj, Ben Jennings (The Guardian), Alejandro Alvarez (The Bush Junta), Paul O Connell, Dr Parsons, Abu Mahjoob & many more.

No-one is being paid for this project, but as you’ll appreciate, it takes money to see it happen.

This is where you come in and can help a worthwhile & educational project.
Look at the great VIP perks for those who donate

The comic strips include well researched stories from around the world (Tibet, Afghanistan, Israel & Palestine, Africa, Iraq, etc) which cover everything from human rights struggles, war veterans & PTSD, political imprisonment & torture, child soldiers, refugees /asylum seekers, peace campaigns, the arms trade, corruption/ conflicts of interest, military spending, propaganda to humour & satire.
Some of the stories are more historical, going back to previous generations (Vietnam, World War 2, Spanish Civil War etc) & the very personal/ moving stories of those involved.
Paul Gravett, leading author on comics, journalist, and curator of the COMICA events (plus one of the supporters of the project), has read the collated work and said “this will be a landmark project”.
Roger Sabin, another leading comics author, scholar and lecturer has also donated to the project, along with the anti-war/ poverty charity War On Want.
So far the project has raised £3450 externally (it's in the CAP community bank account waiting for the target to be reached), I have put in £1500 myself into this project, and have raised another £1750 via some wonderful sponsors, contributers, and by putting on two benefit gigs. That leaves me with just under £650 to raise so that i can get the books printed and barcoded, the CDs professionally mastered/duplicated & to then promote & distribute the work
See Gallery and Updates links above for examples of comic strips, and check links to the myspace and facebook sites for more examples
The CD features well known artists who support the project, such as Michael Franti & Spearhead, Sly & Robbie, DJ Spooky, Blue King Brown, Zion Train, The Levellers, Big Youth & Twilight Dub Circus, The Groove Corporation & many more.
The book features the cream of underground & international talent from 17 countries,& well known respected artists from the comics world such as Spain Rodriguez (Ché: The illustrated Biography), Peter Kuper (World War 3 Illustrated/ Speechless), Alexsandar Zograf (Regards from Serbia), Ulli Lust (Warburger), Mazen Kerbaj, Ben Jennings (The Guardian), Alejandro Alvarez (The Bush Junta), Paul O Connell, Dr Parsons, Abu Mahjoob & many more.
No-one is being paid for this project, but as you’ll appreciate, it takes money to see it happen.
This is where you come in and can help a worthwhile & educational project.Look at the great VIP perks for those who donate

story:
Our origins

The Hidden City (“La Città Nascosta”) is a comic book. It was born in 2012 in Turin, Italy, at the Cottolengo School (www.scuolacottolengo.org), in collaboration with The Italian Comic Book Illustrators Association and talented students from Italy’s most prestigious Academy of Fine Arts.

Since then it was published online and available for free, in Italian, English and Arabic:

http://issuu.com/afnews.info/stacks/d1d8613ab7ab479abf3f5b7ba4d07cf2 

Our inspiration

Our goal is to convey , through our comics,  a gospel of hopes towards the last of the earth , origin and inspiration of St. Joseph Cottolengo's example and message. 

The Hidden City illustrates true stories of young girls and boys who discovered the beauty of giving love and compassion to someone else. It is inspired by real life episodes of people attending the Cottolengo School, facing severe disabilities or critical poorness.








Our message

Our stories mean to prove that, by helping someone in difficulty, you and the entire community receive back much more that what has been given for help, often in unexpected ways.  

Unexpected was also the success obtained by the Hidden City amongst visitors. The number exceeded our expectations (over 1,600.00 IP addresses). 

Our “poor” art and our passion for sports and loyalty (a “series” dedicated to the high values of rugby) proved to be a great vehicle for our message and people around the world showed unexpected interest and passion for our releases.

Our goal

We want to continue illustrating new stories and we want to give more and more people the chance to read the Hidden City and to appreciate its message and "hidden" hopes. 

We want to increase the number of languages available and we want to continue giving this chance to our public for free!

Your help

So far we could survive thanks to donations and charity, but after December '14 release, funds are over.

By helping and donating something to the Hidden City you will help us paying the basic costs for another two years (8 releases) of colorful and meaningful releases.

Costs include:

- Professional Illustrators fees;

- Students reimbursements;

- Tools and production costs;

- Graphics and layout;

- Online distribution and website costs;

Without your help the Hidden City will have to shut down its doors and with its closure also the inspiring reality of the Cottolengo School and the special stories o its inspiring guests will have less chances to be shared, appreciated and supported by the rest of the world.

We need your help!

story:
Overview!

Hello! Thank you for coming to my page! My name is Morgan Colonna and this is my first graphic novel. I'm so excited to be able to share it with you.  The cover explains it all: I just wanted a story about loving yourself and being proud of your identity all wrapped up in a cute puppy package! Toby is a disabled Pom on wheels with big dreams! It's a very self indulgent project with pups, puns and mermaids, and who doesn't love those?  It's a story perfect for all ages and especially children! :>

 

What I Need & What You Get!

There are a lot of steps in order to make the book a reality! Your contributions will help me not only to publish and upload the book, but also fund a first print run, and help with shipping and distributor fees! For your generosity, I made a list of various packages and perks for donations! See the perks listed to the right for details and the images for the pin and print!!

To make backing the project easier, I have add on perks available for easy picking so you can customize what you'd like including the pin, print and a digital zine of my story art/doodles. :> 

I plan to have the book published hopefully in January and will ship items out as soon as the funds come in! Right now I'm aiming for February/March time for perk arrival dates!   

 

The Impact!

The themes in the book are so important to me, as I have many people I care about that I want to let know I love them and I want them to love themselves. My biggest hope is that Toby can make people smile and help readers to be proud of everything that makes them unique.  I'd be forever grateful for your support in making this story a reality. Thank you for everything. 

If I'm able to make enough funds, I'd love to make extra book copies to take to hospitals, especially children hospitals!:>

 

Other Ways You Can Help!

If you aren't able to back the project now, I totally understand that money is tight--I normally live off pizza and a prayer hehe.  Fear not, after the campaign is over I'll be publishing the book to various distributors January/February time and will be posting updates on my social media! You can follow me @moelle_studio on Instagram for news and links! I also have plans to sell the pins/print post campaign but that date is TBD.  

 If you want to spread the word to anyone you think might be interested that would mean the world and be a crucial contribution!

story: Kind of a Bummer with Andrew and Darius is a weekly comedy nerd podcast hosted by Denver comedians/geeks Andrew Raschke and Darius Alexander. To help celebrate their one year anniversary of the podcast, Andrew and Darius want to report from the Mecca of local geekhood, the 2015 Denver Comic Con! Your donation will provide KOAB with a booth at the Con on Exhibitor Row. With all the celebrities appearing at the Con and more being announced, who knows who Andrew and Darius could interview!

story:
Who We Are

Rookery is a dedicated team of artists bound together by ink, sweat, and tears. From its humble premiere on the floor of MoCCA Fest 2014 in NYC, the Rookery Mag has gained momentum and now we are gearing up for another installment!

Rookery: Dreams and Nightmares showcases pages adorned with transcendental tales and fantastic visions, all brought to you by these talented young artists:
Stephanie Bailey
Jess Hurley
Paulo Campos
Jenna Kass
June Vigants
Tyler Boss
Hazel Newlevant
Sheila Machicado
Marlena Konglau
Sara Duvall
Christopher Gomez
Carmen Pizarro
Peter Schmidt
Ashley Silva
Rebecca George
Jennifer "Steen" Lloyd
Giselle Sarmiento
Crystal Rivera
Lorena Reyes


What We Need & What You Get

All funds will go towards the printing of the new volume in order for it to be debuted at SPX 2014 (Small Press Expo) in Bethesda, Maryland on September 13-14. This show provides a huge platform for artists, writers, and publishers to present their independent work in front of a public who may not get to see it otherwise. Even if we do not reach our goal of $1,000, funds will still sustain printing costs and be used to bring Rookery to you! All of our fabulous perks* are listed to the right.

*For any perks containing commissions, the artist will contact you by email to complete your order when the campaign is closed.

*Also some of these items are in limited quantities so get them while you can!

* The physical book is only in the higher tiers because those are exclusive copies we are shipping earliest before SPX, and before they will be up in an online shop. This is why it's an early bird special and comes with a high-tier commission. They will be made available for all once we raise enough money to get them printed, so please help make the physical copy a reality by donating! 

THE SWAG:

Pacific Rim stickers by Sara Duvall, Food Stickers by Peter Schmidt, Bat Stickers by June Vigants, and Alpaca buttons by Sheila Machicado.

THE PRINTS:

The first 3 are Tyler Boss' American Series prints, only 10 of each print is available.
She-wolf print by Sara Duvall.
Horse Silkscreen print by Jennifer "Steen" Lloyd, only 15 available.
Moon Sickness comic print by Steph Bailey.
The 2nd to last 3 are by Lorena Reyes, only 2 prints of the Spaceman, and 1 of each of the smaller prints are available.
Lolita, Kimono, Essence of Time, and Colorful days posters by Marlena Konglau, only 5 of each available. 


THE MINI COMICS:

Evenstar by Jenna Kass, Whatever Dude & Lord of the Dynamos by Sara Duvall, and Clutched Robotics by Sheila Machicado. Rainy Tuesdays, Wu Zhao, Take it Easy, and But not for me by Marlena Konglau, only 4 of RainyTuesdays, 5 of Wu Zhao & BNFM each, and 10 of Take it easy are available.

THE SPECIAL COMMISSION TIER:

This is the $55 tier, these items are limited to this tier and there is only the 1. Sample pictures of the commission being offered, a sketchbook mini, and the BABYLON comic by Giselle Sarmiento.

THE COMMISSIONS:

The first is the $25 tier sample of commissions being offered by Steph Bailey.
The pencil portrait is the $60 tier sample of the commissions being offered by Jenna Kass, only 2 slots available.
The full-body colored is the $100 tier sample of the commissions being offered by Rebecca George, only 2 slots available.

The Impact

The independent comics movement has been a huge inspiration to all of us here at Rookery. Artists' content can now be seen and sought after by a wider audience than ever before. If you support our anthology - you support fledgling cartoonists, illustrators, and writers. Help us to get our wings and fly by donating today! 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that's okay! You can still help by spreading the word. Like, share, retweet, reblog, and post to your heart's content! The more you share this campaign with others, the more visibility we get, and the closer YOU get to a new installment of Rookery!

story:
On the date of December 21, 2012 everyone thought the world was coming to an end. As usual, the scientific community was wrong, however something monumental did occur that would alter the destiny of a planet and it's people. A woman child was born with many powers that was formed in her DNA thousands of years before her arrival on planet Earth. 

      I 'm going to tell the story of a futuristic epic combination of an esoteric tale of Star Wars meets the Matrix, meets Avatar and throw in the X Men.

      Have you ever wanted to see a kick-ass female pull off the most daring and the heroic epic of all time? A female hero who is more powerful than Superman, all of the X men combined and any other super hero you've ever known? Well she's here and her name is Femi Ayira Knight. Femi (meaning I'm loved) Ayira (meaning the chosen one) Knight. She comes to you by way of the Creators of the Universe. The world didn't end like everyone thought it would. There is no man or womb man on planet Terra who can defeat her and her king, Zuri (meaning beautiful) Oluchi (meaning beautiful work) Noble. He has an incredible tale to be told himself. By now, we are in the energies of the Femi9 principle that has drenched the Solar System we dwell in. She was created to grace the planet Earth with her knowledge and her caring for all people to receive the justice they deserve from the hurt and the pain each one is encountering from the injustices that has been thrust upon them. 

FEMI, THE WAR QUEEN SITTING ON HER THRONE

THE POWER WITHIN
                                             An excerpt of War:
     “Queen, we've been under attack for weeks now. There’s no stopping these ‘things’. For each one we kill, three will take its place! When I left Mexico, all was quiet. I don’t know what it’s like now. I have not been able to communicate with our people there. This country is overwhelmed with these creatures!”

    “Help is here now, bro. Miso! Continue on fighting. Show no mercy as they show no mercy to the people!  Drop them where they stand, leave them in the mire of their own villainous crude!”  

    She reassured Miso that fighting would be the only thing that would stop the Crowne Cross in their tracks. Zuri, meanwhile sent a maelstrom of laser blasts to a gang of the beasts, sizzling them down to ashes. As they fought through the long, hot days and days, none of them gave up as the evil armies continued on the merciless orders of the Draeconian fighting machine.

     It was determined by Femi that Brazil could be controlled by the Iwatchers who fought with Miso. Aradlugal gave the order for more than 100 Sumerian ships to stay behind and clean up the gruesome aftermath. Once they were able to bring Brazil under control slaying at least 35,000 enemy troopers, the fight moved on to Paraguay. 

                                           © Copyright 2011-2014 by Seta Aset

                                                     Blak Minx Productions 

                                                           All rights reserved

 

     The evil Draechons, the upright walking Reptiles, the mindless drones of the Crown Crest and the Android soldiers of the Talisman will be a challenge to Femi, Zuri and the Iwatchers. I want to bring this never before told tale to life, 

        At this moment, I am in negotiations with the chief animator Tony Qwade, to make these stories a reality beyond animation and eventually adapt it on the silver INDEPENDENT screen. I am also needing better sound equipment to make the necessary realistic sounds come to life. Right now, we are pre-screening characters for the lead parts and after we get each and every one together, we will began the three part series starting with Kemetstry: Bright Light. Bright Light is the origin of Femi and what she learns in her young life. Kemetstry: The Gathering of the Vanguard  tells the tale of her young adult life while searching for her counterpart to assist her in doing the battle she was destined for. Kemetstry: The War is the mega battle between life as we knew it yesterday and life as it is known today. 
        The trilogy is complete. Now all I have to do is present it to you. To all my fans who are already in love with the Kemetstry Trilogy page on Facebook (click the 'LIKE' button), I want to send my gratitude to you and I hope that I can make NEW friends and fans of Femi Knight. Once her story is told and sent out to the ethers for all to adhere to, a REAL and TRUE change will appear.                                                             I want to present this saga in animation form where all those who feel that what they can accomplish is not just a dream, but whatever their dream is, it can be a reality. Whether you are striving for certain choices in your life or just doing you. YOU can be your own superhero in the cosmos and I want to give you some knowledge that goes beyond the surface. Remember beloved, let's make the trilogy come to life and get my, 'our' project up and running. There is much more work to be done and we're shooting for the month of December to present the films. We will keep you posted on Kemetstry's progress.                                                                                                                  Again, Peace, Light and Love...  

FEMI, THE WAR GODDESS

ZURI, HER BELOVED

The Three Sons (Suns) before insertion.

This is Femi controlling the (Sons) by her hand


The Number One foe of the Multi-Universe, the Evil Draecon who walks among us now.


THE TRILOGY SERIES


THIS IS GOING TO BE EXCITING. GET READY SUPERHEROES!!!!!

Thank You.

Once her story is told and sent out to the ethers for all to adhere to, a REAL and TRUE change will appear.                                                             I want to present this saga in animation form where all those who feel that what they can accomplish is not just a dream, but whatever their dream is, it can be a reality. Whether you are striving for certain choices in your life or just doing you. YOU can be your own superhero in the cosmos and I want to give you some knowledge that goes beyond the surface. Remember beloved, let's make the trilogy come to life and get my, 'our' project up and running. There is much more work to be done and we're shooting for the month of December to present the films. We will keep you posted on Kemetstry's progress.                                                                                                                  Again, Peace, Light and Love...  







FEMI, THE WAR GODDESS




ZURI, HER BELOVED




The Three Sons (Suns) before insertion.




This is Femi controlling the (Sons) by her hand



The Number One foe of the Multi-Universe, the Evil Draecon who walks among us now.





THE TRILOGY SERIES



THIS IS GOING TO BE EXCITING. GET READY SUPERHEROES!!!!!

Thank You.

story:
YOU CAN VIEW and USE THE SITE IN BETA RIGHT NOW !

http://www.inspirecomics.com

Our Story

Inspire Comics was built off the idea that the indie comic industry is a thriving community yet support to get these artists up and running faster is dwindling. Being a comic/manga artist myself I decided to take it upon myself to provide a website that will not only host comics from the start for free and provide a free forum and advertisement, but to expand and attend events with prints of the comics and merchandise where the original creators could make the profit to inspire them to make more comics and perhaps at a later point become a direct publisher of all the hosted comics on Inspire Comics itself !


The Impact

Imagine a website where you can join up free of charge, post a comic, free of charge and get free access to tools for easily uploading media and a forum. Now multiply that by the fact the creator of the website is an artist himself who will attend events under that name, advertise and get people reading your comic online absolutely for free again. It would definitely change the comic hosting game and once refined will attract many artists at a time to join up, with this indiegogo funding I will do that and much much more.

What We Need & What You Get

The money from indiegogo will be split among 3 categories. The website, the advertising and the printing. The first part will go to upgrading our website and fleshing out it's features for users as well as creating a much more friendly experience with features such as an online store, galleries, downloads and media ! The second part will be paying for attending events such as FanExpo and Sandiego ComicCon under the Inspire Comics name as well as web advertisements and last but not least the third part will go to printing out comic issues, posters, flyers and more.


Other Ways You Can Help

The best way to help us as Inspire Comics is just by spreading the word around, joining the site and publishing your comment or simply filling out the form and giving us suggestions on what we're doing right and what we should change !

story:
What is Vestigia?

Vestigia is an 84-page graphic novel that I've written and illustrated. 

At its core, it's a spooky adventure story about a boy trying to regain his former self. You'll also find action, mystery, humor, and a few unexpected turns. I would consider it as having a PG rating, due to some fantasy violence.

Vestigia takes place on an Earth-like planet, in a time period much like our own. The story centers around a boy named Wesley. Before the events of the book, Wes experiences a personal tragedy. His best friend, Malcolm, tries to help him through it by joining him on a mission to find a buried treasure box. Shortly after setting out on their quest, Wes and Mal find themselves trapped in a giant cave. They must go deeper into the darkness in hopes that there's another way out... and something is lurking in the shadows.


My Goal

We surpassed our funding goal with over a week to go! Thank you so much to everyone that helped out. 

All funds raised went into the first printing of the book, and booth costs for various conventions. Now that we're categorized as InDemand, I've updated the perks to reflect that the book is no longer in the pre-order stage. 


The Perks

Download Vestigia in PDF format
You'll receive a link to download a PDF of the full book.

Signed Vestigia Book
The 84 page soft cover graphic novel - sized at 6.625in x 10.25in.

Signed 11x17 Vestigia Poster
Vestigia cover art, beautifully printed on an offset press.

Signed 8x10 Art Print
This will be an exclusive Vestigia-themed piece - not in the book.

Vestigia Silicone Bracelet
Reads "VESTIGIACOMIC.com" (purple on black). Circumference is 7.375in. 

Custom USB with Vestigia PDF
A USB customized with the Vestigia logo - containing the book in PDF format.


Art Samples


    Thanks again!

    -Scott

story:
The Boston Comics Roundtable is Boston's largest oldest collective of comics creators. We encourage growth and development in new members,  constructive critiques for works, and a weekly fellowship amongst the local creators. The BCR is responsible for comics events for all ages, workshops for all skill levels, and publishing anthologies.

The BCR anthologies are a huge source of motivation for up and coming creators. All members are eligible for submission. The BCR also encourages everyone to be involved, giving those new to the behind the scenes world of comics a way to gain experience. Any member is able to volunteer to help table at a con, assist with a workshop, or work on the planning committee. 

 

A lot of people helped us work on this anthology and we are so close.

As a non-profit, our funds for printing and other projects are very limited. On this anthology we ran over our original estimate for a page count and over budget. The funds will help us cover about 40- 50% of the cost.

 

Any amount will help us towards our goal and will be much appreciated! But of course, you will be rewarded with Spellbound swag. We have signed page prints, color prints, and even original art inside your Spellbound vol.2!

story:
The Pride

Have you ever been sick of being misrepresented? Of having no one like you to look up to? Have you ever wanted to change everything?

Well, FabMan has. In a world populated by superpowers, the superhero is common. Sadly for FabMan (Tomorrow’s Fabulous Man, Today), he feels a deep schism in the representation of his community, his own heroic exploits being presented as just big jokes in the news. Wan...ting to fight for change, he forms PRIDE, the world’s premier LGBT supergroup. Not a gay superteam, just a team where most members are LGBT. Not exactly receiving the desired response, the group faces opposition from the confrontational Justice Division, more aggressive misrepresentation by the media and are then taken advantage of in the plans of the nefarious Reverend. After a serious trial by fire, the team find themselves the only super team in the world capable of stopping The Reverend’s diabolical plot for world domination.

Join FabMan, Wolf, Sapphire, Frost, Twink, Bear, Angel and White Trash on their mission to help people and improve LGBT representation in the process.

 

What is 'The Pride'?

 

The Pride is a six-issue mini-series written by Joe Glass, and with art by rising star Gavin MItchell, and Kris Carter. The series will be published by Deadstar Publishing, and is seeking further distribution.

Our Story

 

I'm Joe Glass, and I'm a gay man who loves comics. Luckily, I also happen to be a writer.

 

When I was growing up, and coming to terms with my sexuality, one of the things I always felt sad about was the fact there were no visible, openly gay superheroes I could relate to. Sure, there were one or two, but they lived in the background or were poorly reresented. Ever since then, I wanted to change that. And that's what The Pride is all about.

 

Taking me many years to work out the story, let the characters grow an evolve in my head, and the most important part of finding a great artist; we are finally ready to bring this project out into the world.

 

Helping me I have the fantastic new artist Gavin Mitchell, who provides the excellent artwork on the series. Kris Carter brings that art to life with his glorious colours. A host of other artists are providing one page stories nd covers for the series too. And Deadstar Publishing are helping me to brin it to a wider audience than I could by myself. But as new creators, we could always use more help to get this comic out even further.

 

The Impact

 

The whole point of doing this project is to provide young LGBT comics readers with heroes they can look up to, and older ones with heroes they can relate to; it's to cover issues that straight readers may not be aware of, or may have disregarded as something which 'doesn't affect them' when they affect all of us; it can hopefully change some opinions and help push for an improvement in representation; and most of all, it will be fun!

 

If we are unsuccessful here, the comic will still come out. But we won't be able to spread it as far as we would like, and there is little point to a message if no one can actually hear it.

What We Need & What You Get

The money raised by this project will be used to pay for printing larger print runs of this comic that I can distribute personally, or through stores who order the book too. Furthermore, each donation can be used as a kind of 'pre-order' that we can show larger distributors like Diamond the kind of numbers we can achieve, so hopefully they will work with us to help distribute the comic as far and wide as possible. The other benefit of the poject being on this site is that it's the best way to get your copy if you live in the United States or outside of the UK. As yet, we are working on distribution deals in those territories, but we're not there yet. So your help will let us spread this message globally. Higher print runs and perorder numbers are of course also possible even if we don't hit the ultimate target, but the more we raise the better.

 

In fact, if we beat the target, then it just means we can print more, market more, and maybe even commission more artists to provide their help in the series. Anything to make this project as big and great as it can be! 


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help fund the series, you can help spread the word! There are links to the comics Facebook and twitter pages, and I'll keep this project updated on any and all news on the comic, so you can keep helping by passing that info on to anyone you know and encouraging them to help us. Thank You!

Thank You!

story:
"I Think I Broke My Brain..." is the debut half hour comedy special for comedian Joe Doyle. His ridiculous and childlike outlook on life skewers off the wall topics like "man-scaping," Kim Kardashian, and Michael Vick. He also shares stories of his experience on the VH1 series "The Pickup Artist" and how he became a gay sex symbol overnight.

After college I managed to find my way onto the set of a reality show called The Pickup Artist. I moved to Los Angeles and began standup comedy so I had an outlet to tell the nut ball stories I had from the underground pickup artist scene. That was just the beginning. Through a series of fortunate events I had the opportunity to open for Jon Lovitz and one of my favorites from the Blue Collar Comedy Tour, Ron White. I keep my friends on their toes back home with random tv appearances on TMZ (unintentionally), The Soup, and Season 8 of So You Think You Can Dance as "Big C" The Claus of Krump. Like the video mentioned, I also plan to include a number of sketches written and directed by myself and showcasing my hilarious friends in the LA comedy scene. Bonus!

I hope you enjoyed the video and a taste of what could be with your contributions and help to spread the word about my campaign.  I'd like to share one of my favorite quotes with you that always seems to cheer me up and make me smile.

"Everybody has a laughin' place, trouble is most folks don't take the time to look for it." -Uncle Remus (Song of the South)

Thanks again!

story:
Our Story

I have always wanted to create a comedic film about what happens when women get drunk and black out. What they remember, and what they don't remember.  I figured why not raise the stakes and make it one of the most important days of a girls life, their wedding day. The maid of honor, Darlene, is the lead of this story, she is the sister to the groom and the bride's best friend.  The action occurs the morning after the bachlorette party which turns out to be the day of the wedding.  All hell breaks loose when they find out when they wake up from the black out that the wedding ceremony is in 1 hour! It is Darlene's job to wrangle them up and get them to the church on time.  Will she do it?

The Impact

I am trying to use all of the resources I can to create a really awesome short film, and produce something that is memorable and funny.  I want people to see that women can have fun and get little crazy too! 


Creativity, ambition and an amazing cast and crew can only go so far without the funding.  We hope that you enjoy the final project and help us out in creating our vision! 


Other Ways You Can Help

Share this with others! Tell them about this project and see if they are interested in helping :)

story:
Dear friends,

We are the Ladydrawers. We’re a diverse group of people from all over the country who create comics, make books, write articles, do performance art, and fill out giant spreadsheets full of data based on original research we conduct on labor, economics, gender, sexuality, and race in the comics industry. Women make up 51% of the world’s population yet hold only 25% of the paid gigs in cultural production. In comics, it’s worse: Male creators make up only 54% of the industry but get 90% of the freelance contracts, which translates into some very real pay inequities. On average, male creators make 3.5 times more than female ones from comics—and 19.5 times as much as trans, genderqueer, or non-binary gender creators.

We’ve got more data to share—and more research to do—so we’re asking for you to help fund a 160-page compilation of much of the work we’ve done in the last five years, plus exciting never-before-seen material from our wonderful collaborators throughout the US. The book will be two-color printed, assembled, and bound by a gender diverse group of local Chicago artisans. (Huge thanks to Spudnik Press!) It will be read in media and women’s studies classrooms and by comics fans around the world. Funding will cover printing, binding, assembling, generating content, editing, mailing, paying our contributors, and making it look amaze-balls: that’s why we need $20,000.

Yeah, you read that right: paying our contributors. Not much—unless we surpass our goal—but something. Because we value the labor in cultural production. And we think we're doing something right. Look at what people are saying about our work:

“Beautifully illustrated intellectual ammunition.” —ThinkProgress

“Depressing news, but the comic makes it a little easier to swallow”—Bitch

“Wry”—New York Times Magazine

Although our strips have appeared in Tin House, Annalemma, and on Truthout, and been praised by many more than the above, we’re not just another pretty face. We’re going to change the way your culture gets made—and change the way you learn about the world. Basically, we want to make everything more fun, and funnier. For everybody.

If you can’t donate, please share our campaign with your pals who might be able to. ‘Cause some of what we do is about money, but some of it is just about sharing information and making things more awesome—for everyone.

Much love,

The Ladydrawers

 

P.S. Check our blog for more, but one of our anthologies—Unladylike—is online in its entirety here.

story:
Welcome to the World of Valendor, a bold new world where steam-powered ships sail across the sky and where you’ll find that the standard heroes come in any shape or form—even Pirate!

In the Sky Pirates of Valendor comic book series, the leading airship is the Rogue's Revenge. In the home of its creator, the leading airship is a 2004 Honda Civic. This airship has traveled thousands of miles, transporting Everett Soares and his crew to and from conventions, signings and networking events for the past 6 years. However, it seems as if the airship is in need of some serious repairs. Everett Soares is trying to raise $3000 so that he can fix his airship and continue doing what he has waited all of his life to do - make and exhibit comics. 
 
With this goal in mind and being that we are in the process of developing the storyline for Volume 3, we have created a very exciting opportnity for appreciators of comics, pirates and steampunk!
 
The theme and storyline for Volume 3 of Sky Pirates of Valendor is Pirate Wars. So this fundraising has two levels:
 
For a $50 donation - you will be drawn into the comic book series as one of the particcipants in the Wars. You will also receive a pinup of your character and a copy of the issue your character appears in.
 
For a $100 donation - you will not only be drawn into the comic book series but you will also be the captain of your very own pirate ship, to be named by you! You will also receive the original page where your ship appears and a copy of the issue you appear in.
 
Volume 3 will be a 6-issue miniseries, published in single-issues and a collected volume. Issues will be available in print and digital versions.
story_txt:
Welcome to the World of Valendor, a bold new world where steam-powered ships sail across the sky and where you’ll find that the standard heroes come in any shape or form—even Pirate!

In the Sky Pirates of Valendor comic book series, the leading airship is the Rogue's Revenge. In the home of its creator, the leading airship is a 2004 Honda Civic. This airship has traveled thousands of miles, transporting Everett Soares and his crew to and from conventions, signings and networking events for the past 6 years. However, it seems as if the airship is in need of some serious repairs. Everett Soares is trying to raise $3000 so that he can fix his airship and continue doing what he has waited all of his life to do - make and exhibit comics. 
 
With this goal in mind and being that we are in the process of developing the storyline for Volume 3, we have created a very exciting opportnity for appreciators of comics, pirates and steampunk!
 
The theme and storyline for Volume 3 of Sky Pirates of Valendor is Pirate Wars. So this fundraising has two levels:
 
For a $50 donation - you will be drawn into the comic book series as one of the particcipants in the Wars. You will also receive a pinup of your character and a copy of the issue your character appears in.
 
For a $100 donation - you will not only be drawn into the comic book series but you will also be the captain of your very own pirate ship, to be named by you! You will also receive the original page where your ship appears and a copy of the issue you appear in.
 
Volume 3 will be a 6-issue miniseries, published in single-issues and a collected volume. Issues will be available in print and digital versions.

story:
Last year we successfully Published Tarzan and the Comics of Idaho #2 AND Idaho Comics #2 and everyone was very pleased with the results.  

Tarzan and the Comics of Idaho #1 garnered some national attention as our comic book anthology was featured twice in articles in Comic Book Resources.  Also, three pages from TATCOI #1 by Randall Kirby were featured in an article in The Huffington Post.  (Randall's pages are under entry #15).  We were mentioned on the official Edgar Rice Burroughs website.  Lastly, we got a very nice mention on Boing Boing!

People from as far away as California, Texas, Oregon, Ohio, Virginia, England, and AUSTRALIA ordered and bought copies of our anthology.

This is an officially licensed Tarzan comic book from Edgar Rice Burroughs, Inc. in Tarzana, California.  After the comic book has been printed, Edgar Rice Burroughs, Inc. will keep eight copies of our comic book on file in their archives.

Edgar Rice Burroughs lived in Idaho on three separate occasions in his life and is a big part of our Idaho sequential arts heritage.  That is why we have decided to license his most famous character for our anthology. 

Some of the writers and artists involved in our anthology include:

  • Jacob Bear (Hawk & Dove, Deadpooh, Batbear)
  • Ward Hooper (award-winning local artist)
  • James Lloyd (Space Masons, The Adventures of Young O.J. Simpson)
  • Randall Kirby (Bop Comics)
  • Dennis P. Eichhorn (Real Stuff, Real Good Stuff, Extra Good Stuff)
  • James Lichtenberg (Why Not?)
  • Treycen Fluckiger (Why Not?)
  • Joseph Bradshaw (Kingdom Of Freedom, 6x6)
  • Damon Bradshaw (Push)
  • Hector Diaz (Dia De Los Muertos)
  • Gaz Asker (Tarzan and the Comics of Idaho, Idaho Comics)
  • Albert Frank Asker (Tarzan and the Comics of Idaho, Idaho Comics, 6x6)
  • with a very special note of encouragement from Idaho's newest Pulitzer Prize winning author, Anthony Doerr

What We Need & What You Get

Here is why we need money.  We need:

  • $250 for the Tarzan licensing fee
  • $500 for printing costs
  • $50 for shipping costs
The artists and writers donated all of the talent, time, energy, blood, sweat, and tears for the good of the Friends of the Boise Public Library.  We again thank them for their efforts.  I will donate the cost of shipping the incentives out if it is over $50. However, it is preferred that donors pick up the comic book in person at the 2016 Library Comic Con on Saturday August 27th where the anthology will make its debut.  If there is any extra money left over, that cash will go to the Friends of the Boise Public Library.

The Impact

You will be able to own a piece of Idaho sequential arts history and help out a great cause at the same time.

Risks & Challenges

We're waiting on a couple of creators pieces so making the deadline will be a little stressful for the editor (yours truly).  We have already obtained the Tarzan license so that won't be a problem.  Also, this is the first time that we have worked with this printer so hopefully they will be able to turn out a quality product for us.

Also, we don't have as many perks this year as last year so it we are going to emphasize volume of perks rather than a handful of big ticket items.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
That's about it.  Thanks in advance for your help.
