story:
It's been 6 months sense we've last seen our heroes.  A lot has changed after fleeing the nightmares of H.E.L.L..  Unfortunately, plenty will be lost when they meet Azazal on the killing field.

Hybrids: The Sons of Gods " The Killing Field" Part 1 is a 32 page self-cover (28 content pages) full-color standard size comic book.

All of the work for this release is complete and will be ready for print upon the campaigns end.

Hundreds of indie comics fans have encountered the HYBRIDS UNIVERSE and enjoyed the action!  The Killing Field doesn't require you to get the previous issues, but they will be available with this campaign! 

Terraform Comics Founders have successfully funded and fulfilled more than 25 campaigns!

Who will like this series?

Hybrids is an action/adventure story set around the advent of a new super human species.  It includes theories surrounding the NEPHILIM and ANCIENT ALIENS set against the discovery of a new drug and human trafficking ring.  This series will appeal to you if you like the following...

Superheroes
Obscure History
Greek Mythology
Nephilim
Conspiracy Theories
Religious Lore
Movies like "Taken"
90's Comics

ICYMI!
How it started!

 

How it's going!

 

FIRST DAY PRINT

All first day backers will get this print for free!  Don't worry.  If you missed it, you can get it as an add-on!

 

 

BACKUP STORY BY ROG MAHAN AND JIM O'RILEY

RED CAPE

PAGE SAMPLES

THE GAME MASTER IS ALWAYS IN CONTROL

A LITTLE LATE FOR COMPANY

 

THE DAD PACK

THE SWAG PACK

BE A HYBRID IN A SPIN-OFF SERIES

Stretch Goals

HYBRID ENGINEERING LOGO PATCH - UNLOCKED
HOLOFOIL TRADING CARD - UNLOCKED
NETHO DIAZ COVER POSTER - LOCKED - unlocks at 100 backers

ADD-ONS

HYBRIDS DAD HAT

HYBRIDS MUG - ART BY ADRIAN FERNANDEZ

HYBRIDS BACK PACK _ ART BY CAANAN WHITE AND ERIK HODSON

HYBRIDS THROW BLANKET - ART BY CAANAN WHITE AND ERIK HODSON

CREATIVE TEAM

CREATOR/ARTIST - LUKE STONE
COLORER - PATRICK GAMA
LETTERER - NIKKI POWERS
EDITOR - PIPER STEED

SHIPPED WITH GEMINI MAILERS

story:
My project: I have created a Super Hero Team for Germany. It is a group of good guys from MODERN, POST WW2 POST Berlin Wall, Germany. They are NOT related to the N word and I will not use the name of the national socialism EVER in my story. This is a story of the MODERN Germany and I will give no free press to those who want to live in the Past or will not see Germany as it is today not 70 years ago. 

Mein Projekt: Ich habe ein Superhelden-Team für Deutschland geschaffen. Es ist eine Gruppe von guten Leuten aus dem modernen, post-2. Weltkrieg, post-Berliner Mauer Deutschland. 

Sie haben nichts mit dem N-Wort zu tun und ich werde das Wort Nationalsozialismus nicht ein einziges Mal in meiner Geschichte erwähnen. Dies ist eine Geschichte des modernen Deutschlands und ich werde keine Plattform bieten für die, die in der Vergangenheit leben wollen und Deutschland nicht so sehen wollen wie es jetzt ist, 

 My intention is to use this project to help Germany restore some of the soul it has lost because of the residual scars of war on it's people.

Meine Absicht ist es, mit diesem Projekt Deutschland etwas von der Seele wiederzugeben, die es verloren hat auf Grund der Kriegsnarben, die die Bevölkerung noch immer trägt. 

an aspect of this project includes wearing Super hero costumes and visiting childrens hospitals to give them toys and cheer them up during the depressing time of recovery and lonelyness of being in a hospital away from family and familiar things.

 I am a  Army Veteran married to a German woman. I live in Germany and I have immigrated there. I have noticed a few things Germany needs help to improve on and since my children(if I ever have any) will be half German and I would like to do what I can to make this little part of our world better.

Ich bin ein behinderter US Army Veteran und mit einer deutschen Frau verheiratet. Ich lebe in Deutschland und bin hier eingewandert. Ich habe einige Dinge bemerkt, die in Deutschland verbessert werden könnte und da meine Kinder (sollte ich welche haben) zur Hälfte Deutsch sein werden würde ich gern das tun, was ich kann um einen kleinen Teil unserer Welt besser zu machen. 

 Presently I need funds to publish my Comic which must start as a photo storybook on Kindle because I do not have time to draw the whole thing neither do I have the proper equipment to do so. My story book does include some drawings I have done. I can not afford to hire an artist or writers or editors so my first product will be very rough but sincere.

Aktuell brauche ich Mittel, um meinen Comic zu veröffentlichen, dieser muss zunächst als Foto-Storybook auf Kindle starten, da ich nicht die Zeit oder die Ausrüstung habe, um das ganze zu zeichnen. Mein Storybook beinhaltet jedoch einige Zeichnungen, die ich bereits fertig habe. Ich kann es mir nicht leisten, Künstler, Autoren oder editors anzustellen also wird mein erstes Produkt nicht sehr professionell sein aber es kommt von Herzen. 

 If this project is a success then it will move on to a presentation to TV and Movie producers and hopefully Video Game producers.

 Sollte dieses Projekt erfolgreich sein, so hoffe ich es TV oder Filmproduzenten zu präsentieren und hoffentlich auch Videospiel-Produzenten.  

Risks and challenges

The Risk here is that no one cares enough about Germany to want a Superhero or a team of Super German Good guys. They do exist in other major Comic brands but they are not created in Germany. ALL of them are created in the US and imported. THIS project is IN Germany and done by a half-German Family. I am American and my wife is German. 

My intention is mostly to raise funds for Charities and help people see Germans as good and not the Super villains they are always portrayed in the Comics and movies and media.

I believe Germany is awesome and the goodness of Germans is ever present and survived wars and geographical division. 

This project would not be a good project for a German because people fear German pride. I am not German so I can maybe give something unique for Germany that they are not allowed to give themselves due to scars of Wars long since gone. 

I hope this project will be accepted as the Good gift it is intended to be.
story_txt: My project: I have created a Super Hero Team for Germany. It is a group of good guys from MODERN, POST WW2 POST Berlin Wall, Germany. They are NOT related to the N word and I will not use the name of the national socialism EVER in my story. This is a story of the MODERN Germany and I will give no free press to those who want to live in the Past or will not see Germany as it is today not 70 years ago. Mein Projekt: Ich habe ein Superhelden-Team für Deutschland geschaffen. Es ist eine Gruppe von guten Leuten aus dem modernen, post-2. Weltkrieg, post-Berliner Mauer Deutschland. Sie haben nichts mit dem N-Wort zu tun und ich werde das Wort Nationalsozialismus nicht ein einziges Mal in meiner Geschichte erwähnen. Dies ist eine Geschichte des modernen Deutschlands und ich werde keine Plattform bieten für die, die in der Vergangenheit leben wollen und Deutschland nicht so sehen wollen wie es jetzt ist,  My intention is to use this project to help Germany restore some of the soul it has lost because of the residual scars of war on it's people.Meine Absicht ist es, mit diesem Projekt Deutschland etwas von der Seele wiederzugeben, die es verloren hat auf Grund der Kriegsnarben, die die Bevölkerung noch immer trägt. an aspect of this project includes wearing Super hero costumes and visiting childrens hospitals to give them toys and cheer them up during the depressing time of recovery and lonelyness of being in a hospital away from family and familiar things. I am a  Army Veteran married to a German woman. I live in Germany and I have immigrated there. I have noticed a few things Germany needs help to improve on and since my children(if I ever have any) will be half German and I would like to do what I can to make this little part of our world better.Ich bin ein behinderter US Army Veteran und mit einer deutschen Frau verheiratet. Ich lebe in Deutschland und bin hier eingewandert. Ich habe einige Dinge bemerkt, die in Deutschland verbessert werden könnte und da meine Kinder (sollte ich welche haben) zur Hälfte Deutsch sein werden würde ich gern das tun, was ich kann um einen kleinen Teil unserer Welt besser zu machen.  Presently I need funds to publish my Comic which must start as a photo storybook on Kindle because I do not have time to draw the whole thing neither do I have the proper equipment to do so. My story book does include some drawings I have done. I can not afford to hire an artist or writers or editors so my first product will be very rough but sincere.Aktuell brauche ich Mittel, um meinen Comic zu veröffentlichen, dieser muss zunächst als Foto-Storybook auf Kindle starten, da ich nicht die Zeit oder die Ausrüstung habe, um das ganze zu zeichnen. Mein Storybook beinhaltet jedoch einige Zeichnungen, die ich bereits fertig habe. Ich kann es mir nicht leisten, Künstler, Autoren oder editors anzustellen also wird mein erstes Produkt nicht sehr professionell sein aber es kommt von Herzen.  If this project is a success then it will move on to a presentation to TV and Movie producers and hopefully Video Game producers. Sollte dieses Projekt erfolgreich sein, so hoffe ich es TV oder Filmproduzenten zu präsentieren und hoffentlich auch Videospiel-Produzenten.  Risks and challengesThe Risk here is that no one cares enough about Germany to want a Superhero or a team of Super German Good guys. They do exist in other major Comic brands but they are not created in Germany. ALL of them are created in the US and imported. THIS project is IN Germany and done by a half-German Family. I am American and my wife is German. My intention is mostly to raise funds for Charities and help people see Germans as good and not the Super villains they are always portrayed in the Comics and movies and media.I believe Germany is awesome and the goodness of Germans is ever present and survived wars and geographical division. This project would not be a good project for a German because people fear German pride. I am not German so I can maybe give something unique for Germany that they are not allowed to give themselves due to scars of Wars long since gone. I hope this project will be accepted as the Good gift it is intended to be.

story:
Wraparound Cover for the Regular Edition

             Regular Edition will have these two covers making it a double cover book.

 

ALOHA!

I'm Manny from GoodDogPress.  Sit back, relax, and enjoy your time viewing the campaign for the unbreathable Skunk Girl : No Squirrels Allowed ! The unbreathable Skunk Girl is an homage to the great BADD girl comics of the 1990’s. It’s the story of Delilah Defluer, a shy, brainy, and awkward young lady who has an unfortunate accident  in her college years that turns her dull boring life up-side down. She will transform from a meek little girl into a bold, cunning young woman! It’s the ugly duckling story gone BADD! If you like ACTION and FUN, please support Skunkie as she takes on the Super Justice Wardens with the help of her “henchmen” Stink, Stank, Stunk, and the Booster Bois.

Skunk Girl  is intended for Teens 13+ as it contains a LOT of violence, gunfire, smoking, drinking, and oh my lorrrd BEAUTIFUL women!

 

STRETCH GOALS

STRETCH GOAL UNLOCKED $1,000  All backers will receive a FanArt trading card by Weston “Tank Ferret” Duggan

STRETCH GOAL UNLOCKED $3,000  All backers will also receive a FanArt trading card by Cesar “El Gaupo” Feliciano

$5,000  All backers will also receive a FanArt trading card by Josh “The Copic Kid” Chris

$7,000  All backers will also receive a FanArt trading card by Pope Raven the Champion

$9,000  All backers will also receive a FanArt trading card by Kevin “Trusty Sidekick” Wiggins

$10,000  Good Dog Press will donate to the USO  500 copies of a variant newsprint 32 page comic book of  the unbreathable Skunk Girl #1 .

$25,000 All backers will also receive an evolution of Skunk Girl ashcan.

 

                                                 FanArt Trading Cards                                       

           

 

              

 

                                        

                     

                     

$10,000 USO Stretch Goal

Oh Henry Tier

Choose your original art page from these 12. Original art is done on 11"X 17" Bristol Board with archival ink. First come first reserved. As this tier is being backed, I will update the remaining pages that will still be available.

 

 

Stunk Tier

Sculpted and hand painted sculpture bust of the unbreathable Skunk Girl by Manny. Limited to only 25 copies.

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Campaign Goal

This campaign has a flexible goal of $1,000 to produce the first and only print run of the Indiegogo exclusive edition of the unbreathable Skunk Girl #1! The main story is nearly done. The backup stories and sketch pages are done.

 

Risks & Challenges

There is always a risk but this comic is 94% drawn, inked, colored, and lettered. I held back 5 of the penciled pages to be inked live  on GoodDogPress's Youtube channel during the campaign.  We here at team Skunkie are just going over the fine details and just tweaking the book to make the best product as possible. We expect a turn around of 4 to 6 weeks with the printers, then shipped off to all of our wonderful backers.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't support the project, please spread the stink .... err WORD around and tell a friend about the unbreathable Skunk Girl.

story:
Summary

Hello and thanks for stopping by! You have reached the fundraising page for The Legend of Boudicca graphic novel written by Joey Ellison, lettered by Paul Mclaren and illustrated by Monty Borror. The book is going to be 120 pages black and white greyscaled told in six chapters. No publisher announcements just yet but we will update you as the proccess continues.

 

Boudicca is a historical figure from Iceni which included parts of England and Wales. She lead a bloody rebellion against Rome in AD 60 or 61. Her story is not often told in the United States although it is inspiring to all who stumble upon it.

 

Making Boudicca's story accessible to to a wide audience is the goal of this campaign. 

Where it goes

Funding raised will go to the printing of our book in both seperate chapters and as a full graphic novel. These will be used to send as perks of course but also to get printed books in front of publishers more than likely to be shopped at San Diego Comic Con. Any extra funding will partially go to the creators because after all of the work we deserve to buy ourselves a beer or two. But we will also use some for animated shorts and promotion. If our goal is not met, any monies made go directly to printing.

 

One of the most important perks in this fundraiser is a chance to own original artwork from the graphic novel at a very reasonable price. A real reminder that one can actually hang on their wall.

The Goal

Telling the story of Boudicca to a wide mainstream audience is not without it's challenges. Just writing and drawing a 120 page script is challenging enough. Our main goal is telling as wide of a scope as possible. To include the excitement of medievel battles aligned with the great loss responsible for the uprising of the Iceni people. It is our goal to show these events lead by a woman whose strength the world had not yet seen.

 

It costs nothing to share.

Ain't got the dollar to spare? No problemo. If you would still like to see the project get made share the link! That little bit of help keeps our depression at bay. 

Cheers!

story:
CYBERFROG: UNFROGETTABLE TALES is here!

 

This is FANTASTIC!  I've got the files to ALL OF THE CLASSIC 90's CYBERFROG stories, and obviously, as the creator, I own all of this stuff!  Want to read them?

 

The original CYBERFROG comics that were published by HALL OF HEROES in 1994 are next to impossible to find, and if you do find them, they're extremely expensive!  Not only that, they were done in black and white and on cheap newsprint, with my sloppy hand lettering!  

LET'S FIX THAT. 

I've got KYLE RITTER,  MASTER COLORIST, going over each page and bringing out gorgeous lifelike colors from my line art!  

I've also got ERIC WEATHERS, MAN OF LETTERS, replacing the old word balloons, letters and FX with updated, clean and professional lettering that will be a pleasure to read!

Meanwhile, I've drawn TWO NEW COVERS after the original versions, and they'll make this whole package something to treasure!  

 

UPDATE: THE COVERS WILL NOW FEATURE FOIL EMBOSSED EFFECTS! 

WHAT ELSE?

We're also offering an exclusive REKT PLANET PREVIEW ASHCAN of the first ten pages of story and art, along with bonus material, with a fantastic JAE LEE cover!  TWENTY PAGES TOTAL!

MORE?

How about a brand new SALAMANDROID BLACK LIGHT POSTER?  We're producing a gigantic 23”W x 35”H​ velvet flocked ultra violet light fluorescent poster of everyone's favorite Good Boy, Salamandroid!  I haven't seen rock and roll posters like these since the 1980's, so I decided to make them again!  Here's your chance to get yours!

 

STRETCH GOALS!

 

Anyone who backed CYBERFROG: BLOODHONEY knows that our brand is SHINY!  We did amazing Chromium covers last time, and I'd love to offer another shiny set of books this time!  If we can get this campaign to $50,000,  we'll do beautiful, foil embossed effects on YOUR COMIC BOOK COVERS!

 

From there, I'm going to offer a series of awesome stretch goals and freebies to make receiving your perks even more fun!

If we make it to the first stretch goal, I'll announce the second one!  I think you'll like it!

 

Please support this campaign, and let others know!  Spread the word!  And let's get this Frog hopping again!

 

So here's a look at the interior pages!

story:
About The Project:

Hi all, I'm Davide Racah.
I'm an IT expert and I'm working as a producer in the videogame industry from 2008.

I always loved videogames, comics, anime, and many others nerdy things :)

In the last 2 years I've worked on a project that I strongly believe will work: the creation of a web platform to allow comics' authors to publish their works and gain money through the division (50% & 50%) of the advertising revenue.

Comicsjump.net is half website and half social network: it's strictly connected to the "new social aggregation media" as Facebook, Twitter, Linkedin, Google+,  etc.

Personal connections is the key to move a lot of users on the platform and rise up the value of the entire platform, obtaining better advertising rating and rising a decent amount of money for the authors.

Comics' authors, especially newcomers, can easily reach millions of users around all the world, creating a solid background about their works, plus gain some money, that is always good!

Comics' authors will be always the only owners of their works: they will never sell to the platform any rights, they just allow the platform to publish their works for the digital parts in order to obtain views and divide the ads revenue.

Network is also a wonderfull example of meritocracy: every result here depends only on the skills and efforts employed.

The core idea is really simple and in a lot of occasions, a simple idea works damned fine when you have skilled developers that work on it :)

 

What I Need:

I need 50.000$ to realize this project.
I've contacted many different web developers, but only one was able to follow all my 56 pages of specifications :)

These crazy guys work for the "Officine Bianche" (http://www.officinebianche.it/) an Italian cross-multimedia communication agency.


This web based platform must be as much possible bulletproof and assure cutting edge performances for the users.
The web developers show me how they works and the framework that they want to use: -> EZ publish <- was used to power and manage the video archive of the ESA (European Space Agency) and the performance showed are really impressive.
This framework has to move tons of GB of data everyday with a minimum delay and not toast the server CPUs ;-)

This amout of money will cover:

  • Development cost
  • QA cost
  • SEO cost
  • Advertising campaing for the release of the platform
  • Estimated server (full hosting) expenses for 1 year
  • Estimated bandwidth plus back for 1 year

The domain www.comicsjump.net is already secured :)

With 3 months of development plus 1 month of heavy tests, this project can be completed and launched!

I'm aiming to have it ready and run for december 2012 in order to maximize all the efforts and strike with a big success.

Why I'm using the flexible funding option?
Because even in the case that the goal of the project will not be reached, I can divide the development work in small modules (this will complicated things quite a bit) and start working on the core features of the platform.
Leaving the development of the additional features after the release.


What You Get: AKA The Perks ^^;

You can contribute to make this project a success with the perks or buying the limited edition merchandising available on the shop that I've setup at cafepress.com. (you will find the link at the bottom of this page)

Here the breakdown of the perks: YOU will became part of the project ^^;
I'm looking for a nicer graphic solution that a mere list :)

Anyway here the list of the seven sins, ehm the 7 standard perks!

  1. A big thank you!
  2. Personal thanks & mailing list
  3. Forum Pack
  4. NickName Pack
  5. Credits pack
  6. Thank you -> Home Banner <-
  7. Achievement Unlock!

NOTE: all of these perks are incremental: if you choose for example the N7 "Achievemente Unlock!" perk, you will receive all others 6 previous perks!

There are also 3 super perks:

  1. Enter the comics!
  2. Main Characters!
  3. Your comics live!

these 3 specific perks are NOT incremental and they are separated from the other 7.
Basically these 3 super perks are reserved to the people who want to leave a proof of his/her deep support to the project ^^;

There is also 1 epic perk:

Half of Eternity!

This perk is for who wants to invest in the project in a different way and obtain a special result that will last forever (which will come before? the end of time or the end of the Comicsjump project? I strongly believe the first!).


This perk is NOT incremental and it is separated from all the others.

The Impact (Thor Hammer falllll..ehmm ehmm)


Is this enough? ;-)
She is Gabriel: the high seraph that will oversee the project!
Mortal, kneel down to her boo... ehm Wings! I mean Wings!!!

 

Other Ways You Can Help The Project to Obtain Success!

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this specific  campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Speak with all your friend that usually read comics and tell them about this project!
  • buying the limited edition merchandising.

story:
Ben

This is Ben.

Ben loves to make deals. The stupid kind. Deals so stupid he once tried to get me to shave my hair for an equal volume of homemade kale chips. He keeps an open challenge to anyone willing to bet $300 on a game of rock-paper-scissors. Look into those sunglasses. The man is a monster.

Two days ago, Ben made me another deal: If I buy it for him, he will remove his laptop keyboard and replace it with a twenty-pound typewriter for the duration of his study abroad in Budapest, Hungary.

I told Ben I would find a way.

Ben did not believe me.

We're now a mere $875 from stripping the keys off his computer and hooking a fully-functional USB typewriter to his screen.

Imagine it:  The sweat on Ben's face as he tows that anvil through the streets of Budapest; Ben's classmates, staring gape-mouthed at the behemoth on the desk before him; Ben, typing in libraries and sleepy coffee shops with all the quietness of crickets playing castanets.

So join us. Together, we can revel in the knowledge that, somewhere in Hungary, some idiot is doing his coursework on a doorstop.

 

Inconvenience quantified

To demonstrate just how annoying this will be for Ben, I've put together a few stats:
  1. Ben's laptop is a Dell XPS 13 developer edition. A featherweight, the 13 clocks in at just 2.6 pounds. Ben's new keyboard will weigh more than five times that, plus he'll still shoulder the weight of the actual computer.
  2. Estimating the walking distance of Ben's daily commute to the classes offered by the Budapest Semesters in Mathematics program is hard because Ben hasn't yet scoped out an apartment. But given that Ben will be housed somewhere near the historic city center, and that his classes are offered through partnerships with Eötvös University, the Mathematical Institute of the Hungarian Academy of Sciences, and Budapest University of Technology and Economics, I was able to make some rough calculations. Assuming that Ben lives exactly on the city center and takes public transportation to Eötvös (the closest of the three universities), he will still have to walk a minimum distance of 1360 meters a day. That much walking, three times a week for three and a half months, comes out to roughly 35.5 miles. We can only hope there are some stairs in there.
  3. Ben plans to visit the beautiful cities of Vienna and Prague! Good for him! He'll be taking the typewriter.
  4. Ben is expressly forbidden from using other keyboards (emergencies notwithstanding). The typewriter should significantly lower the 110 words-per-minute average he takes so much pride in. I'm not sure I can explain how hard for him this will be.

Where the $$$ go

Base goals

  • $875 gets Ben a renovated Underwood typewriter (plus shipping and tax) from http://www.usbtypewriter.com/.  Here's the model Ben requested.  Meeting this goal guarantees that Ben will start a blog to document his burden.

Stretch goals

  • $100 over the goal buys Ben a carrying case for the typewriter. Because c'mon, we're not that mean.
  • $200 over the goal covers the case and shipping the typewriter to Budapest. If we make it to $975 but not here, I will cover the shipping myself.

Above $1075

  • Above $1075,  donations go to cover the expenses for t-shirts and stickers. (Even if we don't make it above $1075, I will honor all the perks for qualifying donors.)
  • Once expenses are covered, all additional donations will go directly to the Against Malaria Foundation, one of independent charity evaluator GiveWell's top-rated charities.

Remember: this is a fixed-funding campaign!

Should we fail to meet our goal, all contributions will be returned via PayPal.


FAQ

Will Ben really do it?

Look at that face. Abso-fucking-lutely.

What's in it for me?

Aside from all the perks available to qualifying donors, any donation (the $1 Indiegogo minimum or above) will get you an access code to Ben's weekly blog so you can follow his descent into typewriter madness.

What will you do with money over the goal amount?

Ben, charitable man that he is, wants to donate all surplus $$$ to the worthy cause that is the Against Malaria Foundation. If we exceed our goal, I will post proof of donation here within 30 days.

story:
Wynonna Earp: Legends Graphic Novel

Signed by Melanie Scrofano, Tim Rozon, and Beau Smith

This Indiegogo Exclusive signed edition is printed, packed, and waiting for your address to be put on the label.

The standard, unsigned version of this book is available in bookstores everywhere, but you can only find this edition—and all the great extras—here on this Indiegogo campaign!

The Book

In this exciting collection, Wynonna decides to take a vacation after everything she's been through, but things don't exactly go as planned. Plus, Wynonna and Doc Holliday may have faced off against demons and Revenants, but nothing can prepare them for all the trouble the infamous Pinkertons are about to unleash! Featuring the first comic appearance of Waverly Earp, this edition collects issues #7-8 of the Wynonna Earp series, plus issues #1-4 of Wynonna Earp: Legends.

With richly detailed artwork by Chris Evenhuis, this collection was written by Beau Smith and Wynonna Earp stars Melanie Scrofano and Tim Rozon—that's right, Wynonna Earp and Doc Holliday co-wrote these stories!

 

Indiegogo Exclusive Edition

Why Earpers won't want to miss this incredible book:

  • Each book is hand-signed by Melanie, Tim, and Beau.
  • Limited to only 500 copies!
  • Only available from this Indiegogo Campaign.

Earpers Who Need More

We dug through our warehouse and wrangled up some amazing exclusives that need a new home—YOURS!

  • LANYARDS: These were created before the show was even on the air for use by IDW staff during WonderCon 2016 and the private Wynonna Earp screening and launch party. A few of them were also handed out during the 2016 San Diego Comic-Con. This is the last batch of these extremely rare, unused lanyards that we have. Don't miss out on the chance to show your Earper pride with some of the earliest Wynonna Earp memorabilia ever created!
  • POSTERS: An 11" X 17" poster was created to promote Season 2 and handed out at different conventions in advance of the season's premiere. These posters are some of the last that we have and were kept in pristine condition deep within our warehouse. They will be shipped to you in a reinforced poster tube. 
  • PINS: Show your Earper pride wherever you go! These limited edition enamel pins were created exclusively for San Diego Comic-Con 2017 and the Wynonna Earp Blu-ray campaign (www.WynonnaEarpBluray.com). Featuring the Wynonna Earp  logo, a U.S. Marshals Badge, a Special Deputy Badge, and a rainbow-colored Pride Mustache, this batch here is the last we have before they're all gone!
  • NECKLACES: A highly detailed replica of the necklace that Wynonna herself wears on the TV show! These flew off the shelves at SDCC 2017 and were offered as a perk in the Wynonna Earp Blu-ray campaign (www.WynonnaEarpBluray.com). We've only got 10 left, so get yours before they disappear!

Super Rare Show Costumes for Charity!

Also in this campaign, you have the chance to own actual clothing worn by the cast during filming of the TV show Wynonna Earp.

And Wynonna isn't the only one out there who can do some good—ALL the proceeds from these two perks will go to charities personally selected by Melanie and Tim!

WYNONNA'S DRINK WELL WITH OTHERS SWEATSHIRT

  • Sweatshirt worn by Wynonna Season 2, Episode 6.
  • Signed by Melanie Scrofano.
  • 100% of money raised from this perk goes to Melanie's charity of choice: World Wildlife Fund, Canada (www.wwf.ca).

DOC'S SHIRT

  • The shirt right off Doc's back from Season 1, Episode 5.
  • Signed by Tim Rozon.
  • 100% of money raised from this perk goes to Tim's charity of choice: GLAAD (www.glaad.org).

story:
A Brief History of A Broken Winter

Debuting on November 2, 2009, A Broken Winter is a long-running webcomic written by myself (Kale Night) and illustrated by Archie the Redcat, a professional comic book artist. The series contends with themes ranging from the corruption of authority to gay rights.

Archie is a commissioned artist, which means each page of the comic is paid for by me. I've managed to cope with this fairly well over the years, with the help of occasional donations from fans and friends. However, after an extended period of unemployment and an English degree I can't seem to do anything with, I need help funding the rest of the current story arc. By the time the arc is completed I hope to be in a better financial situation and back to funding the comic primarily on my own.

What Does This Mean?

There's a minimum of 65 pages left to go in order to complete the current story arc, which follows the life of Kokkan as a captive in a government slaughterhouse. The conclusion of this arc indicates the closure of this aspect of Kokkan's life and the beginning of another.

The cost of commissioning the required number of pages combined with hosting fees for the website are the basis of the fundraising total. Any money raised will go directly toward financing more pages for your viewing pleasure and keeping the website afloat.

Why Should You Donate?

If you're reading this, chances are you enjoy reading the comic. I hope that will be sufficient for some of you to feel inspired to see it continue to grow and remain free to read.

Not only are you helping me to finance a project that I hold very close to my heart, but keeping A Broken Winter going means continuing to draw attention to important issues like children who are negatively impacted by war and the denial of basic human rights to anyone who defies the heteronormative paradigm. This project means so much more to me than being able to see my work in a visual format, it means giving a voice to anyone who suffers as a result of oppression or mental illness.

I've tried to be creative with the incentives, given a lack of monetary resources, so hopefully they're still appealing enough to provide some degree of motivation.

If you're unable to donate, please help spread the word either by posting a link to the campaign or by promoting the website itself. Every bit helps. Thank you for reading and allowing A Broken Winter to come as far as it has. All it needs now it a little boost.

If anyone has any questions/concerns, please feel free to contact me at kalenight@gmail.com

 

Update (06/23/2013): Some of you may be aware of the flooding situation in Calgary and other parts of Southern Alberta. I was evacuated from the house I was renting (which is close to the Bow River) on the 20th and have yet to be allowed to return. I've been informed that the house is flooded with water and chances are high that I'll be forced to relocate. I wanted to assure everyone that any money donated for A Broken Winter will still go toward the comic. If anyone would like to leave a donation of a more personal nature they are free to do so, but pleace leave a note or comment specifying that your donation is intended as such.  Anything is appreciated. Thank you.

story: Hi, I'm Allan Sconza, writer, actor (see films I star in) , lead singer. I am here today to find people who love deep psychological thrillers! I have been working on a story for 10 years and am now printing it as a 20-issue comic series, THE PURPOSE OF FLIES! This is your chance to be first onboard with these comics before anyone else! I just need your help printing the first issue to get it all started. The first issue is all ready to go. I do everything for the comic myself, (story, artwork, etc.). I know a lot of people are already to buy the first issue, so for the people who just want to read it, this is like a way to pre-purchase the issue, and for those of you who want more, I have set up some pretty tasty perks for you. Let's get this started so we can begin reading this together by the summer!

story:
The New Recruits is a comic written by Brad Glenn and Drawn by James Clement. Brad has been writing and drawing his comic, Utility Belt, for five years, and is also working on another ongoing comic called Hat Trick. James has been drawing and selling his prints at comic conventions all over Alberta.

This is our first collaborative effort, and we're both excited about bringing together this story of a group of young superheroes coming to terms with the unique situations they encounter while training to become superheroes.

This story is unique. It isn't really about superhero fights and battles, although there are a number of them in the comics, but more than that, it's about people. It's about being young and away from home, and given freedoms, choices, responsibilities, and consequences. It's about the pressures that change people, and how stress can make you question your beliefs.

As this is a fairly large project, we will be spending much more time on it than on previous works. The money will go mainly to paying James so that he can spend his days creating this comic. The rest of the money will be spent on printing costs and supplying rewards to those of you who choose to help fund us. Any extra money we get will be spent giving James more time to work on each page, or if possible increasing the comic size. More money means we can add on an extra issue or two to the run!

Your contribution will make a difference! Both James and I are breaking into the comics field, and we're excited and motivated to create more and more comics. I've got a number of scripts that I'm preparing for the future, and by funding us on our initial venture you're encouraging new artists to create new work. You're changing the comics industry one comic at a time!

The New Recruits is a self-contained four issue story. One issue is not enough to convey the story and emotion that I intend. Both James and I are committed to completing all four issues.

Every dollar helps. We're going to make this project regardless of how much we make, as we fully intend to respect the rewards offered. Plus, every extra dollar will be put back into this project to make it the best that it can be. If you cannot contribute, please pass the word along that we're looking for help financially on this project, and that the final product will be fantastic! Please use the Indiegogo share tools to put us on twitter and facebook, and any other media. There are some great tools here on Indiegogo!

 

Stretch Goals!

$3000 - All donators of $15 or more get a New Recruits postcard with their comic.

$4000 - All donators of $8 or more will get a special edition cover, not like those people who plan to buy the comic after it's out!

story:
Too Late for Halloween!

Pete Von Sholly has been holding out. It turns out this demented master of the macabre art of low-brow satire has dozens of Monster Laff Parade cartoons that poke fun at our favorite undead, freakish, ghostly, and creepy monsters, vampires, ghosts, and more. Pete and I figured the best way to celebrate Halloween and get these into the hands of our favorite ghouls was as a pack of 18 trading cards. After enough of you suckers--er, patrons, that is--pitch in, that number could multiply like a Gremlin under a watering can.

Then, we realized Halloween was as close as the hot breath of a pursuing werewolf on the back of our collective neck.

So, if we fund, you'll still get the Monster Laff Parade set--they're just going to be fashionably late. Like November. Maybe even December.

They come with horrific humor on the back of each card, with a gag cartoon on the front.

But that's okay, because monsters (or jokes) are relevant any time of the year, and these may prove the perfect present for dysfunctional family holidays. 

Oh, and all of these cards are intended as works of satire--as if you hadn't figured that out yet.

The Impact

Right now, the world needs to see monsters put in uncomfortable and awkward situations, to be the butt of puns and dad jokes--all lavishly illustrated by master of horror art and lovable weirdo supreme Pete Von Sholly. 

You know Pete's work: he's worked as a storyboard artist on movies that include Darkman, The Shawshank Redemption, The Mist, and on monster movies featuring monsters Freddy Krueger, Jason Voorhies, Pumpkinhead, and Chucky. He's illustrated stories from H.P. Lovecraft to Stephen King. Horror is in his DNA--along with a strain of satire and gag humor.

Monster Laff Parade is Pete's first foray into trading cards and, if successful, will lead him to come up with more quirky, unique, and crazy humor sets.

As for me, I've run about two dozen crowdfunding campaigns, mostly trading cards, and have boiled everything from soup to nuts down to a science.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk we face is having our cards misprint or get hijacked en route by zombies. Since I've been using the same reliable printer for a few years now, and since all the production art is complete, I'm not the least bit worried.

However, if anything rears its ugly head, I'll be sure to let you know ASAP. Since this will follow my usual production/crowdfunding schedule, I anticipate having them to you about a month after funds appear.

You know what would also be awesome? Even if you can't pitch in, you can help spread the word through Indie GoGo's sharing tool. Or by carrier bat. Or by sending a message to the afterlife.

Oh, and all of these cards are intended as works of satire--as if you hadn't figured that out yet.

The Impact
Right now, the world needs to see monsters put in uncomfortable and awkward situations, to be the butt of puns and dad jokes--all lavishly illustrated by master of horror art and lovable weirdo supreme Pete Von Sholly. 
You know Pete's work: he's worked as a storyboard artist on movies that include Darkman, The Shawshank Redemption, The Mist, and on monster movies featuring monsters Freddy Krueger, Jason Voorhies, Pumpkinhead, and Chucky. He's illustrated stories from H.P. Lovecraft to Stephen King. Horror is in his DNA--along with a strain of satire and gag humor.
Monster Laff Parade is Pete's first foray into trading cards and, if successful, will lead him to come up with more quirky, unique, and crazy humor sets.

As for me, I've run about two dozen crowdfunding campaigns, mostly trading cards, and have boiled everything from soup to nuts down to a science.

Risks & Challenges
The biggest risk we face is having our cards misprint or get hijacked en route by zombies. Since I've been using the same reliable printer for a few years now, and since all the production art is complete, I'm not the least bit worried.
However, if anything rears its ugly head, I'll be sure to let you know ASAP. Since this will follow my usual production/crowdfunding schedule, I anticipate having them to you about a month after funds appear.
You know what would also be awesome? Even if you can't pitch in, you can help spread the word through Indie GoGo's sharing tool. Or by carrier bat. Or by sending a message to the afterlife.

story:
Short Summary


  • My name is Matilda, and I am a 3rd-year student reaching the end of my studies, on BA (hons) Illustration at the University of Westminster.

  • I have used the opportunity of my final major project to begin a graphic novel series that comments on our current 'Throw-Away Lifestyle'. I have always been passionate about environmental discussions and these are now more urgent than ever. This said I have to recognise that not everybody is willing to read through pages and pages of depressing and complicated data and theories to stay up to date with the current situation. In recent years this tendency slightly shifted to a more coloured and animated infographics to try to catch the attention of the viewer while still communicating a message. What I am trying to do is one step further. Basing an entire comic on real environmental facts and statistics, I'll be able to give the reader a narrative to follow that, hopefully, will still be able to convey the message of how our actions and inactions are impacting the World we live in. 


  • The narrative focuses on characters living in the year 2984, by which point the planet 'Earth' is covered in garbage, sea levels have risen, the ozone layer is in tatters and humans are living in underground settlements. The community runs on trade in skills, labour, food tokens and practical materials sourced from the surface. Basically everything that is happening now and we fear happening in the future has already happened. Although the setting of the story is very much dystopian and commenting on serious consequence, it was important to me that the tone be humorous, and this is done through the rather mad and crude characters.



  • I have developed the idea, completed initial sketches and concept art, and now I need some help to get the work printed and display ready for our degree show. Anything will help, and there are a few perks to encourage you that I hope you will enjoy. If there is any money left over from the cost of the preparing my work for the show, then this will go towards the printing and publishing costs of the first issue of 'Garbage Striders'.


(Concept Art - 'The Surface' - Working Progress)

Main Characters


  • Mole - F - Protagonist, Garbage Strider: tough, bit of a bitch, confident, loyal... fear of soap (thinks it will weaken her immune system)
  • Dolly (Short for Randolph) - M - Mole's Partner in Garbage Striding: Very tall, calm with occasional outbursts, usually the result of underlying OCD
  • Mud Duck - M - A Working Creatures, amphibious texture, looks like a cross between a lizard and a boar
  • Berg - M - A large mutated being that operates a 'fast track' lift to the surface.
  • Fugmo - M - Garbage Fisherman: covered in growths, uses magnets on the end of his line, thinks gold is magnetic (still valuable as a conductor of electricity)
  • The Keeper - M - Takes care of all the working creatures.
  • The Mechanic - F - A manic genius, incredibly resourceful.

(Character designs for female protagonist)


Other Ways You Can Help...


  • Please share this with anyone you think might be interested
  • Remember you can use the Indiegogo share tools!


Thank you for taking the time to read about this project, I hope it sparked your interest. And if you've chosen to help it be realised, you can select which Perk you wish to receive for your contribution, thanks again!

If you want to see more of what I'm about or ask me any questions, please feel free to visit my website, where you can find my contact - www.matildadawes.com

(Final decision on the features for 'Mole' - on the right)

story:
The campaign is over! However, you can still purchase the book online over here.
---
My name is Angina Herrmann, and I’m a freelance writer and a self-proclaimed artist living in Switzerland but originally from cold and exotic Finland. I have written, hand-painted, designed and lettered a graphic novel about angels, those gracious and vicious creatures of a fantasy world so much like ours, and now I’m looking to get my firstborn printed.

The deal is simple: check out this draft of the graphic novel, and if you like it, come back and contribute to my campaign. Sure, you can contribute even if you haven’t read it, but why miss the opportunity to check what this is all about? And sure, you can also contribute even if you don’t like my book, me being so loveable and all, but why wouldn’t you like it?

These contributions will help me bind the angels on paper and send those pages to you and others like you, anywhere around the world. For 25 euros you can get your own print copy of the upcoming book, sent anywhere in Europe – and the rest of the world is covered with only EUR 30. The price will go up after the campaign, so don’t miss your early bird opportunity!

Quick facts about the book

The graphic novel is written in English. It has approximately 230 pages, all in full colour, each panel hand-painted with acrylic paints on paper and then scanned and digitally arranged into full pages. The printed book will be a paperback sized A4 (210 mm × 297 mm, 8.27 in × 11.7 in).

What's the book all about?

The graphic novel tells the story of Astrid, a woman in her 30s, living in a northern city that may or may not resemble Helsinki, the capitol of my home country Finland. Angels have popped in and out of her life ever since she was a young girl, and now she feels the world around her shift, as if preparing for a change.

In addition to Astrid, the story will feature a colourful bunch of angels, both fallen and not, as well as humans – and something that falls in between. It’s a story of pain, loneliness, trust and the endless wonders of the human life.

How did it start?

I have made my living as a writer, and drawing and painting have been my escape and favourite pastime for as long as I can remember. It was about time that I combine the two and create a comic story, however devoid of comedy.

In early 2012 I was living in China with my family, working as a leisurely freelance journalist, with some extra time on my hands, as I started to feel the pressure to put this story on (digital) paper. I painted the first panels and published the first pages of this book-to-be in spring 2012 in two languages, Finnish and English, in my two blogs dedicated entirely to this project.

[The first desk drawer started getting really full about one year after the project started]

Creating this graphic novel turned out to be really addictive and rewarding, as I started to discover my own style. Consequently, since what I started with was not what I ended up with, the paintings and texts went through a few iterations before settling into the form they are today.

[Repainting old pages in a new country, on a bigger desk.]

What about the money?

What I need is simple: printing one hundred copies of the book costs 2,000 euros, so that’s what I’m asking for from the generous people of the World Wide Web. Of course, having a book printed and distributed is not really quite that straightforward: there are all kinds of taxes, shipping costs and ISBN costs involved, as well as Indiegogo's small cut of the pie. However, since I’ve set some money aside for such random costs and prefer to keep things simple, here’s a pie chart of what I’m looking to raise and what I’m planning to do with it:


So no, I’m not looking to make a profit here, or even get compensated for all the costs: I’m just eager to get the book on paper and that paper spread around the globe! If the campaign target is exceeded, the money will go towards printing a larger edition of the book, thus bringing it to an even larger audience! And of course I am already working on a sequel to the book, so any support will have a direct link to my future productivity.

Oh yeah, and it’ll make me feel all warm and fuzzy on the inside.

Shut up and take my money! – Wait, PayPal?

Indiegogo campaigns using euro as currency can only receive payments via PayPal, not via credit card. However, you should know that you can use your credit card via PayPal even if you don't have a PayPal account. So fret not, credit card owners, you won't have to create any new accounts just to contribute to my campaign!

Spread the love

If you're unable to contribute financially to my campaign but still wish to help, you'll do it best by spreading the word. Tell everyone what an awesome book I'm printing! Share this page on Facebook, Google+, Twitter, in your blog, you name it! You'll feel all the better for it!

story:
The purpose of this video is to promote my graphic novel: Blaze of Glory Iraq.

 

My name is James A. Bretney.  I am the writer, producer and illustrator of Blaze of Glory Iraq.  Blaze of Glory Iraq is an extension of the based on a true story youtube web-series  chronicling the saga of James LeRoy McCormick and the 518th Gun Truck Company - the most decorated convoy escort company during Operation Iraqi Freedom.  This campaign will raise $ 1,000 toward building an e-commerce website to digitally distribute the graphic novel "Blaze of Glory Iraq."

 

This is a story about an veteran of the Persian Gulf War who returns to fight a second Iraq War.  James McCormick faces three external conflicts: the Iraqi Insurgents who want to kill Americans, his own troops who look at their deployment as a vacation from their lives and their wives, and his own commanding officer who is more concerned about advancing his career than the safety of his soldiers.  Like I said it is a true story based on the public domain works of U.S. Army Transportation Historian Richard Killblane.  Richard Killblane wrote the "The Filthy Thirteen and is himself a West Point graduate and Special Forces soldier.  I myself am an Iraq War veteran.

 

I collected war comics as a kid they introduced me to the war my grandfathers fought.  This story details heroism and cowardice, loyalty and betrayal and indomitability of the American fighting spirit.  Your contribution will enable people from all over the world to know this story - a story that needs to be told.  For after all, only the dead have seen the end of war.

 

 

Times are tough but there are other ways you can contribute.  Sharing this video or linking to this site on twitter or Facebook is one way you can help the campaign.  You can visit the Facebook site and check out issue # 1.  Issue # 1 is free. Watch the series on youtube.  Rate, Comment, Share and Subscribe.  Pray for me.  Pray for James and Rich, our soldiers and our country.  That is the most worthwhile and powerful thing you can do.  Thank you again and GOD BLESS YOU AND GOD BLESS AMERICA!!!

story:
Who Are We & What Is Epiphany?

Hi, I'm Ian Jay. I'm an independent cartoonist with a B.F.A. in Sequential Art and over eight years of webcomics experience. You may remember me from the fundraiser I did last year to finance my short story comic collection, Ian Jay Super Comics Volume One. This year, I'm back with an even more ambitous project: turning my long-running webcomic Epiphany into a printed graphic novel.

Epiphany is about Eli, a deer kid in high school with a lot of issues-- bad grades, careless friends, and a strained relationship with his preacher father, Henry. But when an errant truck puts Henry into critical condition, Eli seeks out Oscar, slacker ex-god of his family's religion, to help recover his father. Things don't go entirely as planned, and both Eli and Oscar will have to put everything they hold dear at risk in order to make things right again.

Although I've been publishing Epiphany online serially since 2008 (read it as it finishes up at ianjay.net), it's a story that's meant to be read as one continuous experience, not in drips and drops over the course of years. That's why, even before I started the series, I knew it would eventually need to be printed as a book-- it's the medium that best fits the content. Now that Epiphany is reaching its conlcusion, it's time to make that book a reality.

What We Need

The finished book will be 6 by 9 inches, 236 pages and in full color. Within those pages will not only be the entire comic run, but also sketches, annotated location references, a guest gallery and more. Gasch Printing of Odenton, MD has sent me a quote for $3797.34 for 300 copies using the book specifications I gave them, so I'm asking for an even $5000. Here's how I'm breaking down our 5K goal:

$3800 - printing the book.
$600 - shipping pre-orders.
$400 - donation perk merchandise.
$200 - Indiegogo fees.

Shipping really bit into my stretch goal earnings during the last fundraiser I did, so this time around I want to make sure I leave enough of a budget to get every pre-order shipped.

NOTE TO INTERNATIONAL DONATORS:
Shipping abroad costs more than it used to, and I can't add variable shipping options to Indiegogo's donation perks (at least, as far as I know). If you're ordering from outside the United States, please add an extra 10 to 15 dollars to your order, just to make sure I can ship your items to you safely.

What You Get

We have a really incredible range of donation perks, including glow-in-the-dark and gold buttons, t-shirts, votive candles, and that ever-popular staple of fundraisers everywhere, tote bags. We're also selling off original inked artwork from the book, and providing all donation tier levels with high-resolution digital book copies. It's the biggest wave of new merchandise I've put out since... well, ever! And the more you donate, the more you get.

I feel like the most significant perk, though, is that starting at our $20 level, you can get your name (or pseudonym or alias of choice or whatever) printed in the book's Acknowledgements section. It might seem like an odd gesture to make, but Epiphany in general has always been a team effort. Drawing a comic isn't just about me shouting my ideas into the void; it's about you readers (and potential readers, of course) receiving those ideas and thinking about them within the individual contexts of your lives. Comics are a really intense collaborative experience between artists and readers, and printing this book is only another way that we're all banding together to help create something amazing.

Also it should go without saying that the books themselves will be so completely great. You'll be able to read Epiphany without a device or internet connection. You can put them on a bookshelf and marvel at how impressive and prestigious it makes your collection of books look. If you read it and don't like it, you can use it to kill insects or prop a wobbly table leg up or something, I don't know. IN ANY CASE: YOU'RE STILL A TEAM PLAYER.

How You Can Help, Besides Donating

I'm going to be absolutely screaming my head off about this fundraiser campaign until May 25th, but I can't possibly do it alone. I'll regularly be posting updates and news posts both here and on my progress blogs at twitter.com/IanJay and http://ianjay.tumblr.com; any reposting, retweeting, reblogging or otherwise there will really help me out. Ian Jay Super Comics also has a Facebook fan page, in case you're more of a Facebook fan.

I can't emphasize enough, though, how important word of mouth is-- not just on social networking sites but person to person as well. Go to my website, read Epiphany, and if you like it, don't just stop at pre-ordering a book for yourself! Tell your friends! Blog about it, or bother other people's blogs about it! Recommend it to others who might even vaguely find it interesting, both online and "in meat space"! It's really, really easy to get drowned out here, so let's make sure this project gets the attention it deserves.

Thanks for stopping by. Whether you're a long-time fan or a newcomer to Epiphany, whether you're donating a whole pile of money or only a few cents (or nothing at all), I really appreciate you taking the time to check out this project. Let's make this book happen together!

story:
Why buy Flaco this Plane ticket to Japan?

 

  • International Exposure of the Detroit artist culture and building international artistic relationships are the most important things to me for this campaign, the more people over seas that know of all the awesome things happening here in Detroit, the better! My city gets a very bad wrap media wise, but I am here every single day meeting amazing people great spirits and surrounded by amazing artists as well as other community developers. It's a lot more happening in my city than media will allow to be known, and its a bubbling underground movement that will soon be impossible to ignore, I am one of the leaders of the movement, I serve as an inspiration to a lot of up and coming creators, once accomplished, This Campaign will help inspire every up and coming Detroit artist.

  • Flaco Shalom (myself) is a fine artist from Detroit,MI gallery owner and community developer. Participant  of Hop Scotch Detroit (World's Longest Hopscotch , Wedge Detroit), Owner & operator of The Untitled Bottega, an uncurated art gallery that invites all artists all all styles and mediums to showcase. Flaco Shalom has worked along side with The Heidelberg Project as a 2012 Emerging Artist, 

     

  • This campaign helps the members of my community more than it helps me as an individual, every artist who has ever worked with me never saw art as a career, only a hobby on the side, until they met me. It's a rare thing to find a full time self sustainable artist in the city of Detroit, the community I've built is one of dreamers, shakers, hustlers, creators and movers, we all inspire one another.

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • These funds are going to these things ONLY! Supplies for art, Passport, Plane tickets, Food, my Hotel, and Gallery rental fee! thats it!
  • Everyone who contributes gets a copy of the comic strip. A signed print from the collection and a Hot Potato button.
  • If I do not reach my entire goal, funds will only go towards getting a plane ticket.

The Impact

 

  • After completion of this project you will have assisted in getting a magnitude of exposure of Detroit art is Japan, a country that is 10 years ahead in fashion and technology, imagine the market and opportunities that will open up from this one action!
  • When I campaigned with Hopscotch detroit, of Wedge Detroit, we only raised $1,200 using crowd funding and still managed to break the world record! Detroit has a never  say die spirit! we are resilient, we are Hustlers who take the little we have to make the most.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have a Blog, Blog about this, if you have a Twitter, Tweet about this if you have a Facebook, Facebook this if you have a Instagram, Instragram this! GET THE WORD OUT!

story:
The Pitch

We are a husband and wife team with Atom on writing and voice duties and Hanji on animation. Animating Temp Tales is truly a labor of love and we hope to get some support for this latest episode so we can keep making them! Our dream is that one day we can make Temp Tales full time, but for now we're just focused on the next episode. The $1,000 budget is a fraction of what we would make doing commercial animations, which is how we make our living these days. It doesn't include the cost of writing, recording or to hire voice actors. It really only helps to cover some of the costs of the time it takes to animate the cartoon, which would be otherwise spent doing paying animation jobs. To break it down, a one-minute animation takes roughly about a week if we're gunnin it. This next cartoon will be over two minutes to give you an rough idea of the animation work involved. The script and audio recording are ready to go for this next cartoon, so all we need is your financial support and we'll be off and running. But if you don't have a cent to spare, please share this link and tell your friends!

story:
Velthaneus is a mature Sci-Fi comic. A hand-drawn debut from the creator, illustrator, and storyteller Ashley West. Enter a mad world filled with character expressions as extreme as their physical proportions. 

Welcome to the debut of Art of Velthaneus Volume 01, a 104-page collection of illustrations and concept art created between the years 2016-2019. Wait, there's more! The variant cover edition of Velthaneus Issue 01: Humanoid Psycho is dropping alongside the art book. Same 48 pages (32 story pages) of wacky interiors. Crazy new cover art. 

Meet Thane. He's strong. Stomping monsters and parkouring through the cavernous strata, he's unmatched. But, IT'S USELESS without the one in charge of his sex drive and FIGHTING SPIRIT...The id.

Finding his id means freedom, and Thane will be damned if he rots in hell. Consider the challenges conquered, so long as he resists the sensual Ellexa.

Art of Velthaneus Volume 01 and Velthaneus Issue 01 are finished products. Yay! However, the cost of printing is expensive. IndieGoGo enables a budget for this project. It's made possible from the support of an eager fanbase ready to experience a new animated-style indie series. 

Risks and Challenges

Having run five successfully-funded Kickstarters and one IndieGoGo project, I am familiar with each platform. I am used to working at a professional level and understand the importance of meeting deadlines. I have no control over the speed at which the product is printed or shipped, but I am confident I will deliver a stunning product within​ the target time.

Cheers! You're gonna love Velthaneus!

Ashley

story:
Meet Dan Green

Dan was a cop, and not a very good one. In fact, he was pretty much the worst cop in the worst precinct in the worst city in the world. Crooked and corrupt, Dan cared about nothing and no-one but himself, until the day he turned a blind eye to the kidnapping of a six-year-old girl. That night, lying in bed, Dan felt something he had no memory of feeling before.


Guilt.


The next morning, Dan knew what he had to do. He would find the girl and save her, and life could go back to normal again.


Three hours into the investigation, Dan was brutally murdered and dumped in a shallow grave. That would've been the end of it, only Dan didn't stay dead. Two weeks after being buried, Dan's reanimated corpse dragged itself free of the ground.


And now Dan remembers it all. The girl. The investigation. The stab of hot steel cutting into his flesh, and the frantic, terrifying hopelessness as the soil came down over his face. Dan's mind is perfectly intact. Unfortunately his body is decomposing steadily, and if he is to have any hope of rescuing the missing girl, he's going to have to act fast.


GANGRENE is a darkly funny mini-series, jammed full of murder, mutilation, mutants and a hero whose arms occasionally drop off when he least expects it.


Who Are You People?!

GANGRENE is the brainchild of writer Barry Hutchison and artist Neil Chenier.


Barry is the author of the award-winning children's horror book series, INVISIBLE FIENDS, which is published by HarperCollins Children's Books. A comics fan from an early age, Barry came up with the idea for GANGRENE while being dismembered and buried alive by a gang of kidnappers.


That was a lie. Sorry. He can't remember when he came up with it, but he's very happy that he did. Although he has written over 30 books, including several based on the hit cartoon series, BEN 10 and GENERATOR REX, GANGRENE will be Barry's first comic.


Neil, on the other hand, has substantially more comic-book experience. Based in Winnipeg, Canada, Neil has pencilled comics for a number of publishers and is in constant demand for comissions.


Completing the team are Travis Stephens on inks, Fran Ros on colouring duties, with Kel Nuttal doing the lettering work. They're all lovely, and if any of them ever met your mum struggling to carry lots of shopping, they'd all be happy to help her.




Why are you doing this?!

We're doing it for you. No, really.

You see, we all know what happens in the story. Barry can write Dan's adventures forever more, and Neil could draw as many pages as he liked. We'd have enough GANGRENE action to keep us happy for the rest of our lives.

But no-one else would get to see it for a long time, and from the comments we've had on the completed pages of issue 1, a lot of people really want to read this comic.

Without funds, it might take us a couple of years to complete the mini-series, then several months to shop it around or decide if we're going to completely self-publish and distribute. Let's call it three years from now before a finished copy would be in anyone's hands.

If we manage to raise our $4000 target, though, then things can kick into high gear. Our creative team can afford to take some time away from their paying jobs to concentrate on GANGRENE. We'll have the resources available to look into our publishing and distribution options before the series is completed. We'll be able to produce the best quality comic we can, in the shortest timescale possible. And it'll be all thanks to you.


Where's the money going?!

Of our $4000 target, around $1000 will be spent on marketing, including the cost of some of the Perks available to those who donate their hard cash. (See the column on the right for more details of what's up for grabs).


The remaining $3000 will go towards paying our inker, colourist and letterer a page rate for the work they do. The rate will be well below what they would usually charge, but it will allow them to justify turning away full-paying work in order to complete GANGRENE. Neither Neil nor Barry will be taking any fee for the work they are doing, because Dan is their (hideously deformed) baby, and they're doing all this for the love of it.


If we don't hit the target, it isn't the end of the world. The project can still continue, but it will be a much slower process and not to the standard it might otherwise have been had we raised all the money. Every penny you donate will allow us to produce a better comic in a shorter period of time, and the sooner we do that, the sooner we can get started.


What if you exceed your goal?!

Cor, that would be nice, wouldn't it? If we make more than the $4000 it will allow us to produce more copies of the comic and spend more money marketing it. Extra funds will not go to the creative team, as these costs have already been included in the budget, so every dollar over our target will be spent on helping GANGRENE make as big a splash as possible.


What if I don't have any money to donate?!

That's OK. We've all been there. Having no money to donate doesn't mean you can't make a difference. Tell everyone you know about this page. Use the social networking links above to Tweet about our comic. Talk about it on Facebook. Email your friends, discuss it on forums, tattoo the link across your forehead - whatever, just get the page out there, and help us spread the word.

story:
Zombie International – an animated comic on the iPad, the very first of its kind! Experience a zombie comic never seen before. The first episode “All Undead On The Western Front” is coming to your tablet with 26 pages and 15 minutes of animated scenes.


What stories does Zombie International tell?

Zombie International is an epic zombie saga that unfolds from episode to episode. The first one “All Undead On The Western Front”is set during the First World War. Desperate to change the course of the war, the German high command ordered a platoon of men to be injected with chemically modified snake poison in the hope of them developing super human powers. However, instead, these guinea pig soldiers turned into zombies longing for human flesh and blood. 

Each following episode will take place in a different era, for example the ancient world, the Dark Ages and the 21st century.

What is our objective, who is the target audience?

Zombie International is scheduled for release for the iPad and other tablets this autumn. We love the classic zombie movies essentially shaped by Romero and Fulci. In other words: Our zombies are dumb and move slowly!

If you’re generally interested in comics, especially horror and zombie comics, then Zombie International is perfect for you.

Why should I support this project?

We want to create something new: a comic that honors the masters of the genre, but nonetheless tells an original story. Despite our attachment to the zombie genre we aim to set a new standard in story telling.

What will happen to your donations?

We have been working on this comic for more than two years. All expenses have come out of our own pockets. Now, shortly before release, we are facing new costs. Without exception, every donation will be used to finance the App as well as additional production costs.

Who are the guys behind Zombie International?

Zombie International belongs to Cappricorn Media UG, a start-up publisher established specifically for this project. We have the illustrator TimTonic on board for the artwork. Another member of our team is graphic designer and musician Sascha Carl, aka Scalp, who is in charge of animation and programming. Florian Schneider, aka The Swabian, is managing director of Cappricorn Media and responsible as author for the story, dialogue and text. The two journalists Dominik Drutschmann and Volker Schönenberger are responsible for marketing and public relations. We are pleased to have attracted Butch Loco of “The Reel Banditos” to compose the soundtrack for the first episode. Last but not least, there is a whole bunch of other guys who have also contributed to our ambitious project over the past two years. We can’t name them all, but you’ll know who you are!

story:
Hello! My name is Liz Valasco. I operate under the name Vialcomics. For the past two years, I have made two installments on my story The Seeker, and I am on my way to make the third. But, to make that happen, I need your help!

The Seeker is a story about Halloween and the mysterious events brought to life by a girl and her pumpkin head. What happens when you lift the veil between the ghost world and the day-to-day world? We will find out in part three!

**This book is for ages 12 and up, since it does have some curse words and some potentially scary material.**


So, the funding for this will be primarily for printing. As with the last two chapters, I hand print the covers myself and get the story printed elsewhere. I have also completely run out of copies of part one of the Seeker, so I need funds to get those reprinted.

If you are kind enough to give me some of your hard earned money, you will be rewarded by not only my eternal thanks and tears of joy, but with copies of the comic, original drawings, and other surprise goodies.

If I don't reach my entire goal, it's not the end of the world, because every bit helps. I recently moved across the country and times are tough, monetarily. So I'll print with whatever I have, maybe just not make as many copies.


If you've ever loved Halloween, dreams, ghosts, and mystery, you would love this comic. This is a comic for people who never stopped believing that there's more to the world than just what we see.
Parts one and two of The Seeker have received good reviews. They both debuted at Genghis Con in 2013 and 2014. 
This is the first story I've pursued for more than one issue. It's important to me to see this through. With your help, you could make my dreams a reality.


My goal is to have Part three ready before October 31st, 2015, for the Short Run fest in Seattle. What better way to debut a comic book about spooky stuff than on Halloween? 
At the moment, I'm working a part time job, which pays the bills and also gives me time to finish drawings and other projects. I know that I will have enough time to complete this by mid October. 


If you can't contribute, I understand. I know what it's like to be interested in something but also broke. You can still help by sharing this with anyone who you think would be interested!

story:
Welcome to the world of Superstar Fighter: Shooting Star. Lady Rinka is a princess from the planet Ioni, and learns of the alien Lord Gordock’s plan to invade her planet. To prevent this, she studies Earth’s heroes to try to put a stop to Lord Gordock. However, when she arrives on Earth, she learns that all of Earth’s superheroes only existed in things such as movies and comic books. Luckily, she has a plan B. The power suits she made for Earth’s heroes will not only help a select few, but will increase their strength as well. Lady Rinka now must recruit a team of “heroes” so that together they can stop Lord Gordock and his reign of tyranny. However, this won’t be easy as two of Lord Gordock’s top ranked killers have followed Rinka to Earth.

Thank you for checking out this kickstarter! By pre-ordering your copy of Superstar Fighter: Shooting Star #1, you are helping to ensure that enough copies are printed but this will also make sure we have some great artwork for you to enjoy. But fear not as your good deeds will not go unrewarded. Be sure to check out the perks to the side and maybe you will find one that interests you. Even if you cannot or chose not to donate, we understand! You can even help out by just sharing this project with others.

Justin Kontovich- Characters and Story

Andrea Blanco- Pencils and Colors
Alvarex- Inks and Backgrounds

heroes to try to put a stop to Lord Gordock. However, when she arrives on
Earth, she learns that all of Earth’s superheroes only existed in things such
as movies and comic books. Luckily, she has a plan B. The power suits she made
for Earth’s heroes will not only help a select few, but will increase their
strength as well. Lady Rinka now must recruit a team of “heroes” so that
together they can stop Lord Gordock and his reign of tyranny. However, this
won’t be easy as two of Lord Gordock’s top ranked killers have followed Rinka
to Earth.
Thank you for checking out this kickstarter! By pre-ordering
your copy of Superstar Fighter: Shooting Star #1, you are helping to ensure
that enough copies are printed but this will also make sure we have some great
artwork for you to enjoy. But fear not as your good deeds will not go
unrewarded. Be sure to check out the perks to the side and maybe you will find
one that interests you. Even if you cannot or chose not to donate, we
understand! You can even help out by just sharing this project with others.Justin Kontovich- Characters and Story
Andrea Blanco- Pencils and Colors
Alvarex- Inks and Backgrounds

story:
Hello!

My name is Matt Jardin, i am a journalist and first time comic book writer from Massachusetts. I have been a fan of comics my whole life and love the fantasy genre.

 

this campaign is to get the funds to complete the art work and lettering for the first issue of my comic, Knights of Fire. This is the first comic I have written and I really want to get it published for myself, and my daughter to show her that you can do anything you set your mind to.

contributors to this campaign mean everything to me and the campaign without contributors like you publishing this comic would not be possible.  It shows that you believe in the work I've done and hopefully become a fan of these characters that I love and want to keep alive.


to get the book fully illustrated and lettered I am asking for $2,500 on this campaign.  as i said the funding will be going to an amazing artist who brought these characters to life in pages seen below and to get words on the pages.

I'm excited to offer some fun perks for contributing such as some behind the scenes stuff, a poster of the cover, thank you page mentions, and even possibly a character named after you in a future issue. obviously you'll also receive Knights of Fire Issue 1 and my undying gratitude

 

If I fail to reach my goal rest assured the funds will still go to getting as much of the book ready to go as possible and I will try to finish on my own, or run anther campaign in the future with ore work finished.

 

This adventure comic following four friends who receive super powers not only entertains, it has great themes, winding tales, humor, and great action. the characters in this book are from all different walks of life and anyone can re;late to someone in the book.

This project is so important to me because it is really the first thing that I have created relying solely on my imagination. I have written articles and opinion pieces but this is the first thing I have to call my own 100% I wrote it to create a world that I would love to see in comics and hope you will too.

Your contribution will make my deem of being a comic creator come true

I have been working on this comic for 4 years now and have had a failed attempt at crowd funding before. I have had a little ore work done on it and hope that by investing in the project more on my own it is now ready for others to show interest in the project and contribute what they can.  I believe in this book and think that many people will enjoy what it has to offer.  the challenge for me will be the reach of the campaign. I have been taking some courses on social marketing so I am hoping this will help me reach a wider audience so I can brig this book to life and share it with you all.

If you can't contribute I totally understand. I ask that you take the time to please share this project with others if it sounds interesting to you or you know someone that would enjoy reading this. I thank you in advance for taking the time to help. THANK YOU!!
