story:
Avast, Ye Landlubbers!

 

Yoe-Ho-Ho! The same scurvy dogs who brought you Haunted Horror now share this booty: "Pirates"! Swashbuckling artists the likes of Frank Frazetta, Reed Crandall, Graham Ingels, Dick Briefer, etc. give ya complete comics stories to plunder, arrr!  Plus feast on art by bilge rats Wally Wood, Bernard Krigstein, Carl Burgos, Howard Pyle, and, yarrr, more! Avast ye, prepare to take you a prize--savvy, matey? 

 

This campaign features a new graphic novella from Clover Press and exclusive swag made for our Indiegogo supporters!

 

 

We've got two fine covers to choose from including an exclusive variant with a tremendous story behind it!

From Captain Craig Yoe:

Reed Crandall made an homage to The Father of American Illustration, Howard Pyle, when he drew a “Piracy” comic book cover for EC. We now make an homage to EC in our variant cover design and we use Pyle’s famous Pirate painting ”Who Shall Be Captain?” that inspired Crandall to do it! Also note  the painting on the left side of the cover is a Pyle painting that some historians cite as a reference for a later Frazetta painting!  

Pyle! Crandall! Frazetta! EC Homage! You’ll feel like a pirate rich with booty, matey, when you add this sparkling variant cover treasure to your booty! Avast now, ARRR!

 

Feast Your Eyes On The Loot!

For this two week campaign, we've put together a haul of exclusive collectibles rangin' from buttons, t' shirts, t' pirate masks so you can raid the high seas safely!

 

 

Pirates Graphic Novella is 80 Pages of Comics by Legendary Arrrrr-tist

 

Reed Crandall...

 

Will Eisner...

 

Carl Burgos...

 

Frank Frazetta...

 

 

Meet The Team

 

Yoe Books

Craig Yoe

Vice magazine has called Yoe the "Indiana Jones of comics historians." Publishers Weekly says he's the "archivist of the ridiculous and the sublime" and calls his work "brilliant." The Onion calls him "the celebrated designer," The Library Journal, "a comics guru". BoingBoing hails him "a fine cartoonist and a comic book historian of the first water." Yoe was Creative Director/Vice President/General Manager of Jim Henson's Muppets, and a Creative Director at Nickelodeon and Disney. Craig has won an Eisner Award and the Gold Medal from the Society of Illustrators.

Clizia Gussoni

Yoe Books are produced with cartoonist and designer Clizia Gussoni, author of the best-selling title, The Awesome Book of Sharks, The Awesome Book of Dinosaurs, and The Awesome Book of Bugs. In the Kid Power! series, I Care for The Earth, which she wrote, was awarded the Dr. Toy Best Green Product Award.

Clover Press is a progressive, eclectic, boutique publisher made up of four industry veterans. Our goal is to work on projects we have a strong passion for.

Risks and challenges

Clover Press is made up by a team of publishing professionals. While delays are always possible and sometimes impossible to control, the members of Clover are committed to delivering the best quality products in as timely a manner as possible.

story: This passion project has finally germinated into a full blown endeavor. I've drafted 30 pages of the first edition of The "Adventures" of Billy Bear Hands and M. Pervious. These original characters will find their way to the pages of a comic in spring 2015 and I will be grateful for any assistance with finishing cost that you can spare. with $500 I can produce a quality black and white comic detailing the origins of our heroes and their first "adventure" together. With your support the published product will be sold and promoted in conjunction with "Them Comics", a McDonough based small comic production group which has been generous and inspirational in this endeavor. In the unforeseeable event of excess funds I intend to produce a color version of the comic and I would thoroughly enjoy illustrating the continued adventures of these characters in later editions for anyone who cares to continue supporting them. Thanks so much for your consideration and please continue to support the things you enjoy.

Thanks so much for your consideration and please continue to support the things you enjoy.

story:
Short Summary

Yes! It means we're changing the world. Let me explain more about myself! Hi guys, my name is Marcus Day. You see, ever since I was a little child; I was able to draw; not good, but draw nonetheless. When I went to middle school; I stopped drawing altogether. It wasn't that I didn't like it, but it was more of an I didn't care for it anymore. That's when I got to high school and I went to an art class for the first time in a long time! When I got there, I was drawing, painting, and sculpting..  I hated my art teacher, because she was just mean and did not help any way shape or form. BUT! She did help me realize something; she helped me realized that I wanted to draw again. So a couple of weeks after being in that class, I finally went home, looked on YouTube of how to draw videos. I came across a Naruto how to video. Since it was my first time drawing, it took me 6 hours to complete! No joke, I timed myself. From there on, I continued YouTube drawing. And then I finally wanted to draw professionally. The next day, I went to Google and typed in pictures to draw. I then figured that I can do what most people can, which is sight drawing. I became a MASTER at it and I can draw anything from sight seeing. THEN next year while I was at school, one of my friends came up to me and asked me to draw pages from Naruto. (If you know manga, it goes from right to left, and my friend asked me if I could draw one chapter from Naruto.) I took his challenge and went home, pulled up a chapter, and drew every single page. It took me 10 hours to do, but I did it. I felt so proud of myself. I was able to do one chapter; woohoo! When I went to school the next day, I showed him. He was amazed at what he saw. Then he asked me: hey man, you should be a comic book artist, and it hit me like a sack of potatoes. My mind came was like: Wow Marcus, you can do this, you can. And I thought about it more and more! It became a part of me. I was going to do it. The VERY NEXT DAY, I tried to create a character and I realized one problem. I didn't know how to draw from my mind; it was frustrating (and still is) I didn't know what to do and I was extremely sad. I couldn't believe how many drawings I did (over 200) was all for nothing. I didn't know how to draw from my imagination. Awful. Very awful. I went to YouTube and looked up how to draw hoping that I can find something that will help me be able to draw like professionals in just one day. But sadly, it is not like that. It takes years to master. Go for me; ever since then I have been drawing for years to come. I have gotten SIGNIFICANTLY BETTER! It's not too hard anymore but it still causes me some problems. And now; I am going to college in a few weeks to major in art. My mother is not able to pay for my college courses. I only have a few scholarships and the rest are loans. I don't want to be in debt when I get out of college. That CAN'T happen! I don't want that to happen! I want to go to college without worrying about getting kicked out of college because I don't have enough money. I will explain my comic below

Reason why I want to make my comic - Twins

I want to explain to you why I want to make my comic. And no, it is not to make money, far from it. I want to change the world with my comic. Yes, the entire world. I know it's a big claim but you will understand why I want to.

I have a friend right? We always talk about Philosophical stuff. ALWAYS! Every time we have a conversation, it is philosophical. What do we talk about? EVERYTHING! We talk about the universe, earth, life, what the world really is, secrets of everything and much more. Trust me, I can't explain to you how deep it is but if you were there, you would know how amazing it is. I want to add everything we talk about into my comic. I want to show secrets of humans being and everything in my comic. There are many things I will show you that could possibly blow your mind. My comic won't be like the typical comics you see everyday. It will be different. However; when you think of superpowers and such, it will that of course (What comic doesn't!?) But the powers will be some you hear about everyday, but explained differently.

Not only will I be adding that in my comic, but I will also be put my life experiences in my comic. Yes, you will get to know a lot about me in my comic. You may be asking? "Why are you so special?" Well, to tell you the truth, I am not special; every single human is special in their own way. When you read or watch comics, you won't get information about the creator's life right? May be you will, but I will not let one single slip of my life slip by in my comic. I will add everything! I want my comic to change the world with information that seems to be hidden from people. Of course, I don't have information. But what I will add in my comic is the 'possible secrets' of the world. I want people to take all of it in consideration and view the world differently. The world is evil and I want to change that for the better.

I don't have the education to start making my comic and I know college will. I will also need programs that cost over thousands of dollars and materials to start making my comic. And that is a lot. Even after I get my go through college, it will still be hard to get materials for my comics. And I know I won't have thousands to spend when making my comic. If I don't reach my funding goal, then I will put whatever I have into my comic. Every little will count.

The Impact

I want to change the world with my comic as I explained earlier. You guys will help me change the world. I truly believe I can. It seems repetitive to me because I say it over and over. Do you guys want to change the world as well? For the better? Not the worst. That is how I feel. Actually, the money in making my comic is the most important part to me. It is the factor of how it will affect the world. I want it to be big! I want everyone to know! You guys can help with that by spreading as well. I will still need the materials and programs to start it. I will not let you guys down! I will continue on until I can make this comic. I will never give up; Dedication is key; having a passion is key; making my goals a reality is a must!

Risks & Challenges

I know it will be hard to start learning how to draw. But it will be something worthwhile. It may be a while before I can actually start my comic. I have general information about drawing; it has become easier; but I know I can still do a lot better with it. It will change the world; it will make people think differently about the world. The challenges will be worthwhile

Other Ways You Can Help

Please! If you can't contribute; no biggie. But PLEASE! Please share with the people that you know that will be interested in it. If you have friends. Please share my information. Please don't promote my campaign if you don't want. I want you to promote my comic itself!

story:
About the Artist

Hello my name is Julian Routt, artist and creator of the Blacktop Brigade. I’ve been a comic book collector and sports fan since a child. So it was natural when I wanted to create a comic book that it would incorporate both sports and comic book stylized action.

 

Our Campaign

We believe the story of Blacktop Brigade is one that will filter into all different media outlets, such as animation, video games and clothing. Our mission is to self produce and print our own comic book. We have secured a spot at the upcoming Stan Lee’s Comickaze event in Los Angeles, California Sept. 15-16 2012. However, our story starts with you! We are in need of funds in order to get our comic book printed and to introduce our product to the world!

 

Funding

In order to get our first book printed we are looking to raise $2,000, this will pay for a limited print run and the cost of shipping the finished product to us. Any additional funds raised will go towards the costs of the second printing or next issue. If we fail to meet our goal the book will still be printed, the funds raised will be applied to the cost of printing.

So if you enjoy stories of iconic characters such as Werewolves, Vampires, Aliens, Ghosts and much more with a twist, then the Blacktop Brigade is a campaign that is worth your contribution.

 

What you get

We have produced some amazing perks for each tier of contributions. From collectible cards and, posters to original sketches and Custom silk screen Tee Shirts to name a few. The more you generous you are the sweeter your perk.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends about our amazing comic book campaign. Get the word out about us on face book and twitter.

story:
Powers are a common thing in this world, but with every power comes a random side effect. Although this world is mostly peaceful. However monsters dubbed "Keelios" by the governments of the world, appear and destroy the peace they used to know. only a few million escaped to space, out of the billions on earth. These monsters make quick work of almost the entire population. Four friends need to survive in a destroyed world, and maybe even escape it. Sleeping is a waste of time is going to be a FULL COLOR, super powered, action, comedy comic of apocalyptic proportions. 

About The Author: I always wanted to create something people would see and I thought this would be the best opportunity to do this. With your support I can make something great! 

Goals: Our goals are to make the comic, and hopefully turn it into something huge! first digital, and then someday paperback!

Money:  The money will be used to create, publish, and distribute the comic via usb.

story:
The JAWBREAKERS are back!

 

 

This action-packed finale to the GØD-K1NG storyline takes the JAWBREAKERS to the edge of insanity!

 

 

Heroes die! Gods are born! The JAWBREAKERS will never be the same!

 

 

JAWBREAKERS: GØD-K1NG contains four stories:

"GØD-K1NG Book Three"

The culmination of the GØD-K1NG storyline that began in JAWBREAKERS- LOST SOULS.

Written by Richard C. Meyer

Drawn by Aaron Alfeche

Colored by Color Channel

 

"XAXI: RE-SPAWN"

Xaxi returns! And she's PISSED!

Written by Richard C. Meyer

Drawn by Charlie Snogans

Colored by Michael G. 

 

"DEVILDOG: ORIGIN"

DevilDog's origin on the battlefields of Afghanistan!

Written by Chuck Dixon

Drawn by Aaron Alfeche

Colored By Color Channel

DESOLATION WAVE: MASTER/$LAVE

In this 10-page prequel to next year's sci-fi epic, a race of genetically-modified humans are freed from slavery by what appears to be a quirk of fate...and discover that they are now the wealthiest beings in the galaxy!

Written by Chuck Dixon

Drawn by Renzo Rodriguez

Colored by Michael G.

 

 

 

Current Status (13SEP2019):

100% of the interior story pages have been drawn (pencils + inks).

100% of the interior story pages have been colored.

100% of the interior story pages have been lettered.

 

Stretch Goals:

$100,000 STRETCH GOAL *UNLOCKED!*- Exclusive Cover by Ethan Van Sciver!

$125,000 STRETCH GOAL *UNLOCKED!*- Extra pages that summarize previously-printed JAWBREAKERS stories (LOST SOULS, GØD-K1NG Book One & Two) with amazing digital art by Gabriel Major!

 

My most recent Indiegogo campaign (JAWBREAKERS- LOST SOULS *Remastered*) shipped on time.

This book will print & ship in September 2019.

I think you're going to love this book. I can't wait for you to read it!

 

 

"Good Guys Win...Bad Guys Lose."

story:
Story 

An illegal genetic research lab was set up on a remote planet. But after the corporation in charge comes under investigation by officials on Earth, all communications were cut off and the colonist abandoned, leaving them marooned on a world with harsh conditions and limited natural resources.   

Seventy years later, the outlaw Sunday Childs, born into this world, struggles to survive the apocalyptic landscape populated by warring factions and escaped genetic experiments.  Sunday's luck will change for the better or the worse when she is sent on an assassination mission by the planets ancient ruler know as the Mother.

What Are You Backing?

  • A post-apocalyptic sci-fi comic
  • First issue in a five issue mini series
  • The comic is 32 pages

Preview

Creators

Joshua Metzger

Writes the crime comics Punch Drunk (Arcana Comics),  Metzger and Pawlak Presents: Villain (Evoluzione Publishing) and Le Fay (No Sleep).

Carlos Nieto 

Carlos Nieto is a comic artist and illustrator from Madrid, Spain. He graduated in Fine Arts from the Complutense University of Madrid. After some first experiences in the world of comics with several web-comics and fanzines, he published with a national publisher his first creator-owned comic-book called ‘Fated’. His international professional career in comic-books started with ‘Star Trek’ series for IDW Publishing. Since then, he have worked for several international publishers of different countries.

Besides that, Carlos works for advertising illustrations, character designs and and many more projects involved with drawing, illustration and sequential art process.

Finally, Carlos Nieto is a highly creative professional who has solid, clean and clear storytelling with excellent illustration skills. He is passionate about telling stories and he also enjoys working with other professional to create them!

Luis Antonio Delgado

Luis Antonio Delgado, colorist for the fan favorite series, Ghostbusters, was born in Mexico City in 1982, he discovered comic books at the age of eight with the “Dark Night over Metroplois” story, and never looked back. After studying Graphic Design in Mexico, he went to Halifax, Nova Scotia and studied Illustration before meeting his mentor Raúl Cruz back in Mexico in 2005. He followed Raúl’s steps and in 2007 went to San Diego Comic Con and met IDW editor, Tom Waltz. After months of uncertainty, he finally got the long awaited email that changed his life, Tom Waltz offered him a project coloring a 12-page story in Gene Simmons House of Horrors #3. Thirteen years, over a 100 comic books and half a dozen board games later he has worked on properties such as Ghostbusters, TMNT, Star Wars, Transformers, My Little Pony, Spider-Man, Batman, Superman, GI JOE, Archie, Sonic, Mega Man, Star Trek and more.

story:
Why Trifecta?

Could it be because each member of this ensemble is a Triple Threat? All our members (1) perform, (2) write, and (3) possess another unique talent, whether it be directing, producing, playing music, or even performing magic! 

Here we are, looking fly as can be. Members (pictured above) are Dom Bournes, Marc Rosenzweig, LaRose Washington, Grace Korkunis, Portia Juliette, Isaac Jay, Kevin Phan, Sheridan Pierce, Jay Lee, Katie Baker, and Jack Shulruff. And since we have your attention, because you probably were just looking for your grandson's name in this list, we'd like to brag for a moment: collectively we have trained at USC, UCLA (TFT), BADA, Groundlings, UCB, Second City, Antaeus Theatre Company, and ACT San Francisco. We have degrees in Theatre, Film, Music, Screenwriting, Narrative Studies, Marketing, and Psychology. Impressive? Most Definitely. Naturally, our goals are as well:

So, our big group simplified our big dreams into 3 big (but, attainable) goals so that you know exactly what we’ll be doing over the next year.

Step 1: V!RAL. No, not "Chris Crocker" Viral or "Grape Stomping Lady" Viral. We are looking to be a V!RAL disease, infecting you and many others with chuckles. Translated, this means we're making short form sketch videos for online platforms.

Step 2: L!VE. A L!VE show, performing December 1st, 2nd, and 3rd at The Other Space, a theatre in The Actor’s Company (916 N Formosa Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90046).

Step 3: P!LOT. A 30 Minute sketch comedy P!LOT that we will be pitching to streaming services like Netflix, Hulu, and Amazon.

 

Now, it takes a lot of money to reach any of these goals individually, but all three of them? This is what the division of our costs looks like (and if you're like "where are the percentages?" "What are the actual projected costs?" and want a more detailed breakdown, please feel free to email phenomproductions4@gmail.com.):

Why You?

Making a pilot while producing short form content and live shows is impressive! But... also costs a lot of money. This is where you can help us out! If you decide to donate, we will love you infinitely, but also, peruse the perks tab, because you can get prizes for each amount you donate! You are awarded the prize for how much you donate (if you gave $200, you'd get a swaggy t-shirt) as well as everything below that amount (so you'd also get a TR!FECTA Fiesta invitation like in the video, 2 tickets to our show, a personal thank you video, a Haiku about you, and a Facebook shoutout)! T-Shirts, a Cameo, Haikus, oh my!

Wow! You read this whole thing instead of reading about 10 Ways Tom Hiddleston looks like a Cat on Buzzfeed. Gee, thanks!

But seriously. Thank you so much for reading about us. We truly appreciate ANYTHING you can donate. Even if you can't give any money right now, a share still helps! When anyone collaborates with us, we consider them a part of the team. So, whatever you decide to give... Welcome to Team TR!FECTA. We're honored to have you on board with us through this crazy adventure.

story:
Short Summary

 

Nergal is a funny and goofy demon that's always here to help anyone with a burning wish in their chest, but things haven't always been like this.
"Genesis" is Sympathy for the Demon's first graphic novel, in which you'll find Nergal's origins, a bunch of grumpy angels, a lot of wishes and one everlasting friendship.

 

We are Roy and Vyles, two italian guys who noticed that there are too many unhappy people walking around the world that would gladly appreciate some help from a friend. So we created Nergal, a tireless and hardworking demon whose only mission is to grant people's whishes in exchange for their soul. In this new graphic novel (now translated for the first time in english), you'll find out who is Nergal, how he decided to undertake this job and -especially- why.

We sincerely hope you'll join this long adventure with us, so grab yourself a copy and make a wish: Nergal will take care of it.

 


 (Language: English; Format: 16,5x24cm; Lenght: 76 pages.)

story:
"Metal Militia" Hardcover Graphic Novel.

Synopsis:

"A man trapped by the madness within himself. A woman driven to uncover the truth. A government obsessed with a secret. And a world consumed by insanity. 

War may be hell, but it is a walk in the park compared to this place. Metal Militia is a powerful story of the men born from the madness of our world. Be prepared. Because you will never hear the one that hits you." 

_______________________________________________________________________

We smashed all of the "Stretch Goals" and I wanted to thank everyone for their great support. For $35 bucks you get the HC Graphic Novel and all the free stuffs below. A great value for your hard earn dollars :)

 

1st "Stretch Goals" - Punisher & Wolverine print.

_____________________________________________________________________

Hi, my name is Hoang Nguyen, I've been a professional artist for a very long time. I've worked for Marvel, DC, Dark Horse, Image Comics and many independent companies in the past. I'm currently working in the game industry, but my first love is still comics. 

I originally created "Metal Militia" comic with my brother way back in the early '90s. It was a creator-owned project that holds a special place in my heart. Three issues were published back in 1995 and the fourth one never even hit the printing press. I've finally finished the book with the help of many contributors and now it's time to collect all the sold-out issues into a giant size Hardcover Graphic Novel. The book is over ninety-six pages long, and counting.

I've also decided to self-publish rather than going through a traditional publisher. The process for approvals, contracts and negotiation would take too long. Also, having the creative freedom to make decisions without interference from publisher is plus.

Metal Militia will be packed with contents from cover to cover. Over ninety six pages of story & art with NO ads. The hardcover book will be printed on a high-quality paper to showcase the gorgeous painted art. 

I've gone back to the original source and re-touched & updated many of the art pages. Also, many new pages was added as well. Kinsun and his team of painters have done a fantastic job of bringing the characters and environments to life. The colors, lighting and textures are vibrant and beautiful. Mike Kennedy (writer of Star Wars, Superman, Lone Wolf & Cub) will handle the script. 

My goal is to get the Hardcover Graphic Novel out as soon as possible and with your support, I'll be able to get the book into your hands shortly. This book is a labor of love for all of us and I can't wait to get it to you. Thank you in advance, your help and support is greatly appreciated.

Best!

Hoang Nguyen

The fund will be use for printing and shipping the book. We're going to use the highest quality printer and papers to make sure the book is beautiful and memorable.

Here is the status of the Graphic Novel: 

Story - 100% complete

Pencil and Inks - 100% complete

Colors - 100% complete

Lettering - 100% complete 

Cover - 10% complete

We also have a lot of unique perks, like "Book Plate Edition", "Original Artwork", "Mystery Box" and many more to come.

 

Risks & Challenges

I've run many campaigns on Kickstarter and have always delivered. This project will be a first for me on Indiegogo and I'm excited to launch it here.

The book is finished and will be ready for the printer as soon as the campaign close. I don't foresee any problem or delay, but with any project, there is always something. I'll make sure to keep you up to date with any issue that arises.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute, you can still help by sharing our campaign through social media. Please help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

Thanks in advance for your support!

story:
Throwing a Divorce Party, when I don't want to.

So my beloved wife calls me on the phone and tells me she wants a divorce. I don't, but she's going to get it whether I want to or not. I'm ground down to a nub emotionally. This campaign is under the "Comic" category, but this clown has tears flowing.

  • My name's Joseph Barrow, and I'm looking for a unique way to move on.
  • My marriage lasted for eight and a half years, and as of the time of this writing, has a week left. I'm raising money from any interested parties to fund a get-together (she is getting the majority of the marital assets) and maybe I can start fresh when I start over.
  • I can say that right now, I'm heartbroken, mad, upset, emotional, ticked off - the gamut of emotions. With this party, maybe I can meet someone that can help me start to heal the hole in my heart.

I still love my wife dearly. When we got married, she was the most beautiful thing on God's green earth, to me. No matter how upset I might be, no matter how mad I might be, no matter how many tears I shed, she is my beloved wife. I know myself well enough to know that being alone is anathema to me. But she's gone. Finished. Left the station, and not looking back at my shredded heart. So to protect what's left of my heart, I need to close that door in my life and maybe I can find another door to open and walk right through. 

What I Need & What You Get

Let's see if I can run some details:

  • I put $2500 down.  That would pay for a night's rental of either the Legion Hall and catering, or being able to take family out to Red Lobster, with gasoline in all their cars to get there. If any of my other cousins are involved, I'll have to tell them, "No strip joints." I don't think I'm ready for that. Also, the refrigerator in the house I'm staying at is broke, so the beer and Coca-Cola is warm. So is the three-day old pizza, and the hot sauce is okay, but it's bubbling.
  • I have a lot of physical pain from an automobile accident, which makes it hard to convince prospective employers to hire me. I'm truthful in those sections that ask, "do you have any physical disabilities that would limit your ability to perform your job?" If I didn't answer truthfully, that would be a reason to get fired quickly, and then where would I be? Right back here.
  • Plus, with no job and income, I have no health insurance. With no health insurance, I have no way to get grief counseling. I might be writing these sections in a painfully humorous way, but seriously, I am so emotionally unsettled and in need of counseling.
  • Or, a good woman.
  • I have set up flexible funding, meaning that if there are donations, I will pay a fee, and keep what is donated. If the goal is missed, the missed goal funds will go toward what is now my rent and utilities, since my soon-to-be-ex-wife has the paid-off house in her name. Also, food and sustenance. If the goal is met, I will use the funds as stated above.

The Impact

It's amazing the kind of things that you think of when you're too worn out from the tears and sobbing.  I would like to be able to at least have a leg up on the monumental task of starting over.  My wife called me to tell me she wanted a divorce a few days after I was fired from my job. The only income I have is the breeze in the windows. Your contribution will make a difference for my state of mind for a while, and will help me to help others who worry about me feel a little better for a while.

  • This project is important to me on a personal level. Even with a week left in my marriage, I still go to bed with her on my mind, and wake up with her name on my lips. My daily prayers are for her first, and myself second.
  • I am serious about trying to pull myself up, but I am realistic enough to know that I'm going to need help. My family is helping, but they have their own problems.
  • It's going to take me a long, long time to get over her. She was my light, my love, the stars in my sky, and the sands on my beach shore.

Risks & Challenges

The risks are the same for anything on the Internet. The obstacles are that there would be people with apathy without a desire to help. Five or ten dollars at a time. Go without Starbucks for a day. Bring a sandwich from home, and pass up the McDonald's.

  • I'm qualified because I'm stubborn. I'm aware that I need to move on, and I'm also aware that I can't without some help to do it.
  • My planning is to set up this page, watch carefully, answer any questions.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help monetarily toward my goal, there are other ways:

  • Be the word of mouth about this campaign. Spread the word, spread the links on social media, or for that matter, national news.
  • Speaking of social media, use the Indiegogo share tools!

My About.me page: 

http://about.me/josephbarrow
story_txt:
Throwing a Divorce Party, when I don't want to. So my beloved wife calls me on the phone and tells me she wants a divorce. I don't, but she's going to get it whether I want to or not. I'm ground down to a nub emotionally. This campaign is under the "Comic" category, but this clown has tears flowing. 
My name's Joseph Barrow, and I'm looking for a unique way to move on. My marriage lasted for eight and a half years, and as of the time of this writing, has a week left. I'm raising money from any interested parties to fund a get-together (she is getting the majority of the marital assets) and maybe I can start fresh when I start over. I can say that right now, I'm heartbroken, mad, upset, emotional, ticked off - the gamut of emotions. With this party, maybe I can meet someone that can help me start to heal the hole in my heart. 
I still love my wife dearly. When we got married, she was the most beautiful thing on God's green earth, to me. No matter how upset I might be, no matter how mad I might be, no matter how many tears I shed, she is my beloved wife. I know myself well enough to know that being alone is anathema to me. But she's gone. Finished. Left the station, and not looking back at my shredded heart. So to protect what's left of my heart, I need to close that door in my life and maybe I can find another door to open and walk right through.    What I Need & What You Get Let's see if I can run some details: 

I put $2500 down.  That would pay for a night's rental of either the Legion Hall and catering, or being able to take family out to Red Lobster, with gasoline in all their cars to get there. If any of my other cousins are involved, I'll have to tell them, "No strip joints." I don't think I'm ready for that. Also, the refrigerator in the house I'm staying at is broke, so the beer and Coca-Cola is warm. So is the three-day old pizza, and the hot sauce is okay, but it's bubbling.

I have a lot of physical pain from an automobile accident, which makes it hard to convince prospective employers to hire me. I'm truthful in those sections that ask, "do you have any physical disabilities that would limit your ability to perform your job?" If I didn't answer truthfully, that would be a reason to get fired quickly, and then where would I be? Right back here.
Plus, with no job and income, I have no health insurance. With no health insurance, I have no way to get grief counseling. I might be writing these sections in a painfully humorous way, but seriously, I am so emotionally unsettled and in need of counseling.
Or, a good woman. I have set up flexible funding, meaning that if there are donations, I will pay a fee, and keep what is donated. If the goal is missed, the missed goal funds will go toward what is now my rent and utilities, since my soon-to-be-ex-wife has the paid-off house in her name. Also, food and sustenance. If the goal is met, I will use the funds as stated above. 
  The Impact It's amazing the kind of things that you think of when you're too worn out from the tears and sobbing.  I would like to be able to at least have a leg up on the monumental task of starting over.  My wife called me to tell me she wanted a divorce a few days after I was fired from my job. The only income I have is the breeze in the windows. Your contribution will make a difference for my state of mind for a while, and will help me to help others who worry about me feel a little better for a while. 
This project is important to me on a personal level. Even with a week left in my marriage, I still go to bed with her on my mind, and wake up with her name on my lips. My daily prayers are for her first, and myself second. I am serious about trying to pull myself up, but I am realistic enough to know that I'm going to need help. My family is helping, but they have their own problems. It's going to take me a long, long time to get over her. She was my light, my love, the stars in my sky, and the sands on my beach shore. 
  Risks & Challenges The risks are the same for anything on the Internet. The obstacles are that there would be people with apathy without a desire to help. Five or ten dollars at a time. Go without Starbucks for a day. Bring a sandwich from home, and pass up the McDonald's. 
I'm qualified because I'm stubborn. I'm aware that I need to move on, and I'm also aware that I can't without some help to do it. My planning is to set up this page, watch carefully, answer any questions. 
  Other Ways You Can Help If you can't help monetarily toward my goal, there are other ways: 
Be the word of mouth about this campaign. Spread the word, spread the links on social media, or for that matter, national news. Speaking of social media, use the Indiegogo share tools! 
 My About.me page: http://about.me/josephbarrow

story:
The Project

A 12-episode graphic novel about a reluctant superhero yogini who battles abusive police and government agents without the aid of violence. You can see the first episode here.

When is it acceptable to use violence? Can we fight violence without resorting to violence ourselves? Is violence legitimate when it is committed by those in authority? And what can one person do to combat officially sanctioned violence - when she can't use violence herself?

These are the questions posed by Urban Yogini. They are also critical questions for those of us who are committed to peace and to creating a peaceful society. I decided to create this web comic and graphic novel in order to get people asking these questions, and possibly even coming up with some solutions.

I was a journalist for over a decade, mostly in Asia. I have also studied yoga, ballet and some buddhism. You can see my writing and other work here.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The $4,000 will go to pay professional artists to do a better job illustrating the remaining eleven episodes than I have done with the first. It will also free me up to write those episodes if somebody else is doing the artwork.

I'm offering some pretty cool perks to those who donate:

EVERYONE who donates will get a copy of the finished product - the 12-episode graphic novel. Anyone donating $20 or more will get a signed copy.

Anyone who donates $100 or more can have their name appear as the name of a character in one of the episodes.

And for anyone who donates $1,000 or more, I will create a supervillain in your image and using your name (that is, a supervillain version of your name). I personally think this is the coolest perk ever. 

Anything raised beyond $4,000 will go to pay me for my time writing the episodes. If the campaign brings in a LOT more than $4,000 ($8,000 or more), then additional funds will go to fund even more episodes! And of course if the campaign doesn't raise the full amount, I will use whatever funds are raised to make as many episodes as we can.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are excited about this project and want to see it happen, but making a financial contribution is not practical for you, there are other ways you can help! 

Help spread the word: Use the Indiegogo sharing tools to share this project on your social networks, and tell your friends about us!

"Follow" Urban Yogini's Indiegogo project (click on the little "follow" heart below the video) so you can recieve updates on our progress and other ways you can help.

story:
The Story

Years ago, Captain James Ellis and the USN Ballistic Missile Submarine Hammerhead were presumed lost at sea.  But now, somehow, they have returned, and the outcome could be tense.  A navy wants its sub back.  A captain's wife wants her husband back.  But after years of adapting to life at sea, can they come back?

 

Background

Previously previewed in Heavy Metal Magazine's September 2010 issue, you can now see the entire book digitally.

Eisner-nominated for Clive Barker's Tapping the Vein series, I've created a new tale in the style of my work for Twisted Tales, Tales of Terror, Alien Encounters, and Twilight Zone, to name a few. 

 

The Pitch

I believe Off the Deep End has potential as an ongoing series.  But realistically, comic work costs hundreds of dollars a page.  I think Off the Deep End is worth it.  Download the pdfs and decide for yourself.  I'm hoping to earn more than my goal so I can pay my artist to create at least enough pages to create the finale of the story.


If you prefer a paper comic, you may order the entire book from indyplanet.com, or you can purchase one of the copies with my autograph.  (While you're at it, and if you like horror, you can also check out my ebooks on Smashwords.com!)


Thank you for your support!

UPDATE:  Some signed copies are available now!  Order in time for the holidays!

story:
Hello friends from the blue planet,

I arrived by mistake on your planet, due to an emergency landing.
I am all right but my craft is very damaged. I have to get back on my planet because I am low in vital resources, I get enough to live 45 days.
That’s why I need to fix the tails of my craft quickly. I can repair it easily with some materials from here.
The only thing is that I can not obtain such material without your currency.
According to my calculations I need $50 000 to buy whereof fix my spacecraft.

That’s why I rely on you human for your kindness which is famous in this galaxy.

A guy from somewhere else.


Here is what happened to one of my fellow creature :
http://youtu.be/C-fDimPKYCg

 

¬ Translated by Martin Karman

story:
Short Summary

Athens: the comic book #1 was a collection of short stories inspired by Athens - the chaos, the beauty, the darkness, diversity and hope found in this great city. We sent an open call for stories, gave freedom to participants to choose their theme, and received 16 fantastic, romantic, realistic, social, and above all true experiences. The book was printed in the autumn of 2015.

2 years later, the political and social situation is quite different, and Athenian's state of mind too. We wanted to make a new antology, but more curated, with more social content, and longer stories . That was the main idea behind the second call.

This year participants are

Evangelos Androutsopoulos / Efi Theodoropoulou / Theoni Drakopoulou / Alexia Lougiaki / Manolis Zoulakis  / Nikos Malk / Nikos Papamihail / Kristel Pent / Thanassis Petrou / Katerina Stamati / Teti Solou / George Tsardanidis / Wild Drawing and Daniel Egneus for the cover.

Artists manage to  express today's Athens feeling in many different ways, and that makes those anthology so interesting. We are living historical times, not only in Greece of course, but wanted to have a different kind of record of today. That what came up as most interesting in the first book, and that's what we wanted to focus on with the second.

This campaign will help us print this second edition, in color and 2 languages (English and Greek), in order to have a broader audience. 

The last book had a good success for a comic, in Greece, selling 400 copies aproximately.

The second book is of much higher quality, gaining from our previous experience and in color.

If you cannot contribute, you can allways help us by sharing our campaing and promoting our book! This is also of much much help.

Thank you for reading this!!

The book is organized and produced by ATAthens,

The Alternative Tours of Athens (ATA) are a team of architects, photographers, artists and musicians who organize open, educational, informative and entertaining tours in Athens.

Through a wide variety of alternative tours, the ATA promotes Athens'architecture, street and public art, social movements, bike routes, nightlife, and creative local workshops. The ATA also publishes printed and electronic guides of Athens, co-organizes cultural events and educational seminars.

By showcasing Athens' diverse communities, alternative landmarks, and modern city life, the ATA aims to promote culture and tourism, increasing the interaction between visitors, local residents and urban spaces.

The ATA is always working with new talent and unique ideas that bring together cultural, tourist and scientific agencies or organizations, with local businesses, training centers, authors, artists and other people that make up the bustling Greek capital.

story:
A wrong turn down a dead end road.

A car that won't start.

An unspeakable evil emerges from the darkness.

No phones. No weapons. No escape.

Think you've seen this all before? 

THINK AGAIN.

When a girls softball team takes a shortcut through the Florida Everglades, they veer off the path towards a night they'll never forget – drinking, dancing – one last hurrah before college starts and they go their separate ways. 

When they stumble into a trap set by a murderous cult, the stage is set for a night of blood-soaked carnage – but the cult has never dealt with victims who are ready to fight back. 

And while the girls might not have home field advantage, they have a game-changing surprise of their own.

This 48-page graphic novel is a double-header of murder and mystery that will crack you square in the skull – it’s unfiltered survival horror like you've never seen before!

BATTER UP, MOTHERF#@&ERS.

It's time to play ball.
 


A killer preview to get you totally psyched for this blood-soaked, 90s-style slasher story. Hold onto your Tamagotchis - this graphic novel is gonna be all that AND a bag of chips.

Side note: the pages WILL be lettered in the finished book - we just wanted you to see the virgin artwork without any dialogue balloons. Enjoy!


 


Thank you for taking the time to check out our project.

America's three greatest art forms are comic books, baseball and slasher films - we combined them all to create this kick-ass graphic novel, and we're confident you're going to love reading it as much as we enjoyed creating it for you.


Our books, stickers, and t-shirts are printed locally in Canada and the United States.

While some companies use factories overseas to produce their books, we believe the quality in North America is far superior, and we would rather pass along a better product to our customers. It also speeds up the fulfillment process, getting the books in your hands faster.

We also sign, package, label, and ship every order by hand - we do not use third-party fulfillment services.

story:
The Story

NIKOLAI is the authorized comic biography of Croatian wrestling legend, Nikolai Volkoff, 2005 WWE Hall of Famer, former WWF Tag Team Champion, and former partner of the Iron Sheik! Along with Bruno Sammartino, Nikolai was the first professional wrestler to sell out Madison Square Garden. Written by John Crowther (Antarctic Press' Rochelle), this story of Nikolai's life is based on in-depth interviews and intimate conversations between the writer and the wrestler.

Unfortunately, Nikolai (aka Josip Peruzovic) passed away unexpectedly in July of 2018. During the comic production process, he became a friend to us all at Inverse Press/Squared Circle Comics. He called often, just to chat, and we felt his loss tremendously. We've been making comics since 2010 - and wrestling comics since 2016 - and his was the very first of those wrestling stories we were privileged to tell. We're proud to say that he read and approved every page of this book before his death. It's his official biography.

By pledging to this campaign, you make printing/publication of Nikolai's biography a reality. We hope you'll be a part of it.

 

What You Get When You Back This Campaign

  • Nikolai is a soft-cover, 80-page graphic novel in standard American comic size (6.625" x 10.25"). 72 of those pages are full-on story and art telling Nikolai's story, chock full of wrestling action! This is the complete, self-contained story.
  • Every physical (non-digital) backer will receive at least one print edition of the graphic novel.
  • All reward packages include a digital (PDF) edition of the comic.
  • Original, single-issue editions of the story from Squared Circle Comics and Antarctic Press are available as rewards in multiple rewards tiers.
  • Many reward tiers include rare and even bonus collectibles, including comics, trading cards, bookplates, and prints autographed by Nikolai as part of past crowdfunding campaigns.  
  • Your name on our Acknowledgements page in the comic: Bronze level ($15-$30 pledge); Silver level ($31-$74 pledge); Gold level ($75+ pledge).
  • FREE U.S. Shipping!

 

The Preview

Some interior artwork from the legendary artist Dell Barras (Conan the Barbarian, The Amazing Spider-Man, and too many other Marvel Comics to list) and colorist Andrew Pate, a veteran of several of our wrestling comics:

 

The Low-Down

In order to print enough copies of the book to keep costs per copy at a level that makes selling them reasonable, we need to raise approximately $2400. The remaining funds needed for our goal are necessary to pay fees and costs associated with the campaign, including manufacturing, procuring and shipping rewards. Any excess funds that may be raised will be applied to increasing the print run and compensating Nikolai's widow and the creative team, as per existing agreements.

While this is our first IndieGoGo campaign, we have a 100% reliable crowdfunding track record on Kickstarter, dating to 2010, having launched and successfully fulfilled 30+ campaigns there in that time.

 

The Creators

John E. Crowther  

John is the writer and creator of Rochelle, which debuted as Rochelle: The Teen Cockroach #0 with AC Comics in March 2015, and is currently an ongoing series with Antarctic Press, having debuted to great reviews in August 2016. He has authored each installment of the growing line of authorized wrestling comics published by Squared Circle Comics, including The Killer Bees, Hacksaw Jim Duggan, and The Genius Lanny Poffo.

Dell Barras

Dell is an industry legend, amassing over 40 years experience in the comic book industry with DC Comics, Marvel UK , Antarctic Press, AC Comics, and Heroic Comics on many titles, including Rochelle, Conan the Barbarian, The Amazing Spider Man, Blue Beetle and Death's Head II. Dell has also worked extensively as a storyboard artist for Warner Brothers, Dreamworks, Nickelodeon, Disney, Fox Family, Marvel Films, Cartoon Network, Hanna Barbara, and 20th Century Fox, on such titles as Transformers: The Movie, Shark's Tale, Buzz Lightyear, The Amazing Spider Man, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, The Incredible Hulk, Avengers, Silver Surfer, and The New GI Joe. 

Andrew Pate

Andrew is a comic book colorist living in Panama City, Florida. He has been working in independent ​Comics and Game Design since 2014. He has worked on several published and soon to be published comics including The Killer Bees and The Genius Lanny Poffo for Squared Circle Comics, Wannabe Heroes, Edison and New Life for Primary Target Press, and the colors for the board game Last Stand for Woodtop Worlds.

 

Risks & Challenges

There are few to NO risks in the completion and fulfillment of this project. As the IndieGoGo campaign launches, the graphic novel is absolutely complete in terms of art, colors and lettering. Printing and distribution will commence within a few weeks of the campaign's end!

Our first obligation is to YOU, the Backer. Given your support and trust in us, we aim to get you what you paid for at the highest possible quality and within the shortest possible time frame.

He has authored each installment of the growing line of authorized wrestling comics published by Squared Circle Comics, including The Killer Bees, Hacksaw Jim Duggan, and The Genius Lanny Poffo.
Dell Barras
Dell is an industry legend, amassing over 40 years experience in the comic book industry with DC Comics, Marvel UK , Antarctic Press, AC Comics, and Heroic Comics on many titles, including Rochelle, Conan the Barbarian, The Amazing Spider Man, Blue Beetle and Death's Head II. Dell has also worked extensively as a storyboard artist for Warner Brothers, Dreamworks, Nickelodeon, Disney, Fox Family, Marvel Films, Cartoon Network, Hanna Barbara, and 20th Century Fox, on such titles as Transformers: The Movie, Shark's Tale, Buzz Lightyear, The Amazing Spider Man, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, The Incredible Hulk, Avengers, Silver Surfer, and The New GI Joe. 
Andrew Pate
Andrew is a comic book colorist living in Panama City, Florida. He has been working in independent ​Comics and Game Design since 2014. He has worked on several published and soon to be published comics including The Killer Bees and The Genius Lanny Poffo for Squared Circle Comics, Wannabe Heroes, Edison and New Life for Primary Target Press, and the colors for the board game Last Stand for Woodtop Worlds.
 
Risks & Challenges

There are few to NO risks in the completion and fulfillment of this project. As the IndieGoGo campaign launches, the graphic novel is absolutely complete in terms of art, colors and lettering. Printing and distribution will commence within a few weeks of the campaign's end!
Our first obligation is to YOU, the Backer. Given your support and trust in us, we aim to get you what you paid for at the highest possible quality and within the shortest possible time frame.

story:
We watch and read about Cyber-Bullying, in the newspaper, on TV and on the Internet.  We develop programs, class lessons and events, to give our children the tools to cope, defend and hopefully understand each other’s differences.  But the solution isn’t quite that simple. A child being “bullied”; feels alone and scared, and often times won’t speak up or seek any help for fear of ridicule and retribution.

It’s easy to approach the issue as adults; we reflexively respond that it’s just a part of growing up.  However, with the global popularity of the social media, bullying has intensified its frequency and permanence that simply did not exist before.  Our graphic novel will explore how this new enhanced form of bullying affects a person, both physically and emotionally.


So what makes your book different from the hundreds of other books dealing with this topic?

Our story is a “slice of life” tale, showing the trials and tribulations of growing up in the “digital” age. Yes, we know that there have been many that have come before us; we’ve read and watched what we could get our hands on.  However, we feel they haven’t gone far enough in showing what kids are doing and what they are going through.  Our intention is to show more of the nuances in their daily life in the form of a graphic novel. 

Most of the characters in the book are between the ages of 12 and 15.

 

What is Sealyon Prep?

We set SeaLyon Prep, or as we like to call it SLP, up as a private school with better than the average tools found even in the most exclusive of preparatory.  The school is situated in an unnamed fictional city in an unnamed country, set a little ways into the future (far enough not to be dated in 10 years but not far enough to be disconnected from the present)  Students at SLP range from middle school through high school (7th grade to 12th grade).  They come from all walks of life; from the slums of the inner city to wealthiest of suburbs, class and race is not an issue with going to SLP.

 

Is SLP a series?

Yes.  SeaLyon Prep is going to be a series of books that addresses the issues that teens deal with in their daily life.  This book is the first of 13 that will be released on an annual or bi-annual basis, depending on the subject matter.

 

Who are you guys?

K. Isao Muranaka and Kat Maeda have known each other for over 20 years, though this is their first venture as a team.

K. Isao Muranaka is the artist, co-writer and co-creator of the series.  He has been in the publishing business in one form or another for over 20 years. From writing and drawing comics to graphic design, from operating a production camera to running a press and from selling books to managing a store, all this was in preparation, so that one day he would launch his own company, Abeona Publishing.  This is the company’s first book.

Katsumi Maeda is the co-writer and co-creator of the series.  Born and educated in Hawaii, Kat is the writer and artist, behind a series of manga inspired fanzine stories that he has distributed within the local market.  Kat, by profession, works for an internationally recognized transportation company.

 

If I decide to help fund this where is the money going?

  • Pay for any design and production needs that go beyond our expertise
  • Pay for the production of the printed material
  • Shipping and shipping material for all the physical rewards
  • Pay for any and all fees pertaining to this project; PayPal, Indiegogo, unforeseen third parties
  • All funds will go to the production and distribution of the book.

 

What can I do if I can’t donate money?

Well, there are 2 things you can help us do

  1. Spread the word about our campaign through Indiegogo’s sharing tools and other social media sites.
  2. The old tried and true way, word of mouth, to anyone and everyone who will listen to you.

 

Tell us your story.

We are planning to include real life stories of bullying in our book.  They will be featured as story breaks throughout the story.  You can email us at editor@sealyonprep.com

or write to us at:

Abeona Publishing, P.O. Box 893505 Mililani, Hawaii 96789

Note: We will not include any names and those within the story will be changed.  We only want the age it occurred and location (city, state and country)

All REWARDS will be delivered in the of FALL 2014

FOR THE LATEST NEWS AND UPDATES FOLLOW THE LINKS BELOW AND "LIKE" US ON FACEBOOK!

story:
Ah Ben Who?

    Ah Ben Don is a dashingly new urban comic strip. Following the life of Ben, a socially awkward NEET (Not in Employment, Education, or Training) who embarks on a journey to discover himself and re-connect with society. On his journey, he must confront his fears of social conflict, racial diversity and the inconvenient complexities of society.

The story of an Urban NEET

   "Ah Ben Don" is a play on the word "abandon." Ben was once a thriving animator. But when he publishes a controversial animation, his entire life changes. Ben loses it all, and spirals into of years depression and withdrawal from society and his animation career. Luckily for Ben, three buddies appear to help Ben get himself back on track with the life he once Ah Ben Don-ed. "Ah Ben Don" is inspired by the animated and comic series "The Boondocks" and The "PJs" by Eddie Murphy.

Main Characters:

Name: Ben Pie   Age: 23

About: Ben is an average-looking guy with social and creative problems. He is a social outcast and struggles to conform to society's expectations. Consequently, Ben suffers from withdrawal and conflicts with both himself and others. When a strange cast of off-color characters become his mystical buddies, Ben attempts to face the world he once abandoned.

Name: Theodore Bear   Age: 31

About: Theo is a spiritual guru who is asigned to help Ben with his life-changing catastrophe. Theo is a passive aggressive Rastafarian bear like man who's on spiritual journey.

Name: Deandrae Roscoe   Age: 21                                                                                 

About: Deandrae is a high spirited radio host who came far to help Ben re-emerge from his slump. Deandrae an actor who once played a detective on a sitcom now on the radio and he is always in character. He has wild and loud personality often get him into trouble, but this doesn't always spell doom for Ben.

Name: Douglass Zedd   Age: 22

About: Dough is the smart one of the crew. An elegant fella, who is witty and wise, though sometimes arrogant. 

Name: Lina Shadow   Age: N/A 

About: Lina Shadow is an undercover Black Panther agent who stays in the shadows as she spies on Big Brother and other government officials. Jones is very stealthy and very private.

In Strips We Trust!

Step Right Up and Get Your Rewards Here!

 

Pre-Release Print / T-shirt Designs

 

 

Why Should You Back This Project?

   Because this project is awesome, and you have a good taste in comedy ;). I often believe comedy is the best way to spread the truth and awareness to people. A message is best understood when happiness and laughter is involved. So I believe. My goal is to entertain and enlighten the audience, while focusing on social issues that are often left out in commercial media.

Funding for?

-KickStarter Rewards

-Hardware / Software (New Computer, Quality Mic, Stylos HD, etc…)

-Licensing & Host Fees

-Voice Actors / Animators

-Living Expenses

-Accomplishing Dream

For any question, ideas, critiques and or any other input please do so message me here. Thank you for checking this project and backing it up. :D

story:
En Greve

Hi, we're Laura Ellyn and Jane Dough. We're here to talk to you about a graphic novel project that we're really excited about and we need your support to make happen.

Both of us are university students in Montreal, Quebec, and for the last several months, we've been on strike in protest of the Charest government's plans to raise tuition in Quebec by almost 80% over the next few years. We've seen the student movement in Quebec grow from localized protests to a massive movement with international support, effectively changing the landscape of university life and politics in Quebec drastically over a relatively short amount of time. For many students, university staff and professors, and Quebec residents in general, the past several months have been a time of great political turmoil, passionate public debates, community organization and solidarity, police and government repression, and all too often, physical violence as well. The cost of the “Maple Spring” to the Canadian government has been millions of dollars, while the cost to students and Quebec residents has been freedom of speech, freedom of assembly, and in some cases, the ability to attend school altogether.

We have both been on the front lines of student organizing since the strike reached our university, Concordia, one of the few anglophone institutions in Quebec. Being so directly involved in the strike – picketing, holding meetings, marching, occupying, arguing, putting our academic careers, our physical and mental health, and our relationships with friends and loved ones on the line – has been an intense and sometimes overwhelming experience for us both. We each started making comics about the Maple Spring as a way of processing the things we were seeing and experiencing as student activists. We decided to collaborate on a full-length graphic novel, documenting not only our personal journeys and experiences in the strike, but the history of student and union organizing in Quebec, and what the current situation means for the future of the Canadian left.

The Book

En Greve is scheduled to be released in September of 2012 and be carried by independent bookstores and zine distros. Because of the personal and political nature of the book, it is important to us that it be published in a way where we can maintain a large degree of autonomy and control over the production. We initially looked into working with a publisher, but after some discussion, we decided that self-publishing was the way to go. This means that the project will be a lot more labour-intensive and expensive for us, but we can put all of our effort into making beautiful, high-quality, and uncensored works of political art. Each 100-page book will be hand-bound and feature a hand-printed cover. We will also be releasing a series of cards and patches with messages of student solidarity and the right to accessible education for all.

Who We Are

We are two Montreal-based artists and students who have been protesting and striking against the fee hikes since March of 2012.

Laura Ellyn is a printmaker and comic artist, whose comics, often a mix of autobiographical and journalistic in content, have been featured in the Vancouver Review, Bitch, and Briarpatch magazines, as well as the Indie Ladies anthology and the upcoming DrawnOUT anthology. Her work can also be found in teaching collections at Concordia University. You can see samples of her work here.

Jane Dough is a printmaker and illustrator, whose work has been included in a number of zines and self-published art books, manif en cours, and has been shown in Oakville, Mississauga, Ottawa, and Montreal.  Her work can also be found in teaching collections at Concordia University, and La Grande Bibliotheque Nationale.  You can see some of her work here.

Why flexible funding?

We have chosen flexible funding for this campaign because there is some flexibility with regards to the printing expenses and other funding opportunities, but the idea of crowdsourcing the funding for this project in order to keep our books affordable without sacrificing quality is very dear to our hearts. If we exceed our target for donations, any excess money will go towards translating and printing editions of En Greve entirely in French.

What You Get For Donating

Any level of donation gets you a copy of the book, whether we reach our goal on Indiegogo or not. This is obviously kind of a risky commitment for us to make, but we believe that strongly in the ability of grassroots campaigns to produce amazing things.

Other perks include hand written thank you notes, hand-printed patches for your awesome denim vests, poster prints, and special thanks in the credits of the book.

How You Can Help


There are lots of ways to help us reach our goal!

  1. Donate! The money will go towards printing and distribution costs, as well as small stipends for Jane and myself to cover materials and pay us for our labour. Any funds exceeding our goal will be used towards translating and printing a French edition of the book.

  2. Promote the project! Tweet about it at #engrevecomic, reblog this post and other posts to come, write about it on your blog, share it on facebook, whatever! We're excited to hear what people think of the project.

  3. Follow engreve.tumblr.com for updates and keep checking back here. There will be LOTS of updates over the next month! Look out for book excerpts, videos of us working on the book and explaining our processes, and blog posts with reflections on the strike.

  4. You can also buy our work from Fight Boredom Distro. The profits from sales through Fight Boredom will go to one of the distros we'll be working with and allow her to stock up on our work and help us get it out there once the book is done. (We'll be adding more distros and bookstores as we confirm distribution points for the book.)

  5. Contact your local independent bookstore about carrying the book when it launches in September! Send them to our blog, give them our contact info, and tell them that you'd be interested in purchasing our book from them. We love supporting independent bookstores and would be stoked to offer deals to them.

The profits from sales through Fight Boredom will go to one of the distros we'll be working with and allow her to stock up on our work and help us get it out there once the book is done. story:
What happens when the hottest band in the world meets the Dark Knight? Find out in this awesome fan made crossover comic!

In 2014, KISS celebrates 40 years of rock and roll! In 2014, I want to release "KISS Meets Batman", an exciting and fun comic book crossover staring Batman, Starchild, Demon, Spaceman, and Catman as they fight off the Joker and Gotham City's other villans.

However...

This can't happen without your help. I have been an artist for many years of my life. I have never before taken on the endeavor of making my own comic book before. I have draw heroes and villans and created concepts of my own, but they have never come to fruition.

In this age of digital comics, I need to upgrade and adapt to be able to create the comic for KISS and Batman fans alike to enjoy! To do that I need two things:

-Money for a drawing tablet.

-Money to help with publishing costs for perks and distribution.

That's it. Anything helps. 

Obstacles and challenges:

My only obstacles in this project are time. I'm starting college in January, but until then have a lot of free time. Oh, and Gene Simmons being a complete psycho if he ever happens to find out about this.

The only other obstacle I have is getting rewards to backers by the date specified. I put July 2014, which is far later than I anticipate, but I want to give me some time to do that, so I don't up being late getting them to you guys (it is YOUR money after all)

What's in it for you?

Well, check out the rewards! Hopefully, these are enough to entice you to help out. If not, let us know what I can do to convince you!!

Thanks in advance and rock on,

Stephen Bates

story:
The Third Issue!

This will be the third issue of my series of Peter Pan the Vampire comics that follows vampires from fairy-tales, myths, legends, and folklore experienced through the eyes of a slayer named Gwyen that  becomes a friend of Peter's when she discovers that not all vampires are bad (as told in issues 1 and 2).

Issue 3 is my first comic that is colored with the aid of the computer thanks to the fine books Hi-Fi Color for Comics and Mastering Digital Color by Brian and Kristy Miller.  I am really loving the look of this one compared to the colored pencil look of my first go around in comics and I am sure you will love it too!  

Issue 3 is about the vampire slayer Gwyen being near death from her run-in with the vampire Jack Frost when the vampire Maui offers to make her a vampire to save her life. The story carries us through her choice and what happens after that.

 I have been trying to figure out how I can get my books out quicker and I've decided to make the future issues 12 pages (the first two issues were 24) and now I can even lower the prices too.

A Bit About Myself

I have been drawing comics since childhood and it's all I've ever wanted to do. Getting my books published was a huge milestone in my life, but I don't want it to stop there.  My goal is to keep making comics as long as I am alive and I've got a lot of story and script already in the works.  I have already had some success with over 200 readers of my previous books and know they want to read the continuation.

My wife Annie and I have been married for 15 years and we have three awesome daughters and a newborn son; Ryleigh Jo, Shandee,  Kara, and Johnny.  We live in a very small town in Utah called Riverside and are surrounded by family.  

I work for a large food distribution warehouse full time, substitute in my school district, and occasionally weed eat my local cemetery. 

Those are the main reasons I am doing a campaign.  With a full time job and two side jobs I still struggle to be able to get my books out and buy the equipment I need to work on it.  It means the world to me that you are reading this and are interested in helping me reach my dreams. 

What I Need & What You Get


How you help me:

  • Your contribution will help me get the art supplies I draw with, a laptop, and programs that I use to make my books.  
  • You will also be helping me with the printing costs, shipping and packaging, promotional expenses, and all the other stuff that go into making comics. 
  • And also, hopefully, it will help my wife see how making comics is more than just an expensive hobby.

The Perks!

There's a lot in it for you too:

  • I know that you all want issue 3, but I understand that some of you may want the full story and issues 1 and 2 will be available as some of the perks.
  • Have you wanted to see your ad for your book, shop, or thing in a comic book?  That will be available in the highest perk option.
  • Even if I do not make my goal your contribution and aid has helped me and your perks will be sent out. 
  • When I do reach my goal everyone who opted for the $25.oo, $50.oo, and $100.oo PERKS will also have a Rentnarb Studios Comics tee added to their shipment!     


Other Ways You Can Help Out!

I know that not everyone can contribute, but that doesn't mean you still can't help out.  Here are some of the other ways you can help:

  • Share my campaign on your facebook, twitter, deviantART, Pintrest, or other social media sites.  Tell everybody you know!
  • You can even use the Indiegogo share tools!  Click on the icon you like and share.
  • Talk about it with others.  Not everyone is on social media and they may not have heard about it.

THANKS!!

I am so thankful for all that you can do for me.  Thank you for reading my campaign.  Thank you to all that click on the perks.  And thanks to everyone who shares this campaign and helps get the word out.                 There are so many of you out there responsible for making me believe that dreams can come true.  I thank all who have helped me make mine true and hope all of yours come true in return.                                                                               ,gb
story_txt:
The Third Issue!This will be the third issue of my series of Peter Pan the Vampire comics that follows vampires from fairy-tales, myths, legends, and folklore experienced through the eyes of a slayer named Gwyen that  becomes a friend of Peter's when she discovers that not all vampires are bad (as told in issues 1 and 2).Issue 3 is my first comic that is colored with the aid of the computer thanks to the fine books Hi-Fi Color for Comics and Mastering Digital Color by Brian and Kristy Miller.  I am really loving the look of this one compared to the colored pencil look of my first go around in comics and I am sure you will love it too!  Issue 3 is about the vampire slayer Gwyen being near death from her run-in with the vampire Jack Frost when the vampire Maui offers to make her a vampire to save her life. The story carries us through her choice and what happens after that. I have been trying to figure out how I can get my books out quicker and I've decided to make the future issues 12 pages (the first two issues were 24) and now I can even lower the prices too.A Bit About MyselfI have been drawing comics since childhood and it's all I've ever wanted to do. story:
If you have something that you would like me to do.. Write to me and let me know what that is and how much you are willing to donate to have it done ! 


              Who I am and what I am dreaming of?

Performing  has been in my blood since I could talk (and sing)! According to those who knew me as a young child, I seemed to think everyone should be entitled to the “Sean Show!”, or at times, I called it “The Sean-ey Carson Show”. 

                                   

Once I realized I had the gift of entertainment, my life’s goal has always been to entertain full time. So far I have done so in Portland: K.J.’ing at clubs, my own weekly podcast show, writing, staring in and producing 6 short plays, professionally performing at corporate events, and the list goes on. However, it’s time for me to spread my wings and fly, doing what I have always dreamed of: Going to Second City in Chicago and studying where the greats have studied. My girlfriend and I are packing it all up, shipping our belongings, and moving to Chicago!


What will this money be spent on?

My girlfriend and I are moving to Chicago. We have researched driving all our belongings vs. flying and paying for our things to be sent across country. Surprisingly, it is actually cheaper to send everything without us while we enjoy a leisurely flight among the friendly skies. When we arrive, we will stay in a hotel of sorts while we find a place to live. We’ll need customary move in costs, etc. My girlfriend is transferring with the company she is with so she will have a job waiting for her! 

                                 


I will eventually have to find work as well.  We’ll need to become familiar with the city’s layout, and settle in to a new lifestyle (I’ve never lived anywhere but Portland!) My plan is to hit the ground off running by taking classes on writing, improve, and voiceover.

Could you please help this transition be a smooth as it can be for us? 

                                


Why Support My Dream?

Have you ever had a dream? Has that dream been a little outside your comfort zone, but you were ready to risk it all to chase it? Did anyone help you realize that dream, came along side you and help you attain that lofty dream that only felt like an unattainable fantasy? 


That’s what I’m asking you to do for me. Please help me reach my dream. I’ll be blown away by your desire to partner with me, help make my fantasy a reality, and support me in getting to Second City! Help “SEND SEAN PACKING”!

                               


Risks and Challenges

If it’s too windy and cold and I want to come home.

                                         


Other ways you can help

Share this on all your social media: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pintrest, Linkedin

Tell your family, friends, dog, cat, mailman, the little old lady down the street, literally everyone
