story:
Issue 3 of Arise continues the story of Dinah and her lethal protector Thanatos as they plunge through a zombie ridden city.

What is Arise?

Arise is the story of a lone warrior, Thanatos, and his companion, Dinah, trying to battle their way through a zombie infested town. Thanatos' goal is to survive long enough to get to his home - a heavily fortified safe zone that was designed for the inevitable zombie apocalypse. See, Thanatos isn't your average person. He's a conspiracy theorist who believed that the zombie invasion was coming.  ...And he was right.

Arise is an intellectual property held by Satyrn Studios, an entertainment company based out of the DFW region in Texas. Arise is starting off as a six-issue limited comic book series that will be turned into a graphic novel upon completion of the series. The Arise IP will go beyond the comic and span into the realm of film, video games, action figures, and more. Currently, there is a short film already released and a video game underway. The first issue of the Arise comic book is already completed. The series is written by Satyrn Studios owner Jay Reiter. The artwork for the first issue was done by legendary horror artist Vince Locke (http://vincelocke.com/), with colors done by Lauren Affe. The second through sixth issues will have artwork by James Whynot and colors by Jay Reiter.

What is the goal of this crowd funding campaign? 

The monetary goal of $1,000 is to fund the third issue of the six-issue limited comic series.  Any money donated above the $1,000 will go towards funding the remaining issues of the series, printing costs, etc. If this campaign is successful enough to go beyond funding the entire comic series, any additional funds will go back into the Arise franchise. The next step for the Arise franchise is to complete the Arise video game which will be ported to Xbox live, iPhones/iPads/iPods, and Android devices. Action figures will follow.  An Arise animated series is also in the works.  One of the last steps for the Arise franchise will be the creation of a full feature length live-action motion picture.  This will take a minimum budget of $250,000 to fund, over-and-above the costs of funding the comics and other aspects of the Arise IP.

What are the rewards for the campaign?  *Make sure you let me know which item(s) you want specifically for the rewards that have more than one option!*

$8: A physical copy of issue 1, 2, or 3 of the Arise comic and a digital download of one of the issues of the Arise comic (your choice from issues 1 - 3).  Each physical issue has an "A" cover and a "B" cover.  THERE WILL ONLY BE 1,000 COPIES OF EACH "A" COVER AVAILABLE.

$15: A digital download of one of the issues of Arise (your choice from issues 1 - 3) and the entire album of industrial/metal band Skrog's The Global Elite in mp3 form, featuring the song "Dark Metamorphosis," used in the Arise short film.

$20: A mouse pad with gel arm rest featuring the alternate cover of Arise issue 3.

$25: An Arise poster.  20"x30."  Choose from 7 different images (see below).

$35: A T-shirt featuring artwork from the Arise franchise.

$50: The motherload 1! A physical copy of all three issues of the Arise comic ("B" covers only), a digital download of all three issues of the Arise comic, a digital download of the entire album of industrial/metal band Skrog's The Global Elite in mp3 format, and a T-shirt featuring artwork from the Arise franchise.

$65: A hoodie featuring the artwork from the Arise franchise.

$75: The motherload 2! A physical copy of all three issues of the Arise comic ("B" covers only), a digital download of all three issues of the Arise comic, a digital download of the entire album of industrial/metal band Skrog's The Global Elite in mp3 format, and a hoodie featuring the artwork from the  Arise franchise.

$85: An Arise dartboard featuring the alternate cover of issue 3. Throw darts at zombies!!

$90: A skateboard featuring the artwork of the alternate cover of issue 3 of the Arise comic, autographed by Jay Reiter.  THERE WILL ONLY BE 50 OF THE SKATEBOARDS AVAILABLE.

$100: The mega motherload! A physical copy of all three issues of the Arise comic ("B" covers only), a digital download of all three issues of the Arise comic, a digital download of the entire album of industrial/metal band Skrog's The Global Elite in mp3 format, and a hoodie and a T-shirt featuring the artwork from the  Arise franchise.

$150: A physical copy of issue 1 of the Arise comic with cover "A" autographed by Vince Locke and Jay Reiter, a physical copy of all three issues of the Arise comic (cover "B") autographed by Jay Reiter, a digital download of all three of the issues of Arise, and a digital download of the entire album of industrial/metal band Skrog's The Global Elite in mp3 format.  THERE ARE 7 OF THESE AVAILABLE OUT OF THE 10 IN EXISTENCE.  EACH ONE WILL COME WITH A CERTIFICATE OF AUTHENTICITY FROM SATYRN STUDIOS.  THESE WILL BE THE ONLY COPIES OF ISSUE 1 COVER "A" EVER OFFERED THROUGH SATYRN STUDIOS AUTOGRAPHED BY BOTH VINCE LOCKE AND JAY REITER.

$200: An original 11x17 page from issue 2 autographed by artist James Whynot.  THERE ARE ONLY 5 AVAILABLE.

$300: The original 11x17 cover for issue 2 or 3 autographed by artist James Whynot.  THERE ARE ONLY 1 OF EACH AVAILABLE.


All perk levels include shipping costs to the lower 48 states in the USA.

I WILL SHIP OUTSIDE OF THE US.  AN ADDITIONAL SHIPPING FEE WILL BE ASSESSED TO ANY FOREIGN REWARDS DONORS AFTER THE CAMPAIGN'S END.  THE FEE WILL BE ACTUAL SHIPPING COSTS AND PAYABLE TO ME ONLY VIA PAYPAL.

THE COMICS

SKROG'S The Global Elite

Preview the album on Spotify:

https://play.spotify.com/album/0wCF3nC6NYO26GZk3gtpiI

POSTERS

HOODIES *Actual appearance may vary slightly*

story:
Gimme the Deets!

Hi!

I'm Matt Cummings, an illustrator from Nova Scotia, Canada. Over the past few years, I've written and drawn a comic series called Bluenose, which you can find over at http://www.bluenosecomic.ca 

Last year, I created my first ever mini-comic, starring the Bluenose cast. It was a labour of love and turned out really great! This year, I'd like to take it to the next level, with a collection of 3 new stories which continue where the first left off. In addition, the entire first mini-comic story will be included, making this the graphic novel of mini-comics! :0

A whopping 60 pages of comics is planned and ready to be brought to life. And that's not all! I have ambitions here, and they don't stop at comics alone! There will be pin-ups, illustrations, fanart, and A TABLE OF CONTENTS! Whoa!

It promises to be the cutest book on your shelf.

This campaign will also serve as my gateway to the Toronto Comic Arts Festival in May! It's a gathering of some of the friendliest folks in the art and comics worlds and, after attending last year, one of the places I'd most like to revist. I'll be bringing my books with me to give to folks so if you buy one here, tell me and I'll give it to you in  p e r s o n !

 

What I Need And What You Get!

The $1300 I need will go to a few key things! Simply put, book-making costs (from lulu.com!), shipping materials/costs (built into the price of your donations!) and travel/accomodations for TCAF!

After checking all the fancy options around, my comics friends have directed me to lulu.com for my book-making needs. They have the best balance of quality supplies and print detail to costs. The book will be perfect bound in A5 size and should tuck handsomely into any and all book shelves, coat pockets and rolled up pant cuffs.

For the initial run of the book, I'll making 70 books minimum. To cover this, it'll be $300-$400, roughly (depending on final page count). If I end up getting more donations than expected, the number of books goes up, up, up!!

Travel to and from TCAF will be $390 (THANK GOODNESS FOR flyporter.com!!) and hotel costs will be $450 for the weekend.

The last bit is to cover IndieGoGo's fees~ (:

 

And you get? OHO! Well, a book for starters, if you donate $25 and above!

There are digital copies, physical copies, a chance to be DRAWN INTO THE BOOK and locally-sourced postcards from me with drawings and a lovely li'l message on them about how great you are. Check out the side-bar for a complete breakdown!

To Me, This Is The Pinacle of A Good Thing

Learning how to make a book was one of the hardest, most rewarding experiences of my artistic life. It was something I did for myself as much as for the many folks who (to my great delight) were so enthusiastic about helping me see it through.

The cycle of helping each other make cool, new works to share our stories is one of my absolute favourite things and I hope you'll all come along for this ride with me!

Can't Donate? No Worries!

If you can spread the word, I would really appreciate it! Tell all your comics-lovin' pals~ I'M HERE TO GIVE YOU CUTE THINGS. TAKE MY CUTE THINGS!

What I Need And What You Get!
The $1300 I need will go to a few key things! Simply put, book-making costs (from lulu.com!), shipping materials/costs (built into the price of your donations!) and travel/accomodations for TCAF!
After checking all the fancy options around, my comics friends have directed me to lulu.com for my book-making needs. They have the best balance of quality supplies and print detail to costs. The book will be perfect bound in A5 size and should tuck handsomely into any and all book shelves, coat pockets and rolled up pant cuffs.
For the initial run of the book, I'll making 70 books minimum. To cover this, it'll be $300-$400, roughly (depending on final page count). If I end up getting more donations than expected, the number of books goes up, up, up!!
Travel to and from TCAF will be $390 (THANK GOODNESS FOR flyporter.com!!) and hotel costs will be $450 for the weekend.
The last bit is to cover IndieGoGo's fees~ (:
 
And you get? OHO! Well, a book for starters, if you donate $25 and above!
There are digital copies, physical copies, a chance to be DRAWN INTO THE BOOK and locally-sourced postcards from me with drawings and a lovely li'l message on them about how great you are. Check out the side-bar for a complete breakdown!



To Me, This Is The Pinacle of A Good Thing
Learning how to make a book was one of the hardest, most rewarding experiences of my artistic life. It was something I did for myself as much as for the many folks who (to my great delight) were so enthusiastic about helping me see it through.
The cycle of helping each other make cool, new works to share our stories is one of my absolute favourite things and I hope you'll all come along for this ride with me!


Can't Donate? No Worries!
If you can spread the word, I would really appreciate it! Tell all your comics-lovin' pals~ I'M HERE TO GIVE YOU CUTE THINGS. TAKE MY CUTE THINGS!

story:
Page 1 From "The Lowlife."

"The world we be knowin' now were no' always thus.

Oh nah-na, it was once green 'n golden. Rich 'n pretty it was. The majik n' the techno-junk worked arm 'n arm. The collared, point-eared elves ain't have no collars back then I tell ya. All of 'em was free as the carrion muckers as pick bones in the sands t'day! In fact, if tale be true, weren't none o' the races as wore slaver's collars. Not elves, orks, men, nor fae. Was s'posed t' be a paradise.

Paradise? Sounds a little borin'  though ifin ya askin' me..."

Page 2 from "The Lowlife."

"...Anyways, tales say somethin' happened, though it ain't to clear as ta what. Somethin' big as to set this world to the flame. Took all o' that as had color, n' turnt it to grey. Burned it till there weren't much left but the bones. N' us that be left, we 'r just suckin' out the marrow.

Mayhap it was the men as fired too many shots inta the Fae Folk's magik apples that started the world burnin'. Or, mayhap it was the Fae Folk as dropped a conjured ball o' flame inta Man's ammo dump. Even coulda been one o' the suns got too close n' wiped the place clean. Ain't no real writin's or teachin's fer the how. Jus' rumors n' whispers really. N' them that tell always be addin' they own spin on it."

Page 3 from "The Lowlife."

"None o' that as  past matter much now though. In fact, the Now, is about all that most even' can be worried 'bout ifin ya get my meanin'. Cause, Now, well, that ain't pretty...

Now is all warlords n' wanderers. Now is all dregs bein' drug. Now is all findin' n' keepin'! Takin' n' bein' tooken'! Wild majik, broken tech, starvation, slaver's collars, monsters both untamed n' unnamed in the wasted lands..."

Excerpt from  "A Useless History,"  by Nobody.

Page 4 from "The Lowlife."

Possible Cover for Issue 1.

 

 

Why a Reboot?

There are many reasons I decided to reboot this story. If I gave them all at once, this simple explanation would possibly become a full novel, so I will give you a few of the reasons at the forefront.

First, somewhere along the way in the originals, I lost sight of what I wanted to do with the main characters. Those characters being Ra'ek (The Lowlife) and Nis'si. Though they were the backbone of the story, I was spending more time developing supporting characters just to move the pair's plot line along. As I worked on the script for the third issue, I began to realize that I was creating even MORE characters to move the story forward, I decided it was time to take a step back and reconsider the direction I was going as my main characters had no personalities of their own.

Secondly, Ewelina's artistic ability, though always fantastic, had grown astronomically since we started and I began to feel she had actually found her style for The Lowlife and as such, I felt again, that a reboot would help keep everything consistent, both in the art and the storytelling.

Process Shots.

The last reason I will list is that my personal storytelling in the medium of comics has improved right along with Ewelina's art. My ability to edit and plot a comic story, though far from perfect, has gotten much better and more concise.
 
If you are wondering if you will still see some of your favorite supporting characters, well, the answer is that you most likely will. It may be later in the series, or a totally different type of role as we have decided to keep the story focused on the original direction, but they will be there. 
 
The Lowlife is for MATURE Readers as it contains violence, nudity, language and sexual content.
 
Design of the character the "bad guys" call MaMa.
 

Reward Samples:

Below you will find some samples of just a few of the awesome rewards and types of rewards avialable!

Sample Color commission from Ewelina.

Sample Speed Painting Video from Ewelina

Bust of the original Ra'ek, drawn for the last time by Buz, Ken and Blair from the comic series "The Living Corpse." www.Corpse-Crew.net

Cameo and likeness sketch sample. Character based on Grace Liner/@linerdesign on Instagram.

What We Need:

All of the funds contributed go toward the production of the comic.  To be 100% clear, this is the cost of having Ewelina do the art. This includes all pencils, inks, colors and lettering. All of the additional costs go toward Indiegogo's fees and shipping of any of the physical rewards.

Short video of Ewelina working on Page 4.

Why Digital Only?

I would love nothing more than to bring physical copies of this book to the masses. However, my goal is to initially raise the funds to pay the artist, (Ewelina Mroczkowska,) to do the work. She does love working on Lowlife, but for her to be able to take the time needed to do a full comic, she has to prioritize it at the top of her list. As she is a full time artist, in order for her to do that, she has to get paid for her work. This is why we start with digital and IF we crush the initial goal, who knows, there may be some printed copies in everyone's future!

So help us get there! Spread the word, tell your friends, family and heck, even folks you meet on the street! 

Thank you all so much for checking it out! Every bit of your support so far means the world to us!

Search @LowlifeComic on FB and @olddogdigital on IG to keep up to date and share, share, share!!!

The Crew:

Kenny Groom is the co-creator and writer of "Upstarts," published by Ink Forged Studios. He is also the founder his own comic studio “Old Dog Digital,” under which he publishes "The Lowlife.” The Lowlife spin off story "Broken," which Kenny wrote and was drawn by Jose Jaro, also was published under ODD. He recently worked with Swedish Filmmaker Rasmus Tirzitis, on a comic called "Legacy of Darkness," which was a continuation of the Star Wars fan film, "Threads of Destiny."

Kenny has spent many years learning how to write comics and tell wonderful stories and will continue to write until the day he fades away.

Ewelina Mroczkowska is an accomplished freelance artist who has done the illustrations on titles such as; "Legends of Steragos: Damsels of Distress" by Kevin M. Scott and "Princess Lucinda: Book One: Black Rose of the Empire" by Malcolm Harris. Recently, she worked with Kenny and Swedish Filmmaker Rasmus Tirzitis on the comic "Legacy of Darkness," which is the continuation of the Star Wars fan Film, "Threads of Destiny." She is also the lead character designer, co-creator and artist for “ The Lowlife," and she did the colors on "Broken," which was penciled and inked by Jose Jaro.

Jason Humm has enjoyed a public-sector career focused on writing and editing. His self-published, autobiographical book of poetry, Dodged, sheds light on depression and thoughts of suicide. This will be Jason's third time working on comics and has found that he loves the medium.

Stretch Goals:

  • 1st: $2500 - We complete issue two which everyone gets!
  • 2nd $3500 - ???
  • 3rd $4000 - ???

Some of you may be wondering about our stretch goals. In truth, we just want to hit goal first. We are only thinking about getting the books finished and in your hands as of right now, but rest assured, once we hit that first goal of $1100 dollars, we will be pushing for much more. Hopefully leading up to a full Graphic Novel - Printed - Signed and shipped directly to everyone who helps us get there!

Like I said, we have to get there first!

Thank you all! For everything!

story:
UPDATE: I managed to cover half of the costs thanks to your support via Indiegogo, Paypal and bank transfer. There's still time, so if you want to support the project, you can also do so by buying its merchandise: https://www.etsy.com/nl/shop/Pupavegan 



NEW: A set of 5 different postcards designed by me for all people who get the physical book pack!

For almost 4 years...

I've provided thousands of people with a daily/weekly portion of free vegan comics and art, which I was created in my free time, for people of all ages. VEGAN ARTBOOK was a huge success, with its Facebook page gathering almost 10,000 followers in no time, resulting in over 1100 people going vegan/vegetarian because of my art. Non-profit physical books were produced shortly after, self-published by me. People only paid the printing costs and I often gave away copies for free to potentional vegans/vegetarians. I struggled a lot with the bills from the printer, but I always made it somehow. Until now, that is.

I can't financially hold up my vegan art project anymore.

So far I've published 4 books and am currently working on the 5th one. I would like to continue doing this, since many of you seem to enjoy my art and because it inspires people to start living a non-violent life. But sadly I am struggling with exposure and I can't keep this up financially anymore. If you like what I do, and think that my work should keep existing, please consider helping me cover the production costs of this project. You will have my deepest gratitude for your support and will receive many nice perks in return like copies of the books, yummy vegan snacks, postcards, t-shirts, porcelain vegan plates with my art and many other neat stuff. This campaign is international, so it doesn't matter where you live.

If I can't financially cover these production costs, I will be forced to end this project and go into debt restructuring. This crowdfunding campaign is my last resort to save Vegan Artbook. Please spread it far and wide if you want to help save it. I know I've made a mistake by trying to take all this on myself. If this campaign is succesful, I will continue to draw and produce free comics for all of you.

Please keep in mind dat the crowdfunding amount is slightly higher than the actual amount I need, because I need to pay VAT, Paypal transaction costs and Indiegogo costs. Since the book is already produced, I can send out perks right after the campaign ends, so there is no waiting time on receiving your perks. I ship worldwide.

LINKS TO MY PAGES

  • My new webshop: http://www.pupavegan.nl/
  • My Etsy shop: https://www.etsy.com/nl/shop/Pupavegan?ref=hdr_shop_menu
  • My website: http://www.veganartbook.com/
  • My Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pupavegan
  • DeviantArt: http://pupavegan.deviantart.com/

story:
We're Hitting A Growth Spurt!

Alterna turns 13 this year, so it's only fitting that we've hit a growth spurt.

In 2016, Alterna turned ten years old and it was a good year.  2017 saw the debut of our $1.50 newsprint single issue line and quickly became our biggest year ever.  2018 came along and smashed 2017 to bits.

Now 2019 is on pace to become our best year ever.

All thanks to our wonderful readers and the supportive retailers that have helped us to bring back newsprint and affordable comics in a big way!

We have almost 30 titles in our newsprint line and almost 100 issues. Many of our comics have gone back to print two or three times as we're trying to keep all issues in stock as much as we can. As a result of all of this growth, our humble storage space is "shrinking" and we need to move to a bigger and better space.

 

We've Got Some BIG Things Planned!

Increasing the size of our storage space will allow us to do a few things:

  • Larger initial print runs. We can't sell what we don't have, but with a bigger storage space, we'll be able to keep more issues in stock.
  • Order shipping supplies in bulk. This will allow us to save money in the long run.
  • Upgrading to a state of the art facility. The new facility will also have an indoor loading dock and we'll be able to receive shipments in any kind of weather. 
  • Hire Part-Time help. With more room to work, the right set-up, and better organization, we'll be able to hire part-timers to help receive shipments, sort and pack orders, and more as we continue to grow.
  • Allow us to take the necessary steps to eventually launch Alterna Distribution. We've had this planned for a few years now! The first part of the process would be to get a bigger storage space so we can warehouse issues and eventually sell and distribute to readers and retailers.

 

Here's How You Can Help!

We've got 6 perk levels for readers and 1 perk level strictly for comic shop retailers that want to have our books in hand for Free Comic Book Day (May 4th). 

For AlternaWeen, people loved being able to donate our comics to kids for Halloween and many readers also donated comics to schools, children's hospitals, the troops, comic shops, libraries, and more. So we'd like to continue this tradition for FCBD. Each box is a random assortment of comics and will come with multiple copies of each issue so that you can donate any extras.

Comic shop retailers, if you'd like to have our comics in time for this year's Free Comic Book Day, we have one specialized perk level for you which features 50 of our all ages comics at a deep discount. If you select this perk level, we guarantee that you'll receive the comics in time for the event.

By contributing to this campaign, you'll also help us to speed up the transition from one storage center to the other. The less we have to bring over, the better! 

 

 

Other Ways To Support!

If you're interested in supporting Alterna in other ways, please feel free to visit ORDERALTERNA.com where we've got merchandise, comics, graphic novels, and more!

Spreading the word on social media also helps a ton. Thanks!

story:
On the Internets, I go by Shade. I'm an independent comic writer and artist and have been working on a professional basis for 16 years.

SuperHeroes After Dark 2: Nightfall (SHAD2) is the sequel to my successful erotic anthology comic originally launched in late 2016, SuperHeroes After Dark: Extreme.

As of right now, the base page counts for SHAD2 and its accompanying b+w sketchbook will each be 20 pages but those page counts will be expanded upon based on a series of stretch goals.

As of right now, over 45 pages for the main comic are already completed, along with 10 pages for the b+w sketchbook, so I feel very confident that I can begin shipping physical copies of the comic and associated rewards in time for the 2018 holiday season.

Barring any unforeseen complications, digital rewards will ship shortly after the campaign ends.

story:
Hi everyone! Welcome to my Indigogo to get my art printed in two brand new art books! I've already had a successful Kickstarter campaign and the production on the books have started. But I wanted to give everyone who missed the kickstarter a chance to preorder my books! That's why this Indigogo page was created. The books are already at the printers, so you can know when you back this project you'll get your reward!

For those of you who don't know who I am, I'm Chad Hardin. I'm mostly known for being the artist for DC's Harley Quinn comic with Jimmy Palmiotti and Amanda Conner. I've also done Wonder Woman, Dragon Age, Spider Man, Stan Lee's The Traveler, Warlord, and many more over my twenty year career as comic illustrator.  While I'm not drawing comic panels, I'm a Professor of Art at Utah Valley University teaching the next generation of comic artists.   

 

 The books will be hardcover containing 60 pages each and will measure 8.5 x 11 inches with a matte cover with foil stamping. The books will be the best quality possible with glossy interior paper.

Risks & Challenges

We have already raised the funding we need to print the books, so any funds raised through Indigogo will be extra and allow us to possibly create extra rewards for backers. This is my first real campaign, but I'm working with my good friend and business partner, Jemma M. Young who has done three kickstarters and fulfilled all of them. The art is complete and books are designed, right now we are just waiting on the printer. We have a great team behind us to help us get the books printed, fulfilled, and shipped out to backers in a timely manner.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute but want to help? Feel free to share the campaign with your friends~! Thanks for checking out the campaign!
